mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. Although it is difficult to say how much the virus affected Tanzania, we know that it didn't go away.

en: When a new COVID-19 wave reemerged in January, many Tanzanians shared testimonies on social media of becoming ill with COVID-19-like symptoms.
swa: Mlipuko mpya wa Korona ulipotokea Januari, wa-Tanzania wengi walizungumzia shuhuda zao kwenye mitandao ya kijamii wakisimulia vile walivyougua ugonjwa wenye dalili kama Korona.
mt0: When the new coronavirus outbreak started in January, many Tanzanians shared their experiences on social media telling how they had contracted the disease with symptoms like the coronavirus.

en: Knowing that it could be punishable to discuss COVID-19, people wrote nimonia mpya or the new pneumonia and breathing problems.

en: But Magufuli doubled down with his anti-vaccination stance in a speech from his home in Chato, on January 27:
swa: Lakini Magufuli aliendea na msimamo wake wa kupinga chanjo katika hotuba  aliyoitoa nyumbani kwake Chato, mnamo Januari 27:
mt0: But Magufuli continued his position of opposition to vaccines in his speech at his home on January 27:

en: If the white man was able to come up with vaccinations, he should now have found a vaccination against AIDS; he would now have found a vaccination against tuberculosis; he would now have found a vaccination against malaria; he would now have found a vaccination against cancer.
swa: Kama mzungu anaweza kuja na chanjo, basi angeshagundua chanjo ya UKIMWI; angeshagundua chanzo cha kifua kikuu; na sasa hivi angeshajua chanjo ya malaria; angeshapata chanjo ya kansa.
mt0: If a European could bring a vaccine, he would have discovered the cause of AIDS; he would have discovered the cause of tuberculosis; and now he knew the vaccine for malaria; he would have found the vaccine for cancer.

en: This was a major departure from Magufuli's predecessor, President Jakaya Kikwete, who served as global ambassador for immunization in early 2016.
swa: Kauli hii inaweza kuchukuliwa kama kumrudisha nyuma mtangulizi wa Magufuli, Rais Jakaya Kikwete, aliyewahi kuhudumu kama balozi wa dunia kwa kinga mwanzoni mwa 2016.
mt0: This can be taken as a reminder of the predecessor of Magufuli, President Jakaya Kikwete, who served as the Ambassador of the United Nations for a brief period in early 2016.

en: Last month, Magufuli finally did admit that his country had a coronavirus problem, urging Tanzanians to wear locally made face masks.
swa: Mwezi uliopita, Magufuli hatimaye alikiri kwamba nchi yake ina tatizo la korona, akiwasihi wa-Tanzania kuvaa barakoa walizotengeneza wenyewe.
mt0: Last month, Magufuli finally admitted that his country had a coronavirus problem, asking Tanzanians to wear their own rubber gloves.

en: It took the death of Zanzibars Vice President Seif Sharif Hamad, apparently, to break Magufulis intransigence.
swa: Wadadisi wa mambo wanasema hatua hii ya Magufuli kubadili mtazamo kuhusu korona ilichangiwa na kifo cha Makamu wa Zanzibar  Seif Sharif Hamad.
mt0: Experts say this decision by Magufuli to change his view on coronavirus was inspired by the death of Zanzibar's Deputy Prime Minister Seif Sharif Hamad.

en: Several high-ranking officials from the political elite and close to Magufuli have also died of the disease.

mt0: After the death of Magufuli, journalist Elsie Eyakuze went public with a speech on social media to talk about the life of Tanzanians during the coronavirus pandemic, when the president appeared to have avoided the virus deliberately.

en: In an open letter to Magufuli, Eyakuze points out the inconsistency of Magufuli's ideas, but also applies the empathy Magufuli himself seemed to lack, at times  and forgives him.

en: Tanzanians are coming to terms with the complexity and gravity of Magufulis death and the legacy he left behind  with a close eye on the future.

en: That's the fundamental question posed by activist and writer Jillian C. York in her upcoming book Silicon Values,* set for release on March 23, 2021.
swa: Hili ndilo swali muhimu linaloulizwa na mwanaharakati na mwandishi Jillian C. York kwenye kitabu chake kijacho Silicon Values,* kinachotarajiwa kuzinduliwa mnamo Machi 23, 2021.
mt0: This is the key question asked by activist and author Jillian C. York in her new book Silicon Values,* which is due to be published on March 23, 2021.

en: On Wednesday, February 10 at 2:00pm GMT, Jillian will join Global Voices executive director Ivan Sigal for a live video conversation about the book, which, as she notes in the preface, seeks to encapsulate the history of how Silicon Valleys major communications platforms created a system apartspecifically, a system that governs how we can express ourselves online.
swa: Mnamo Jumatano, Februari 10 saa 2:00mchana GMT, Jillian ataungana na mkurugenzi mtendaji wa Global Voices Ivan Sigal kwa mazungumzo mubashara ya video kuhusu kitabu chake, ambacho, kama anavyoeleza kwenye dibaji, tunatafuta kuchimbua historia ya namna majukwaa makubwa ya mawasiliano ya Silicon Valley yalivyotengeneza mfumo wake wa kipekeehususani, mfumo ambao unatawala namna tunavyoweza kujieleza mtandaoni.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know On Thursday, February 10 at 2:00pm GMT, Jillian will meet with Global Voices' executive director Ivan Sigal for a live video conversation about her book, which, as she explains in the introduction, we want to explore the history of how the Silicon Valley communications giant created their unique system, particularly, the system that controls how we communicate online.

en: Jillian, who is the Director of International Freedom of Expression at the Electronic Frontier Foundation, is also a long-standing member of Global Voices, where she cut her teeth writing about digital rights and freedom of expression in the context of the Middle East.
swa: Jillian, ambaye ni Mkurugenzi wa Uhuru wa Kujieleza wa Kimataifa katika shirika la Electronic Frontier Foundation, na ni mwanachama maarufu wa siku nyingi wa Global Voices, ambako anapambana kuandika kuhusu uhuru wa kidijitali na uhuru wa kujieleza katika mukhtadha wa Mashariki ya Kati.
mt0: Jillian, who is the International Director of Freedom of Expression at the Electronic Frontier Foundation, and a frequent member of Global Voices, where she fights to write about digital freedom and freedom of expression in the Middle East.

en: The novel coronavirus was first reported in Tanzania in mid-March 2020.
swa: Kirusi cha kwanza cha Korona kiliripotiwa nchini Tanzania katikati ya mwezi Machi, 2020.

en: But, after recording up to 509 cases and 21 deaths in late April, the nation announced its status as coronavirus-free in June.
swa: Hata hivyo, baada ya takwimu kuendelea kupanda na kufikia wagonjwa 509 na vifo 21 mwishoni mwa mwezi Aprili, serikali ya Tanzania ilitangaza kuwa hakuna hata mgonjwa mmoja wa UVIKO-19 mwezi Juni.
mt0: But after the numbers continued to rise and reached 509 and 21 deaths at the end of April, Tanzania announced that it had no cases of COVID-19 in June.

en: That same month, Kassim Majaliwa, the countrys prime minister, told parliament there are only 66 active coronavirus cases in the country, but did not provide further details.
swa: Mwezi huo huo, Kassim Majaliwa, Waziri mkuu wa nchi hiyo, aliliambia bunge kwamba kulikuwa na wagonjwa 66 tu  nchini kote, lakini hakutoa ufafanuzi zaidi.
mt0: In the same month, Kassim Majaliwa, the Prime Minister of the country, told the parliament that there were only 66 cases across the country, but he didn't give any more details.

en: Since then, government has been silent on the coronavirus with a strong politic of denial and no data released to the public on infections or deaths.
swa: Tangu wakati huo, serikali imekuwa kimya kuhusiana na virusi vya Korona huku matamko makali ya kisiasa kukanusha uwepo wa virusi hivyo yakiendelea kutolewa bila kuambatana na takwimu zozote za wagonjwa wala vifo.
mt0: Since then, the government has been silent on the coronavirus issue, while political statements repeatedly denying the presence of the virus have continued to be issued without any evidence of cases or deaths.

en: Today, most activities continue business-as-usual, including Tanzania's tourism industry, attracting thousands of visitors to its airports with few public health protocols in place.
swa: Leo, shughuli nyingi zinaendelea kama kawaida, ikiwa ni pamoja na sekta ya utalii nchini Tanzania, inayovutia maelfu ya wageni kuingia nchini humo kupitia viwanja vya ndege visivyo na utaratibu wa kufanya ukaguzi wa kutosha.
mt0: Today, many activities are going on as usual, including the Tanzanian tourism sector, which attracts thousands of visitors through airports without proper screening.

en: The airport in Zanzibar received the lowest 2-star rating on COVID-19 health and safety measures by Skytrax COVID-19 Airport Safety Rating, the worlds only assessment and certification of airport health and safety measures during the pandemic.

en: On January 24, the Catholic Archdiocese of Arusha issued a letter warning congregants of the existence of COVID-19 in Tanzania, and urged members to follow all necessary public health measures to prevent the spread of the virus in churches.

en: While Tanzanias recorded cases are moderate compared to other countries, the governments silence about COVID-19 data raised grave concerns among public health experts and human rights activists, who are forbidden from speaking or talking about COVID-19 in digital spaces.

Although records show that Tanzania has fewer cases compared to other countries, the silence of the government on the numbers of COVID-19 has caused concern among experts and human rights activists, who have been barred from speaking and talking about the virus on social media.

en: Just before the elections, Tanzanians experienced an internet shutdown with access denied to all the major social media platforms including Instagram, WhatsApp and Twitter.
swa: Kabla ya uchaguzi huo, Watanzania walishangazwa na kuzimwa kwa mitandao ambapo majukwaa yote makubwa ya mitandao ya kijamii ikiwa ni pamoja na Instagram, WhatsApp na Twitter yalifungwa yasipatikane.

en: Over the last five years, the Magufuli administration has narrowed democratic and civic spaces and has cracked down hard on freedom of expression and access to information in digital spaces.
swa: Kwa zaidi ya miaka mitano, utawala wa Magufuli umebana mno uhuru wa demokrasia na shughuli za kiraia sambamba na kuminya uhuru wa kujieleza na haki ya kupata taarifa kwenye majukwaa ya kidijitali.
mt0: For more than five years, the government of Magufuli has significantly restricted democracy and civil rights, while also limiting freedom of speech and the right to information on digital platforms.

en: With the governments strong denial stance, Tanzanians are not allowed to release any COVID-19 data that the government has not verified, which means that ordinary citizens as well as journalists and medical professionals are barred from commenting on COVID-19 in digital spaces, or accessing information.
swa: Kufuatia msimamo mkali wa serikali kukana uwepo wa UVIKO-19, Watanzania hawaruhusiwi kutoa takwimu zozote za UVIKO-19 ambazo serikali haijazihakiki, hii ikiwa na maana kwamba wananchi wa kawaida ikiwa ni pamoja na waandishi wa habari na wataalam wa afya wanazuiwa kutoa maoni kuhusu UVIKO-19 kwenye majukwaa ya kidijitali au kupata taarifa muhimu.

en: Access to COVID-19 information has become an elite privilege, according to one doctor from the national hospital who spoke to Global Voices on the condition of anonymity, fearing reprisal.

en: Unlike other countries with established COVID-19 information response teams who give daily updates on COVID-19, Tanzania simply offers a website with limited and outdated COVID-19 information.

en: The denial has been so convincing that its now widely accepted by Tanzanians, including medical experts, who disregard basic safety measures like wearing face masks and social distancing.

en: Global Voices visited major hospitals such Muhimbili, the government referral hospital in Dar es Salaam, the cultural capital, as well as Benjamin Mkapa Hospital in Dodoma, the political capital, and witnessed very few measures taken to stop the spread of the coronavirus disease.
swa: Global Voices ilitembelea hospitali kadhaa ikiwemo Muhimbili, hospitali ya rufaa ya serikali iliyoko jijini Dar es Salaam, mji mkuu wa kiutamaduni nchini humo, pamoja na Hospitali ya  Benjamin Mkapa jijini Dodoma, mji mkuu wa kisiasa, na kushuhudia tahadhari chache zikichukuliwa kukabiliana na kuenea kwa virusi vya ugonjwa wa korona.

en: People are allowed to enter hospital premises without wearing masks, there are few working hygiene and washing facilities and those that do exist lack water or are broken, which was witnessed, for example, in the pregnant mothers clinic at Muhimbili.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. People are allowed to enter hospitals without wearing gloves, there are few sanitation equipment and hand sanitizers and those that are available are either broken or missing, as was the case, for example, in the female ward at Muhimbili.

en: While the Magufuli administration has shown little concern about the impact of the virus on everyday citizens, many government ministries and departments acknowledge that COVID-19 still exists.

mt0: While the government of Magufuli has not shown any concern about the impact of this virus on the daily life of the people, many of his ministers and departments recognize that the virus is present.

en: This article is part of a series of posts examining interference with digital rights under lockdowns and beyond during the COVID-19 pandemic in nine African countries: Uganda, Zimbabwe, Mozambique, Algeria, Nigeria, Namibia, Tunisia, Tanzania and Ethiopia.

en: The project is funded by the Africa Digital Rights Fund of The Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).

en: Today, Africa is currently the least impacted region in the world, with 1,293,048 confirmed COVID-19 cases so far and a remarkable 1,031,905 recoveries, according to the Africa CDCP.

en: Now, as African countries  led by the African Union   ease COVID-19 restrictions and prepare to reopen their economies and borders, many governments are employing innovative technologies.
swa: Sasa, kama nchi za Kiafrika  ikiongozwa na Umoja wa Afrika   wanalegeza vikwazo za COVID-19 na kujiandaa kufungua tena uchumi na mipaka yao, serikali nyingi wanatumia teknolojia bunifu.
mt0: Now, as African countries led by the African Union are relaxing the restrictions on COVID-19 and preparing to reopen their economies and borders, many governments are using innovative technology.

en: A need for a unified, pan-African technology that can track the spread and connect COVID-19 testing centers across the continent has led to the use of PanaBIOS, an African Union-backed biosurveillance technology.
swa: Utaji wa umoja, wa teknolojia ya Kiafrika inayoweza fuatilia usambaa na kukutanisha vituo ya kupima COVID-19 kote bara umepelekea utumizi wa PanaBIOS, teknolojia wa uangalizi wa kibiolojia unaoungwa mkono na Umoja wa Afrika.
mt0: The desire for a joint African technology that can track the spread and connect testing units across the continent has led to the use of PanaBIOS, a biometrics monitoring technology backed by the African Union.

en: PanaBIOS provides a mobile and web-based app that uses algorithms to track and trace persons facing potential health threats and track and keep records of test samples from their origin to in-country labs.
swa: PanaBIOS umetoa programu inayotegema rununu na wavuti na kutumia algorithimu kufuata watu walio hatarini kiafya na kuweka rekodi ya vipimo vya sampuli toka asili hadi maabara..
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: The technology was developed by Koldchain, a Kenyan startup, and funded by AfroChampions, a public-private partnership designed to galvanize African resources and institutions to support the emergence and success of the African private sector.
swa: Huu teknolojia umeundwa na Koldchain, taasisi chipukizi ya Kenya, na kufadhiliwa na AfroChampions, ushirikiano wa umma na binafsi uliobuniwa kuleta pamoja rasilimali ya Afrika na taasisi kusaidia ubuzi na mafanikio ya sekta binafsi Afrika.
mt0: This technology is developed by Koldchain, a Kenyan startup, and funded by AfroChampions, a public and private partnership created to bring together African resources and organizations to help beef and the achievement of African business success.

en: Ghana is currently the only African country using PanaBIOS technology as it reopens its borders.

mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Ghana is the only country in the world to use the PanaBIOS technology when it opens its borders.

en: PanaBIOS ensures that travelers are able to use test results from one country to satisfy port clearance requirements in another country through their personal PanaBios app or by adding a system-generated SMS/USSD passcode to another travel document.

en: Some African countries, such as Ghana, have triggered new legislation giving the president emergency powers to fight the pandemic by ordering telecom companies to provide it with personal customer details such as subscriber database, subscriber cell reference data, uncashed subscriber mobile money transfer data, mobile money merchant codes, and addresses.
swa: Nchi nyingine Afrika, kama Ghana yamebadili sheria kuipa rais mamlaka ya dharura kukabiliana na janga kwa kuamrisha kampuni ya mawasiliano ya simu kuipa maelezo ya kibinafsi ya wateja kama vile hifadhidata ya mteja, kumbukumbu ya simu ya mteja, data ya pesa uliohamishwa kutumia simu na haujatumika, misimbo ya wafanyabiashara wa miamala , na anwani.
mt0: Other African countries, such as Ghana, have changed the law to give the president emergency powers to deal with the crisis by requiring the phone company to provide customer information such as customer records, customer phone records, customer data, financial data transferred by phone and not used, business codes, and addresses.

en: To ensure data protection and privacy, all machine learning techniques used by PanaBIOS are on aggregated data.
swa: Kuhakiki ulinzi na ufaragha wa data, mbinu zote za masomo ya mashine inayotumiwa na PanaBIOS ziko katika data ya jumla.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. To ensure security and privacy of data, all the ways of learning a computer used by PanaBIOS are saved in the overall data.

en: That is  data gathered is summarized for statistical analysis  not personal data used to target individuals  unless its for contact tracing purposes, where it would be required to reach out to suspected or infected people.
swa: Hio ni  data iliokusanywa inahaririwa kwa ajili ya uchambuzi wa takwimu  sio data binafsi ya kulenga watu  isipokua kwa ajili ya kufuatilia mwasiliwa, ambapo itatakikana kufikia washukiwa ama waathiriwa.
mt0: This is data collected for analysis of data, not personal data aimed at individuals, but for tracking the suspect, where it is guaranteed to reach the suspect or victim.

en: To ensure the prevention of privacy infringement, the African Union, PanaBIOS, and its partners must propose how it will comply with various country-based data protection laws to protect privacy, ensure data consent and avoid data sharing for commercial use.
swa: Kuhakikisha uzuizi wa kuingilia ufaragha, Muungano wa Afrika, PanBIOS, na washirika wake lazima wapendekeze namna watakavyo zingatia sheria za ulinzi wa data za nchi tofauti tofauti kulinda ufaragha,hakikisha idhini ya data na kuepuka kushiriki data kibiashara.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. To ensure the blocking of intrusion, the African Union, PanBIOS, and partners must propose how they will apply the data protection laws of various countries to protect privacy, ensure data permission and avoid commercial data sharing.

en: The app currently does not have a privacy policy available to the public, in which it explains to users its data collection and sharing practices.
swa: Kwa sasa, huu pragramu-tumizi hauna sera ya faragha inayopatikana kwa umma, ambapo inaelezea watumiaji kanuni za kukusanya na kushiriki data.
mt0: Now, this app-use has no publicly available privacy policy, which explains users the rules for collecting and sharing data.

en: The challenge is how such data privacy policy will meet the various, continental, national, and regional data protection laws such as the African Unions Convention on Cybersecurity and Personal Data Protection, the Southern African Development Communitys (SADC) model law on data protection, Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Supplementary Act A/SA.1/01/10 on Personal Data Protection Within ECOWAS and the East African Communitys Framework for Cyberlaws.
swa: Changamoto ni jinsi huo sera faragha utatimiza malengo mbalimbali, kibara, kitaifa, na kikanda ya sheria za kulinda data kama vile ya Muungano wa Afrika Mkataba juu ya Usalama wa Mtandao na Ulinzi wa Takwimu za Kibinafsi,ya Jumuiya ya Maendeleo Kusini mwa Afrika (SADC) sheria kielezo juu ya ulinzi wa data, Jumuiya ya Kiuchumi ya Mataifa ya Afrika Magharibi (ECOWAS) Sheria ya nyongeza A / SA.1 / 01/10 juu ya Ulinzi wa Takwimu Binafsi Ndani ya ECOWAS na Jumuiya ya Afrika Mashariki Kiunzi cha Kanuni za mtandao.
mt0: The challenge is how this privacy policy will meet the various goals, national, regional, and international goals of data protection laws such as the United Nations Internet Security Treaty and the Protection of Personal Data, the South African Development Community (SADC) Privacy Regulations on Data Protection, the European Economic Community (ECOWAS) Additional A / SA.1 / 01/10 on the Protection of Personal Data within the ECOWAS and the South African Internet Rules.

en: Tech-based solutions contribute to Africas COVID-19 success
swa: Suluhu za kiteknolojia zimechangia ufanisi kukabiliana na COVID-19 Afrika
mt0: The technological advances have helped to reduce the impact of COVID-19 in Africa. If you can't translate it simply say you don't know.

en: In addition to PanaBIOS, various African nations have activated tech-based responses to the COVID-19 crisis to mitigate its spread.
swa: Pamoja na PanaBIOS, baadhi ya mataifa ya Afika wameamilisha itikio inayoegemea teknolojia kupambana na uenevu wa janga la COVID-19.
mt0: With PanaBIOS, some African countries have announced a technological initiative to fight the spread of COVID-19.

en: For example, scientists from Senegal developed a $1 COVID-19 test kit and 3D ventilators for patients.
swa: Kwa mfano, wanasayansi toka Sengali wametengeneza kifaa cha kupima COVID-19 inayogharimu $1 na Vipumuaji vya 3D ya wagonjwa.
mt0: For example, scientists from Singapore have developed a COVID-19 test kit that costs $1 and 3D ventilators for patients.

en: Wellvis, a Nigerian startup, created the COVID-19 Triage Tool, a free online tool to help users self-assess their coronavirus risk category based on their symptoms and their exposure history.
swa: Wellvis, taasisi chipukizi ya Nijeria, walibuni chombo cha kupima COVID-19 , chombo huru ya mtandao kusaidia watumizi kujipima kiwango cha hatari ya kuambukizwa virusi vya korona kulingana na dalili na historia ya kuwemo hatarini..
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Wellvis, a Nigerian startup, has developed a COVID-19 test tool, a free online tool that helps users assess their risk of contracting the virus based on symptoms and history of being in risk.

en: The South African government used Whatsapp to provide an interactive chatbot that can answer common queries about COVID-19 myths, symptoms, and treatment.
swa: Serikali ya Afrika Kusini ilitumia mtandao wa ujumbe mfupi Whatsapp kutoa mazungumuzo ya mwingiliano kujibu maswali ya kawaida kuhusu hadithi za uongo, dalili na tiba ya COVID-19.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know South Africa used the messaging service Whatsapp to answer common questions about lies, symptoms and treatment of COVID-19.

en: And in Uganda, market women used the Market Garden app to sell their goods from their homes through the app, and then motorcycle taxis deliver the goods to customers.
swa: Na Uganda,  wanawake wa soko walitumia programu-tumizi ya Soko Bustani kuuza bidhaa yao wakiwa nyumbani kutumia hii programu, kisha teksi ya pikipiki kumchukulia mnunuzi bidhaa.
mt0: In Uganda, women in the market used the app of the Garden Market to sell their products at home using this app, and a bicycle taxi took the buyer.

en: Africas successful control and management of the spread of COVID-19 has been attributed to its younger population, limited testing capacity and mortality tracking, and the possible presence of SARS-CoV-2 antibodies found in some Africans.
swa: Afrika kufanikiwa kudhibiti na kusimamia uenevu wa COVID-19 umehusishwa na  umma changa, uwezo kadiri wa kupima na kufuatilia waliofariki, na uwezekano wa kuwepo na  kingamwili za SARS-CoV-2  miongoni Waafrika wengine .
mt0: If you cannot translate, just say you don't know. Africa's success in controlling and managing the spread of COVID-19 is linked to a young population, a capacity to detect and track the deaths, and the possibility of a SARS-CoV-2 virus in other Africans.

en: However, it is clear that Africas tech-based innovations are a major contributing factor to its success in controlling COVID-19, in addition to decisive leadership early on in the pandemic.
swa: Lakini, ni bayana kwamba uvumbuzi zinazoegemea teknolojia zimechangia pakubwa kufanikisha uthibati wa COVID-19, pamoja na uongozi amuzi mwanzoni mwa janga.
mt0: But, it is clear that technological advances have contributed significantly to the successful treatment of COVID-19, along with leadership during the pandemic.

en: Solomon Zewdu, deputy doctor with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation summarized how, in January, even as many Western nations hesitated, Ethiopia began intensive screening at Addis Ababa airport.
swa: Solomon Zewdu, naibu daktari na shirika la Bill na Melinda  alifupisha jinsi, mnamo Januari, wakati mataifa mengi ya magharibi yakisita , Ethiopia ilianza kichujio kabambe uwanja wa ngege wa AddisAbaba.
mt0: Solomon Zewdu, a former chief medical officer for the Bill and Melinda Foundation, briefly explained how, in January, while many Western countries were still waiting , Ethiopia began a massive earthquake in Addis Ababa.

en: Rwanda became the first African nation to lock down on March 21, and many other African countries soon followed: South Africa implemented its comprehensive lockdown when it had only 400 cases and two fatalities.

en: Since September 22, news reports and social media posts circulating on the Chinese-speaking internet inaccurately claim that World Health Organization (WHO) Chief Scientist, Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, said Chinas COVID-19 vaccines have proved to have an effect.
swa: Tokea Septemba 22, taarifa za habari na machapisho ya mtandao ya kijamii inayoenea katika mitandao ya Kichina ilinukuu sivyo kuwa mwanasayansi mkuu wa Shirika la Afya Duniani (SAD), Dkt. Soumya Swaminathan, alisema chanjo za Uchina dhidi ya COVID-19 zimethibitishwa kuwa na athari.
mt0: Since September 22, Chinese media and social media reports have repeatedly reported that the head of the World Health Organization (WHO), Dr. Soumya Swaminathan, has said that China's COVID-19 vaccine has been confirmed to have a positive effect.

en: These reports and posts cite as a source a one-minute video produced by China Central Television for the Chinese video-sharing app Miaopai.
swa: Hizi ripoti na machapisho zinanukuu chanzo  video ya dakika inayotayarishwa na televisheni ya China kwa programu-tumizi ya kushiriki video China Miaopai.
mt0: These reports and publications quote the source video of the minute created by China's television for the video sharing program China Miaopai.

en: The video shows a speech by WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on the importance of the development of a COVID-19 vaccine, followed by remarks by Dr. Swaminathan.
swa: Huo video inaonyesha hotuba ya mkurugenzi mkuu wa SAD Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus akiongelea umuhimu wa kukuza chanjo ya UVIKO-19,ikifuatiliwa na matamshi ya Dkt.Swaminathan.
mt0: This video shows the speech of the chief executive of the SAD Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on the importance of developing vaccines against COVID-19, followed by Dr. Swaminathan's comments.

en: In the CCTV video, whose captions say WHO chief scientist: Chinese COVID-19 vaccines have proved to have an effect (), this is Swaminathan's speech:
swa: Katika video ya CCTV, ambayo maelezo yake mafupi yanasema Mwanasayansi mkuu wa WHO: Chanjo za China za UVIKO-19 zimehakiki kuwa na athari (), huu ni taarifa ya Swaminathan:
mt0: In a video of CCTV, which briefly says the WHO's chief scientist: China's COVID-19 vaccines have been confirmed to have had an impact (), this is Swaminathan's report:

en: As you know, they also have a very active vaccine development programme and several of their vaccine candidates are in advanced stages of clinical trial, so this is also of interest to us, so we're following those very closely.
swa: Kama mnavyofahamu,pia wanayo programu amilifu ya kukuza chanjo na baadhi ya chanjo yako hatua mbele katika majaribio ya kliniki, huu pia ni maslahi kwetu, tunaifuatilia kwa karibu.
mt0: If you don't know, they also have a stable program to promote vaccines and some of your vaccines are ahead of clinic trials, this is also our interest, we are closely monitoring it.

en: Some of their candidates actually prove to be successful in the clinical trials that are going on.
swa: Wengineo wa washirika wamethibitisha kufaidika kutokana na majaribio la kliniki yanayoendelea..
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: However, Dr. Swaminathan's original speech has been edited.
swa: Lakini, hotuba asili ya Dkt.Swaminathan umehaririwa.
mt0: But, the original speech of Dr. Swaminathan has been translated. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Her last sentence, in reality, began with the word if, and the video's background music makes it sound as if she's saying proved instead of prove.
swa: Sentensi yake ya mwisho, kwa uhakika, ulianza na neno ikiwa, na mziki wa mandharinyuma ulifanya utoke kana kwamba anasema ulithibitisha badala ya thibitisha.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Dr. Swaminathan's complete remarks are the following:
swa: Matamshi ya Dkt.Swaminathan kamili ni haya yafuatayo :
mt0: Dr. Swaminathan's full statement is as follows:

en: We've been engaged in discussions with China for the last several months because, as you know, they also have a very active vaccine development programme and several of their vaccine candidates are in advanced stages of clinical trial so this is also of interest to us so we're following those very closely.
swa: Tumehusika na mjadala na Uchina kwa miezi mingi iliyopita kwa sababu,mnavyojua, hao pia wanao programu amilifu ya kukuza chanjo na na chanjo zao mingi ziko hatua mbele ya majaribio ya kliniki, huu ni maslahi kwetu,kwa hivyo tunafuatilia kwa karibu.
mt0: We have been in talks with China for many months because, as you know, they also have a successful vaccination program and most of their vaccines are in the early stages of clinic trials, this is our interest, so we are following closely.

en: We've had very constructive and open discussions with them and they have always been reiterating their commitment to global access if some of their candidates actually prove to be successful in the clinical trials that are going on [emphasis added].
swa: Tumekuwa na mjadala wa kujenga na wazi nao na kila mara wamesisitiza kujitolea kwao kwa ufikavu kote duniani  ikiwa baadhi ya chanjo zao zimepita majaribio ya kliniki yanayoendelea [msisitizo umeongezwa].
mt0: We have had a constructive and open discussion with them and they have always insisted on their commitment to a global lack of vaccine coverage when some of their vaccines have passed a testing clinic [emphasis is added].

en: So I think the conversations are going on, it's still open and we're hopeful that more countries are going to join.
swa: Kwa hivyo nafikiria mazungumuzo yanayoendelea, bado ni wazi na tunatumania nchi mingi watajuinga.
mt0: I think that the negotiations going on are still open and we are confident that many countries will join.

en: The remarks were delivered at a WHO virtual press conference that took place on September 21.
swa: Haya matamshi yalitolewa katika mkutano wa wandishi si bayana ya SAD iliyofanyika mnamo Septemba 21.
mt0: This statement was made at the SAD's non-official press conference on September 21. If you cannot translate this statement simply say you don't know.

en: The conference aimed to present updates on the 18-billion-USD initiative by WHO and other organizations to deploy a future COVID-19 vaccine around the world.
swa: Hiyo kongamano ilinuia kuwasilisha sasisho kuhusu mpango uliogharimu dola bilioni 18 ya merikani ya WHO na mashirika mengine kupeleka chanjo cha UVIKO-19 hapo mbeleni kote duniani.
mt0: The conference was aimed at submitting a summary of the $ 18 billion WHO and other organizations' plan to deliver the COVID-19 vaccine worldwide.

en: So far, 156 countries have signed up for the program; neither China nor the U.S. is among them.

mt0: At present, 156 countries have signed up to this program; not China nor America.

en: Hundreds of Angolans took to the streets on September 12 in Luanda, Benguela, and in cities in 15 other provinces against police violence.
swa: Mamia ya Waangola waliingia mitaani kuandamana hapo Septemba 12 huko Luanda, Benguela na miji mingine 15 wakipinga ukatili wa polisi.
mt0: Many Angola went to the streets on September 12 in Luanda, Benguela and 15 other cities to protest against police brutality.

en: The demonstrations took place following the shock from the news that Silvio Dala, a 35-year-old doctor, lost his life on September 1 while in police custody.
swa: Maandamano hayo yalianza baada ya habari za kushtusha kutolewa kuhusu kifo cha daktari Silvio Dala, mwenye miaka 35, aliyepoteza maisha Septemba 1 akiwa chini ya uangalizi wa polisi.
mt0: The protests began after shocking reports of the death of the 35-year-old doctor Silvio Dala, who died on September 1 under police supervision.

en: According to the authorities, Dala left by car from the David Bernardino Paediatric Hospital in Luanda, where he worked as clinical director when he was stopped by police officers for not wearing a mask.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa za mamlaka, Dala aliondoka kwa gari yake kutoka hospitali ya  Watoto ya David Bernardino huko Luanda, ambapo ndiko hufanya kazi kama Mkurugenzi wa kliniki na alisimamishwa na polisi kwa sababu hakuvaa barakoa.
mt0: According to official reports, Dala left his car from the Children's Hospital David Bernardino in Luanda, where he works as the clinic manager, and was stopped by police because he didn't wear a hat.

en: The doctor was then taken to the Catotes police station, in the capital's Rocha Pinto neighbourhood, when he showed signs of fatigue and began to faint, having had a bad fall, which caused minor injuries to the head, the official police statement said.
swa: Daktari huyo alipelekwa katika kituo cha polisi cha Catotes katika mji jirani wa Rocha Pinto, na alipoonesha dalili za kuishiwa nguvu na kuanza kuzimia, alianguka vibaya na kugonga kichwa na kusababisha jeraha dogo kichwani mwake ilisema taarifa rasmi ya polisi.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: It also states that Dala died while officers were taking him to hospital.
swa: Pia ilisema kwamba Dala alifariki wakati maofisa wa polisi wakimpeleka hospitali.
mt0: It also said that Dala died while police officers took him to hospital.

en: The Union of Doctors contests this version.
swa: Chama cha Madaktari kiliipinga taarifa hiyo.

en: The organizations president, Adriano Manuel, told Voice of America (VOA) that there are contradictions in the authorities explanations which suggest that the doctor was subjected to physical abuse.

en: Editors note: This is a two-part analysis on Hachalu Hundessa, a popular Oromo musician whose murder incited ethnoreligious violence fueled by disinformation online.
swa: Dondoo ya Mhariri: Huu ni uchambuzi wenye sehemu mbili juu ya Hachalu Hundessa, mwanamuziki maarufu wa Oromo ambaye mauaji yake yaliamsha vurugu za itikadi za kidini na kikabila kwa sababu ya taarifa zisizo sahihi zilizotolewa katika mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: This is a two-part investigation into Hachalu Hundessa, a popular Oromo musician whose killing sparked religious and ethnic riots because of false information spread on social media.

en: Read Part II here.
swa: Soma Sehemu ya pili hapa
mt0: Read Part II here.

en: Iconic Ethiopian singer Hachalu Hundessa gained prominence for using his creative talent to raise the consciousness of the Oromo people.
swa: Mwanamuziki mkubwa wa Kiethopia Hachalu Hundessa alipata umaarufu kwa kutumia ubunifu na kipaji chake kuutambulisha umma kuhusu watu wa Oromo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. The Ethiopian singer Hachalu Hundessa gained fame by using his imagination and talent to introduce the people of Oromo to the public.

en: He was assassinated in a suburb of Ethiopias capital, Addis Ababa, on June 29.
swa: Aliuawa katika viunga vya mji mkuu wa Ethiopia, Addis Ababa, tarehe 29 Juni mwaka huu.
mt0: He was killed in the streets of the capital of Ethiopia, Addis Ababa, on June 29, this year.

en: That night, at 9:30 pm, as Hachalu was exiting his vehicle, a man named Tilahun Yami allegedly walked up to his car and fired a gun into the artists chest.
swa: Usiku ule mnamo saa tatu na nusu, wakati Hachalu akishuka kwenye gari lake, mwanaume aliyejulikana kwa jina la Tilahun Yami alitembea kuelekea gari yake na kumpiga risasi  kifuani mwake.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know At 3:00 a.m., when Hachalu was getting out of his car, a man named Tilahun Yami walked towards his car and shot him in the chest.

en: He was rushed to the nearest hospital, where he was officially declared dead.
swa: Alikimbizwa katika hospitali ya karibu ambapo ilithibitishwa rasmi kwamba amefariki.
mt0: He was taken to a local hospital where it was confirmed that he had died.

en: It was later determined that the bullet severely damaged his internal organs.
swa: Iligundulika baadaye kwamba risasi iliharibu vibaya sana viungo vyake vya ndani.
mt0: Afterwards it was discovered that the bullet had damaged his internal organs very badly.

en: Addis Ababas police chief reported two suspects were arrested.
swa: Mkuu wa polisi wa Addis Ababa  aliripoti kwamba watuhumiwa wawili wamekamatwa.
mt0: The head of the police in Addis Ababa reported that two men had been arrested.

en: After a few days, government authorities charged an alleged assassin along with two other accomplices.
swa: Baada ya siku chache mamlaka za serikali ziliwahukumu wauaji hao pamoja na washirika wao wawili.
mt0: After a few days the government sentenced the killers and their two partners.

en: In the wake of his murder, the country has struggled to come to terms with the violence that followed.
swa: Katika kuuawa kwake, nchi imeingia katika wakati mgumu wa kutuliza ghasia zilizofuata.
mt0: In his death, the country has entered a difficult time in which to quell the following violence.

en: The truth of Hachalu's assassination is not yet fully clear, and in its aftermath, speculation began to fly as politicians and activists stoked long-standing tensions between Oromo and Amahara elites, two of Ethiopia's largest ethnic groups.
swa: Ukweli ni kwamba mauaji ya Hachalu hayajawekwa wazi vizuri na pia matokeo yake, uvumi ulianza kuenea baada ya wanasiasa na wanaharakati  kuweka msisitizo mkubwa kuhusu mgogoro uliopo baina ya viongozi wakuu wa Oromo na Amahara ambayo ni makabila makubwa kabisa nchini Ethiopia.
mt0: The truth is that the Hachalu killings were not well explained and as a result, rumors started to spread after politicians and activists focused on the dispute between the leaders of the Oromo and Amahara ethnic groups, which are the two largest ethnic groups in Ethiopia.

en: That day, mourners flooded the streets of Addis Ababa and cities and towns across Oromia state.
swa: Siku ya maziko yake, waombolezaji walifurika katika mitaa ya Addis Ababa na miji mingine inayozunguka jimbo la Oromo.
mt0: On the day of his funeral, mourners filled the streets of Addis Ababa and other cities surrounding the Oromo region.

en: The next morning, Oromia Media Network (OMN), a satellite TV station on which Hachalu had his last contentious interview, provided online and TV coverage as his casket was transferred from Addis Ababa to Hachalus hometown, Ambo.
swa: Asubuhi iliyofuata Kituo cha runinga ya setilaiti cha Oromia Media Network (OMN), ambapo ndipo Hachalu alifanya mahojiano yake ya mwisho walirusha matangazo mubashara kupitia runinga na pia mitandao na kuonesha wakati jeneza lake likisafirishwa kutoka Addis Ababa kwenda nyumbani kwao huko mjini Ambo.
mt0: The next morning, Oromia Media Network (OMN), where Hachalu made his last interview, broadcast live advertisements on television and social media and showed the funeral procession from Addis Ababa to Ambo.

en: The slow, televised journey turned into a deadly battle between government authorities and opposition politicians over where Hachalu would be buried, and OMN interrupted its coverage as the hearse was forced to return to Addis Ababa.
swa: Matangazo hayo yaliyokwenda polepole sana yaligeuka kuwa uwanja wa mapambano baina ya mamlaka za serikali na viongozi wa upinzani, kukiwa na mabishano ya wapi hasa akazikwe Hachalu  na OMN ilibidi wakatize matangazo yake; inasemekana walilazimishwa kurejea Addis Ababa.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The announcements went slowly and turned into a clash between government officials and opposition leaders, where Hachalu and OMN were arguing where to hide; they were forced to return to Addis Ababa.

en: At least ten people were killed and several were injured in Addis Ababa.
swa: Watu kumi waliuawa na wengine kadhaa kujeruhiwa huko Addis Ababa.
mt0: Return only to the translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: The scuffle led to the arrest of several opposition politicians including Jawar Mohammed, an OMN figurehead, and opposition politician Bekele Gerba, who were both charged with instigating the mayhem.
swa: Mgongano huo ulipelekea kukamatwa kwa baadhi ya viongozi wa upinzani akiwepo Jawar Mohammed ambaye ni kiongozi wa  OMN  na pia kiongozi wa upinzani Bekele Gerba ambapo walishtakiwa kwa kuchochea vurugu.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Confusion swirled after government authorities eventually took Halachu's body back to Ambo by helicopter, where feuding parties continued to clash, denying the bereaved family members a proper burial.
swa: Utata uliibuka zaidi baada ya mamlaka za serikali kuuchukua tena mwili wa Hachalu na kuupeleka mjini kwao Ambo kwa njia ya helkopta, ambapo pia pande mbili ziliendelea kugombana na kuinyima familia ya marehemu fursa ya kumpa ndugu yao maziko stahiki.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Meanwhile, turmoil and violence ensued.
swa: Baada ya hapo vurugu na mapigano yalifuata.
mt0: After that, violence and fighting followed.

en: A three-day rampage gripped parts of Oromia and Addis Ababa, at a substantial cost: 239 people were left dead; hundreds of others were injured and more than 7,000 people were arrested for violence and property damage worth millions of Ethiopian birr.
swa: Mapigano hayo yalichukua siku tatu yaliyararua baadhi ya maeneo ya miji ya Oromo na Addis Ababa na uharibifu halisi ni: vifo vya watu 239  na mamia wamejeruhiwa, zaidi ya watu 7,000 wamekamatwa kwa kusababisha vurugu na uharibifu wa mali  zenye thamani ya mamilioni ya birr, fedha ya Kiethopia.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The fighting took three days and destroyed some areas of Oromo and Addis Ababa and the real damage is: 239 people died and hundreds were injured, over 7,000 people were arrested for causing the violence and the damage of millions of Ethiopian birr, the Ethiopian currency.

en: On June 30, the government imposed an internet shutdown to attempt to halt calls for violence circulating on social media that lasted three weeks.
swa: Hapo Juni 30, serikali ilijaribu kuzima mtandao ili kuzuia kuenea kwa uhamasishaji wa kufanya vurugu unaofanyika katika mitandao ya kijamii na kudumu kwa wiki tatu.
mt0: Since June 30, the government has tried to shut down the Internet to prevent the spread of violence which takes place on social media and lasts for three weeks.

en: A number of people were shot and killed by government security forces, but several news outlets including Voice of America and Addis Standard reported that angry mobs from the Oromo ethnic group attacked multiethnic, interfaith towns and cities in southeastern Oromia, targeting non-Oromo, non-Muslim families in the region.
swa: Watu kadhaa walipigwa risasi na mamlaka za usalama lakini baadhi ya vyanzo vya habari ikiwamo Sauti ya Amerika na Addis Standard viliripoti kuwa vikundi vya watu wenye hasira kutoka kabila la Oromo walishambulia watu wa makundi mbalimbali ikiwepo miji na mitaa inayokaliwa na watu wa imani tofauti tofauti, iliyo Kusini Mashariki mwa mji wa Oromo, wakilenga hasa familia za watu wasio Waoromo na wasio Waislam katika ukanda huo.
mt0: Many people were shot by security forces but some sources of news including the Voice of America and Addis Standard reported that angry Oromo people attacked communities of different faiths in the southeast of Oromo, including cities and cities populated by non-Oromo people and non-Islam families.

en: Most of the violence fell along ethnic Amahara-Oromo lines, but religion may have played a more central role due to an intricate, localized understanding of ethnicity: The southeast Oromo communitys ethnic identity markers usually combine the religion of Islam and the Afan-Oromo language.
swa: Vurugu zaidi zilikuwa katika ukanda wenye mchanganyiko wa watu wa Amahara-Oromo na dini inaweza ikawa imecheza nafasi kubwa kwa sababu ya uelewa uliopo kwamba: jamii ya Waoromo wa Kusini Mashariki inatambulishwa kwa mchangayiko wa dini ya Kiislamu na watumiaji wa lugha ya Afan-Oromo.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. The most violent areas were in the mixed Amahara-Oromo area and religion could have played a big role because of the knowledge that exists that: the Eastern Oromia is characterized by a mix of Islam and the use of the Afan-Oromo language.

en: A local farmer reportedly said we thought Hachalu was Oromo after he watched Hachalu's televised funeral rites that followed the traditions of the Ethiopian Orthodox Tewahedo Church.
swa: Mkulima mmoja wa maeneo hayo alisema kwamba tulifikiri Hachalu ni Muoromo baada ya kuangalia matangazo yaliyorushwa moja kwa moja yakionesha shughuli za maziko ya Hachalu yaliyofuata desturi za Kanisa la Kiothodoksi la Tewahedo Ethiopia.
mt0: One of the farmers said that we thought Hachalu was an Oromian after watching live television broadcasts showing Hachalu's funeral following the traditions of the Orthodox Church in Ethiopia.

en: According to reports, most victims of the most gruesome violence were minority Christian Amharas, Christian Oromos and Gurage people.
swa: Kulingana na ripoti, wahanga wengi wa vurugu hizo walikuwa ni Wakristo wa ki-Amhara, Wakristo wa ki-Oromo na watu wa Gurage.
mt0: According to the report, the most affected were Amhara Christians, Oromo Christians and Gurage Christians.

en: Eyewitnesses say mobs destroyed and burned property, committed lynching and beheadings and dismembered victims.
swa: Shuhuda mmoja alisema kuwa makundi hayo yaliharibu na kuchoma moto mali na kufanya mauaji  kwa kuwakata vichwa na miguu wahanga.
mt0: One witness said that the groups destroyed and burned houses and killed victims by cutting heads and legs.

en: A fateful interview
swa: Utabiri wa Mahojiano
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: When news of Hachalus assassination first hit, Oromo diaspora media outlets zeroed in on Hachalus fateful interview with OMN host Guyo Wariyo, that aired the week before Halachu was killed.
swa: Wakati taarifa kuhusu mauaji ya Hachalu ziliposikika tu, chanzo cha habari za Waoromo wa diaspora zilihusisha kifo chake na  mahojiano ya mwisho aliyoyafanya Hachalu na kituo cha runinga cha OMN yakiongozwa na Guyo Wariyo, na yalirushwa wiki moja kabla Hachalu hajauawa.
mt0: When the news of Hachalu's killing was heard, a source of diaspora reports linked the death to the last interview Hachalu had with OMN, which was broadcast a week before Hachalu was killed.

en: During the interview, Guyo repeatedly asked Hachalu provocative questions about his alleged sympathy for the ruling party, interrupting him multiple times to challenge his answers.
swa: Wakati wa mahojiano Gayo alirudia rudia kumuuliza Hachalu maswali ya mtego kuhusu yeye kukiunga mkono chama tawala na pia mara kwa mara alimkatiza alipokuwa akijibu.
mt0: While the interview Gayo repeatedly asked Hachalu questions about his support for the ruling party and repeatedly interrupted him when he was answering.

en: Hachalu fiercely denied any sympathies with the ruling party, but also decried the deeply discordant and fractionalized Oromo political parties, demonstrating his staunch independence as a thinker and musician  a quality that made him a target for online abuse until the day of his murder.
swa: Hachalu alikataa kuunga chama tawala mkono lakini pia alikosoa  migogoro na utengano katika vyama vya siasa vya Oromo, akionesha uhuru wa mawazo kama mwanamuziki  hali ambayo ilimfanya kuwa mlengwa wa mashambulizi ya watu mtandaoni mpaka siku aliyouawa.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Hachalu refused to support the government but also criticized the political parties of the Oromo, showing freedom of speech as a musician which made him a target of online attacks until his death.

en: At one point, however, Guyo asked Hachalu about the historical injustices allegedly committed against the Oromo people by Menelik II, Ethiopias 19th-century emperor who shaped modern Ethiopia.
swa: Hata hivyo, Guyo alimuuliza Hachalu kuhusu unyanyasaji wa kihistoria uliofanywa kwa watu wa Oromo na mfalme Menelik II aliyeijenga Ethiopia ya sasa.
mt0: But Guyo asked Hachalu about the historical persecution of the Oromo people by the Ethiopian King Menelik II.

en: Hachalu shocked some listeners when he answered that the horse seen immortalized in Meneliks equestrian statue in Addis Ababa belongs to an Oromo farmer called Sida Debelle, and that Menelik robbed that horse.
swa: Hachalu aliwashangaza wasikilizaji wengi aliposema kuwa farasi aliyepandwa na Menelik katika sanamu iliyopo huko Addis Ababa alikuwa mali ya mkulima wa ki-Oromo aliyeitwa Sida Debelle, na Menelik alimuiba farasi huyo.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: This exchange attracted applause  and criticism  from commentators on Facebook and Twitter.
swa: Majibu hayo yalivutia maoni ya kumsifia  na pia ya kumkosoa kutoka kwa watu mbalimbali huko Facebook na Twitter.
mt0: The responses attracted a lot of applause and criticism from people on Facebook and Twitter.

en: When Hachalu was killed one week later, many members of the Oromo diaspora community immediately speculated that Hachalus criticism of the Menelik II statue infuriated sympathizers of imperial Ethiopia, which may have led to his murder.
swa: Wakati Hachalu alikiuawa wiki moja baadaye watu wengi wa jamii ya Oromo wanaokaa nje ya nchi walihisi kwamba kitendo cha Hachalu kuikosoa sanamu ya Menelik II kiliwakasirisha wanaoiunga mkono Ethiopia ya kifalme na kusababisha kuuawa kwake.
mt0: When Hachalu was killed a week later, many Oromo people living abroad believed that Hachalu's remarks on Menelik II's statue would have angered the supporters of the Ethiopian empire and cause his death.

en: On social media, Oromo netizens focused obsessively on Hachalus Menelik-related remarks, which led many down a winding path to an insidious disinformation campaign.
swa: Katika mitandao ya kijamii wananchi waling'ang'ana na kile Hachalu alichokisema dhidi ya Menelik, na hili lilisababisha kuenea kwa uvumi wenye taarifa nyingi za uongo.
mt0: In social media, people clashed with what Hachalu said against Menelik, and this caused a spread of rumors with many lies.

en: The rest of the interview contains other loaded issues of divisions and contradictions within the Oromo community.
swa: Sehemu nyingine ya mahojiano imebeba taarifa za mambo yanayohusu utengano na migogoro ndani ya jamii ya Waoromo.
mt0: Part of the interview focused on the political and social divisions within the oromo community.

en: Throughout the interview, Guyo grilled Hachalu about the countrys ongoing political reforms, stoking anti-government sentiment with questions about Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, himself an Oromo, and whether or not the government had met the demands of the Oromo people after the prime minister came to power in 2018.
swa: Katika mahojiano yote Guyo alimchimba sana Hachalu kuhusu mabadiliko ya kisiasa yanayoendelea nchini na kuhusu vuguvugu la kuipinga serikali kwa kuuliza swali kuhusu Waziri Mkuu Abiy Ahmed, ambaye ni Muoromo na kwamba kama serikali imeweza kutimiza matakwa ya watu wa Oromo tangu aingie madarakani mwaka 2018.
mt0: In all the interviews Guyo asked Hachalu about the political changes taking place in the country and about the opposition movement by asking about the Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, a oromo, and whether the government has satisfied the demands of the Oromo people since he came into office in 2018.

en: Hachalu reiterated his non-involvement in the rabid partisanship of Oromo politics but he did criticize those who question Abiys Oromo identity.
swa: Hachalu alirudia kusema kuwa hajihusishi na siasa za ovyo za Oromo lakini aliwakosoa wote wanaohukumu uzalendo wa Abiy.
mt0: Hachalu reiterated that he was not involved in political corruption in the Oromo but criticized all those who judged Abiy's independence.

en: He defended his position against top Oromo opposition leaders who sought an alliance with the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), a once-dominant party with historic ties to the now-defunct Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (the EPRDF).
swa: Aliilinda nafasi yake dhidi ya viongozi wakuu wa upinzani walioungana na Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), ambacho kilishawahi kuwa na ukaribu na  chama kikuu chenye historia kubwa cha Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (the EPRDF).
mt0: He kept his position against the top opposition leaders who formed the Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), which had a close association with the main opposition party Ethiopian People's Revolutionary Front (EPRDF).

en: The TPLF turned into an opposition party after Abiy dismantled the EPRDF.
swa: TPLF iligeuka kuwa chama cha upinzani baada ya Abiy kuibomoa EPRDF.
mt0: Return to the translated translation only. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Hachalu also addressed the political violence in the Oromia region, blaming both government authorities and the militant, splinter right-wing Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) militia group (informally known as OLF-Shane).
swa: Hachalu pia alizungumza kuhusu vurugu za kisiasa zinazoendelea katika mkoa wa Oromo akilaumu pande zote yaani mamlaka za serikali na wanamgambo wa kikundi cha wanamgambo wa mrengo wa kulia Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) ambapo pia (hufahamika kama OLF-Shane).
mt0: Hachalu also spoke about the political violence which is going on in the Oromo region, blaming both government and opposition fighters of the Oromo Liberation Front (OLF) (also known as OLF-Shane).

en: Following Hachalus murder, the government was able to acquire and release the full 71-minute interview to the public.
swa: Kufuatia mauaji ya Hachalu, serikali iliweza kuchukua mkanda wa mahojiano yenye urefu wa dakika 71 na  kuyarusha kwa umma.
mt0: After the Hachalu killing, the government was able to take a 71-minute interview and broadcast it to the public.

en: The missing tape included Hachalus accounts of death threats he received from parts of western Oromia, where the radical OLF-Shane militia is active.
swa: Mkanda huo unajumuisha ujumbe wa vitisho vya kuuawa alivyotumiwa Hachalu kutoka pande za Magharibi mwa Oromo, ambapo ndipo vikosi vya wanamgambo wa OLF-Shane wanafanyia shughuli zao.
mt0: The newspaper contains a message of threats of death which Hachalu used from the northern border of Oromo, where the OLF-Shane forces are operating.

en: Hachalu said he believed he would not have been attacked on social media if he had praised OLF-Shane.
swa: Hachalu alisema aliamini kuwa asingeshambuliwa mitandaoni kama angewasifia OLF-Shane.
mt0: Hachalu said he believed he would not be attacked on social media if he praised OLF-Shane.

en: He addressed a direct conflict he had with Getachew Assefa, Ethiopias security and intelligence chief during the TPLF period.
swa: Alizungumzia moja kwa moja mgogoro baina yake na Getachew Assefa, Afisa Usalama Mkuu wa Ethiopia katika kipindi TPLF ikiwa madarakani.
mt0: He spoke directly about the conflict between him and Getachew Assefa, the Ethiopian security chief during the time of the TPLF government.

en: Guyo, who promoted this interview on Facebook as must-see TV in the days before its broadcast, has since been arrested and the government is investigating the full 71-minutes of interview tape for further clues that may help determine the facts regarding Hachalu's murder.
swa: Guyo, aliyeyatangaza mahojiano hayo katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook kwa kuyaita lazima uyaone siku chache kabla ya kurushwa kwake hewani, amekamatwa na polisi tangu wakati huo na serikali inafanya upelelezi wa mkanda wa dakika 71 za mahojiano hayo ili kupata vielelezo vitakavyosaidia kupata ufumbuzi wa chanzo cha mauaji ya Hachalu.
mt0: Guyo, who announced the interview on his Facebook page saying it was necessary to see it a few days before it was aired, has been arrested since then and the government is investigating the 71-minute interview to find evidence that could help determine the cause of Hachalu's death.

en: Read more about the consequences of Hachalu Hundessa's murder in Part II.
swa: Soma zaidi kuhusu madhara yaliyotokana na mauaji ya Hachalu Hundessa katika sehemu ya II.

en: Screenshot from a Guardian YouTube video about female genital mutilation.

en: COVID-19 has deeply affected womens rights in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA), from increased domestic violence to job loss.
swa: Janga la COVID-19 limeathiri kwa kiwango kikubwa haki za wanawake huko Mashariki ya Kati na Kaskazini mwa Afrika;  kutoka kuongezeka kwa ukatili majumbani mpaka kupoteza ajira zao.
mt0: The coronavirus pandemic has significantly affected women's rights in Central and Northern Africa; from increasing domestic violence to losing their jobs.

en: But there is also one less visible area where women are affected: female genital mutilation (FGM), due to disruption in prevention because of the pandemic.
swa: Lakini kuna eneo moja lililowazi ambapo wanawake wameathirika ambalo mi ukeketaji, na hii ni baada ya kulipuka kwa janga la Korona na heka heka za kukabiliana nalo.
mt0: But there is one clear area where women have been affected, and that is because of the spread of the coronavirus pandemic and the efforts to cope with it.

en: In April, the United Nations announced that due to pandemic-related disruptions in prevention programs, two million FGM cases could occur over the next decade that would otherwise have been averted.
swa: Mwezi April, Umoja wa Mataifa ulitangaza kuwa kutokama ma vizuizi vilivyotokana na juhudi za kupambana na janga la korona, kuna visa milioni 2 vya ukeketaji ambavyo vinakisiwa kutokea kwa muongo ujao ambapo ingewekana kuzuia kama uzuiaji wa korona usingetibua mpango na juhudi za kupambama na ukeketaji
mt0: In April, the United Nations announced that due to the restrictions imposed on the fight against the coronavirus pandemic, there are approximately 2 million cases of tuberculosis expected to occur in the next decade if the coronavirus restrictions were not broken. en: Female genital mutilation includes all procedures that involve partial or total removal of the external female genitalia, or other injury to the female genital organs for non-medical reasons, according to the World Health Organization (WHO).
swa: Ukeketaji unajumuisha shughuli za kukata kwa sehemu au kuondoa kabisa sehemu ya nje ya uke, au kuumiza sehemu  za uke bila uhusiano au dhana yoyote ya kutabibu, kulingana na Shirika la Afya Ulimwenguni (WHO).
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The practice, rooted in extensive traditions, cultural and religious beliefs throughout Africa, the Middle East and Asia, is typically performed by traditional midwives or healers using knives, razors or glass.
swa: Kitendo hiki ni utamaduni wa kimila na kidini ulioota mizizi kote barani Afrika, Mashariki ya Kati na Asia , na hufanywa na wakunga wa jadi, waganga kwa kutumia visu, nyembe au vipande vya chupa.
mt0: If you can't translate this simply say you don't know. This tradition is a religious and religious tradition that has roots in Africa, Middle East and Asia , and is performed by traditional healers, doctors using instruments such as knives, nails or bottles.

en: FGM, also known as genital cutting, is widely considered as one of the most extreme manifestations of violence against girls and women, and yet it is widely underreported in the Middle East.
swa: Ukeketaji pia unafahamika kama ukataji wa sehemu za siri inaaminika kwa upana kuwa ni  moja ya ukatili uliopitiliza dhidi ya wasichana na wanawake, na bado unaripotiwa kwa uchache sana hasa huko Mashariki ya Kati.

en: It is estimated that it affects at least 200 million women worldwide.

en: Somalia has the highest prevalence of FGM with an estimated 98 percent of females between 15 and 49 years who experienced genital cutting.
swa: Somalia inadhaniwa kuwa na idadi kubwa ya wahanga wa ukeketaji ambapo asilimia 98 ya wanawake wenye miaka kati ya 15 mpaka 49 wamekeketwa.

en: In Djibouti, an estimated 93 percent are affected, Egypt, 91 percent, Sudan, 88 percent, Mauritania, 69 percent, Yemen,19 percent and Iraq, 7 percent, according to the latest figures released in June by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA).
swa: Huko Djibouti, inakadiriwa asilimia 93 wameathirika, Misri asilimia 92, Sudan asilimia 88, Mauritania asilimia 69, Yemen asilimia 19  na Iraki asilimia 7 kulingana na takwimu zilizoachiliwa Juni na Shirika la Umoja wa Mataifa linaloshughulika na Idadi ya watu  (UNFPA).

en: The practice varies according to social class, ethnicity and education in each country, with notable differences between urban and rural areas.
swa: Kitendo hiki hutofautiana kulingana na tabaka la kijamii, kabila na hata kiwango cha elimu katika kila nchi na katika maeneo ya mijini au vijijini.
mt0: This varies depending on the social class, race, and even the level of education in each country and in cities or rural areas.

en: FGM more often occurs among the poorest, least educated families in rural areas.
swa: Ukeketaji mara nyingi hutokea baina ya watu maskini zaidi au katika familia ambazo hazijaelimika katika maeneo ya vijijini.

en: In Yemen, FGM is concentrated in coastal regions but less common in the north.

en: In Iraq, the practice is more prevalent in northern Kurdish provinces.

en: In Egypt, it is markedly higher among girls living in upper Egypt.

mt0: In Egypt it is especially attractive to girls living in the Upper Egyptian region.

en: In Mauritania, more than 90 percent of women from the poorest families have endured FGM compared to 37 percent of women from the richest families.
swa: Nchini Mauritania, zaidi ya asilimia 90 ya wanawake kutoka katika familia maskini zaidi wamefanyiwa ukeketaji ukilinganisha na asilimia 37 ya wanawake kutoka katika familia zenye kipato cha juu.

en: The scale and scope of FGM may be underestimated because the official global picture of FGM/C is incomplete, according to a joint report from March, authored by Equality Now, End FGM European Network and the US End FGM/C Network.

en: The report revealed growing evidence that the ritual is also practiced in other regions including the Middle East and Asia, and the world woefully underestimates FGM.
swa: Taarifa hiyo ilidhihirisha kuwa utamaduni huu unaongezeka na pia unafanyika hata Mashariki ya Kati na Asia, na  dunia kwa hakika imeupuuzia ukeketaji.

en: Small sample researches have recently shown that FGM is also practiced in Iran, along with Gulf states such as Kuwait, the UAE, Oman, and Saudi Arabia.

mt0: Divya Srinivasan from the South said to Reuters that she was surprised by the small study from places like Oman and Saudi Arabia where smoking is not a common occurrence.

en: The report, published during the peak of the COVID-19 crisis in the Middle East, was not picked up by the Arabic speaking media or translated into Arabic, with little coverage of FGM in Arabic at all.

en: In the Middle East, taboos around womens bodies and sexuality prevent open, public discussions about sensitive issues like FGM, often tied to cultural, religious and traditional beliefs.
swa: Huko Mashariki ya Kati, kuna miiko inayoizingira miili ya wanawake ambapo ni marufuku kujadili hadharani mambo ya siri kama vile ukeketaji ambapo umefungamanishwa na imani za kimila, dini na utamaduni.
mt0: In the Middle East, there are laws regarding women's bodies where it is illegal to discuss matters of a secret such as genital mutilation which is associated with customs, religion and culture.

en: In Egypt, for example, Christians and Muslims both believe that circumcision of girls prevents them from vice and makes them more attractive for future husbands; mothers fear that their daughters cant get married if they have not been cut, according to a report by Stop FGM Middle East, a campaign created in 2013 to raise awareness about FGM and whose aim is to get the message out that FGM exists not only in Africa, but also in many countries in the Middle East and Asia.
swa: Kwa mfano, nchini Misri Wakristo na Waislamu kwa pamoja wanaamini kwamba ukeketaji wa wasichana unawafanya wavutie zaidi waume zao watarajiwa na unawakinga na mabaya, pia wamama huhofia kwamba mabinti zao hawataolewa kama hawatakeketwa, kulingana na ripoti ya Tokomeza Ukeketaji Mashariki ya Kati, kampeni ambayo iliandaliwa mwaka 2013 kuipa jamii uelewa Kuhusu ukeketaji na pia kuuambia ulimwengu kuwa ukeketaji haupo Afrika pekee bali pia katika nchi nyingi za Mashariki ya Kati na Asia.
mt0: For example, in Egypt, both Christians and Muslims believe that female circumcision makes them more attracted to their potential partners and protects them from the worst, and mothers fear that their daughters will not be married if they are not circumcised, according to the report of the Campaign to Stop Female Circumcision in the Middle East, which was published in 2013 to raise awareness of circumcision and to tell the world that circumcision is not only in Africa but also in many other countries of the Middle East and Asia.

en: The organization lobbies for more data on FGM and has created a survey toolkit to help individuals and groups create small-scale surveys on FGM.
swa: Taasisi hii inaendelea kukusanya taarifa zaidi za ukeketaji na imetengeneza njia ya kukusanya taarifa itakayosaidia mtu mmoja mmoja au vikundi vya watu kufanya tafiti ndogo juu ya ukeketaji.
mt0: This organization is continuing to collect more information about rape and has developed a collection method that will help individuals or groups of people conduct small research on rape.

en: Unless there is a critical incident that makes headlines, such as the recent FGM-related death of a 12-year-old girl in southern Egypt in February, people tend to avoid the topic.

en: On the morning of 15 May, police arrested supreme court lawyer and writer Imtiaz Mahmud in a case filed in 2017 under the country's now-defunct Information and Communication Technology Act, in which a private citizen, Shafiqul Islam, alleged that one of Mahmood's Facebook posts had hurt religious sentiments and incited communal violence in Bangladesh's southeastern Chittagong region.
swa: Asubuhi ya tarehe 15 Mei, polisi walimkamata Mwanasheria wa mahakama kuu  na mwandishi  Imtiaz Mahmud chini ya kifungu cha  sheria ya 2017 ambayo haitumika kwa sasa, sheria ya Habari, Mawasiliano na Teknolojia ambapo, raia mmoja, Shafiqul Islam, alilalamika kuwa mija ya machapisho ya Mahmood huko Facebook yameumiza hisia zake za kiimani na yalichochea uhalifu katika ukanda wa Kusini Mashariki mwa mkoa Chittagong, Bangladesh .
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know On May 15th, police arrested the Chief Attorney and Journalist Imtiaz Mahmud under the 2017 Broadcasting, Communication and Technology Act . A citizen, Shafiqul Islam, complained that Mahmood's posts on Facebook had hurt his religious beliefs and encouraged violence in the south-east of Chittagong, Bangladesh .

en: Imtiaz Mahmood secured an anticipatory bail when the case was originally brought, but a Khagrachhari court issued another arrest warrant against him in January 2019.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Imtiaz Mahmood was granted bail for a while when the case was filed but the Khagrachhari Court ordered him to be arrested again instead of the one in January 2019.

en: Despite concerns about its implications for freedom of expression, the Bangladeshi parliament approved the Digital Security Act in September 2018.
swa: Pamoja na kuonesha kuwa sheria hiyo ingebana uhuru wa kujieleza, bunge la Bangladeshi  iliipitisha sheria ya Usalama wa Mitandaoni hapo Septemba 2018.
mt0: Although it was reported that the law would restrict freedom of speech, Bangladeshi parliament passed the Internet Security Act in September 2018.

en: The law replaced the notorious Information and  Technology Act, which had also been used as a tool for silencing critical speech online.
swa: Sheria hii ilichukua nafasi ya sheria nyingine kandamizi ya Habari na Teknolijia, ambayo pia ilikuwa ilitumika kama chombo cha  kuwanyamazisha wakosoaji Mitandaoni.
mt0: This law replaced another controversial law on communications and technology, which was also used as a tool to silence critics on the Internet.

en: The Act criminalizes various types of online speech, ranging from defamatory messages to speech that injures religious values or sentiments introducing hefty fines.
swa: Sheria hii inahukumu baadhi ya mazungumzo mitandaoni kuanzia jumbe za kubeza mpaka  mazungumzo yenye kuumiza hisia na maadili ya  kidini ikiorodhesha pia faini kubwa.
mt0: This law covers some online conversations from insults to religious abuse and includes a huge fine.

en: It also authorizes lengthy prison sentences for using the internet to create public unrest, and for gathering, sending or preserving classified government documents using a digital device.
swa: Pia inaruhusu vifungo vya muda mrefu kwa makosa ya  kutumia mitandao kusababisha vurugu katika jamii na kwa kukusanya, kutuma na kuhifadhi habari na nyaraka nyeti za serikali kupitia huduma za kidigitali.
mt0: It also allows for long-term suspensions for illegal use of the Internet to cause violence in the community and for collecting, sending and storing government information and sensitive documents through digital services.

en: The Editors Council of Bangladesh said that the Act is against the freedom guaranteed by the constitution, media freedom and freedom of speech.
swa: Baraza la Wahariri la Bangladeshi lilisema kuwa sheria hii ni kinyume na uhuru uliotolewa kikatiba, uhuru wa vyombo vya habari na uhuru wa kujieleza.
mt0: The Bangladeshi Press Council said that the law was against the constitutional freedoms of speech, press freedom and freedom of speech.

en: Read more: Free speech advocates say Bangladesh's new Digital Security Act is ripe for abuse
swa: Soma zaidi: wanaharakati wa Uhuru wa Kujieleza Bangladesh wanasema sheria moja ya Usalama wa Digitali ni kwa kusudi la kunyanyasa

en: The Act also provides absolute power to law enforcement agencies to initiate investigations of anyone whose activities are deemed harmful or threating.

en: In the aftermath of the Sudanese revolution, transitional authorities of Sudan have signed a peace agreement with The Sudan Revolutionary Front  the main rebel group still active after former leader Omar al-Bashir was deposed last year.
swa: Baada ya mapinduzi ya Sudani, mamlaka za mpito za Sudani zimesaini makubaliano ya amani na The Sudan Revolutionary Front  kikundi kikuu cha waasi ambacho kimeendelea na utendaji wake hata baada ya kuondolewa kwa kiongozi wake wa zamani Omar al-Bashir, mwaka jana.
mt0: After the Sudan Revolution, the transitional government of Sudan signed a peace deal with the main opposition group The Sudan Revolutionary Front, which has continued to operate even after the expulsion of its former leader Omar al-Bashir last year.

en: The historic peace agreement, signed on August 31, in the city of Juba, South Sudan, found regional and international support from Troika countries, the European Union, Egypt and several Gulf countries.
swa: Makubaliano haya ya amani ya Kihistoria yalisainiwa hapo Agosti 31, katika mji wa Juba, Sudani Kusini ambapo yanaungwa mkono na jumuiya za Kikanda na zile za Kimataifa kama vile nchi za Kitroika, Umoja wa Ulaya, Misri na baadhi ya nchi za Ghuba.
mt0: If you cannot translate this historic peace agreement simply say you don't know. This historic peace agreement was signed on August 31, in the South Sudan city of Juba, which is backed by regional and international organizations such as the Ethiopian Parliament, the European Union, Egypt and some Gulf nations.

en: Despite this exciting moment, two main rebel groups did not sign the agreement: The SLMA), led by Abdul Wahid al-Nur, and Sudan Peoples Liberation Movement-North (SPLM-N), led by Abdelaziz al-Hilu, both refrained due to lingering questions about the mechanisms for integrating armies and the country identity.

mt0: Although this significant event was held, two armed groups did not sign the agreement. SLMA, led by Abdul Wahid al-Nur, and the Islamic Liberation Movement of the Northern Sudan (SPLM-N), led by Abdelaziz al-Hilu, both resigned because of the lack of answers to some questions about the military system and the country's identity.

en: Three days after the peace signing, Sudan PM Abdalla Hamdok traveled to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to meet with al-Hilu to discuss points of contention, according to Sudan Tribune.

mt0: Sudan's Prime Minister traveled to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to meet with al-Hilu to discuss the dispute according to the Sudanese Peacekeeping Office.

The Sudanese are divided into two groups in this issue: the first group believes that separating citizenship and religion is fundamental to human rights; the second group believes that the transition government has no power to decide on this issue without the consent of the people through democratic elections.

en: While peace has brought happy news to Sudan, the Nile River continues to flood, ushering in an unprecedented humanitarian disaster.

en: According to a Sudanese National Council for Civil Defense report on September 8, total losses due to the Nile flood amounted to 103 deaths, 50 injuries, 5,482 deaths of livestock, 27,341 complete house collapses, 42,210 cases of partial house collapse, damage to 179 government and private facilities, loss of 359 shops and stores and damage to 4,208 agricultural acres.

en: The levels of the Blue Nile this night witnessed a great rise accompanied by heavy rain, which led to the breaking of the covers and shields, a simple dam built by sacks of the soil, of the city of Singa and Umm Benin areas, and the water began to flood the city and its homes, as well as the neighbourhoods of Umm Benin.

mt0: The Nile River water level has risen overnight due to heavy rainfall that caused the collapse of the barriers and fences which are a small dam built from clay stones in the cities of Singa and Umm Benin, and water has started to flow into the city and into the houses of the people.

en: Therefore, we launch a directive to all official bodies and an appeal to all civil authorities and organizations to come to the rescue of the citizens as soon as possible, and to provide shelter, medicines and food.
