en: Student Union of Thailand (SUT) president Jutatip Sirikhan has been arrested while on the way to university on September 1 for her participation in the July 18 mass protest.
swa: Raisi wa Umoja wa wanafunzi wa Thailand Jutatip Sirikhan amekamatwa akiwa njiani akielekea chuoni hapo Septemba 1, kwa sababu ya kushiriki katika maandamano makubwa ya Julai 18.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Jutatip was arrested while in a taxi on her way to class at Thammasat Universitys Tha Prachan campus in Bangkok.
swa: Jutatip alikamatwa akiwa ndani ya gari akielekea darasani katika chuo kikuu cha Thammasat kampasi ya Tha Prachan huko Bangkok.
mt0: Jutatip was arrested while he was driving to school at Thammasat University Kampus Tha Prachan in Bangkok.

en: She went live on Facebook at 12:50 pm on September 1 when plainclothes police officers stopped the taxi she was in and delivered an arrest warrant.
swa: Aliingia mubashara katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook mnamo saa 07:50 mchana hapo Septemba 1, wakati askari waliovalia kiraia waliposimamisha taksi aliyokuwa amepanda na wakamwonesha hati ya kumkamata.
mt0: He entered his Facebook page at 7:50 a.m. on September 1, when a policeman stopped his taxi and showed him a arrest warrant.

en: Jutatip was taken to Samranrat Police Station.
swa: Jutatip alipelekwa kwenye kituo cha polisi cha  lSamranrat.
mt0: Jutatip was taken to the Samaritan Police Station.

en: An officer accompanied her in another taxi to the station, since she did not feel safe enough to travel in the private car the officers brought to arrest her.
swa: Afisa wa polisi aliambatana naye kuelekea kituoni akiwa kwenye taksi nyingine kwa sababu hakujisikia kuwa salama kupanda gari binafsi walilokuja nalo askari waliokuja kumkamata.
mt0: A police official accompanied him to the station on a taxi because he didn't feel safe getting into the private car they came with to arrest him.

en: She stayed live on Facebook and read out passages from the Thai translation of Thomas Paines Common Sense during the travel to the station.
swa: Aliendelea kuwa mubashara katika ukurasa wake wa Facebook, akisoma kifungu cha habari  Ufahamu wa Kawaida kilichotafsiriwa kwa Kithailand na Thomas Paine.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: She was then taken to the Bangkok Criminal Court and was granted bail and released at 5:20 pm in the custody of a lecturer at Thammasat University.
swa: Alipelekwa katika mahakama ya kihalifu ya Bangkok na alipewa dhamana na kuachiliwa saa 11.20 jioni akiwa chini ya uangalizi wa Mhadhiri kutoka chuo kikuu cha Thammasat.
mt0: He was taken to the Bangkok criminal court and was bailed out at 11.20 p.m. under the supervision of a professor from Thammasat University.

en: The Court did not require her to immediately pay the 100,000 baht (3,190 US dollars) bail but imposed the condition that she does not repeat the actions for which she was being charged  the same condition given to everyone else who has been arrested and released on the same charges.

en: While India is going through a major general election spread over seven phases from 11 April to 19 May 2019 in order to elect its 17th parliament (Lok Sabha), some Indian voters have taken the unusual step of boycotting the electoral process.
swa: Wakati India ikipitia kipindi cha uchaguzi mkuu uliogawanyika katika awamu saba zinazoanzia 11 April mpaka 19 Mei 2019 ili kuchagua bunge lake la saba (Lok Sabha), baadhi ya wapiga kura wa India wamechukua hatia isiyo ya kawaida kwa kugomea shughuli za uchaguzi.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know While India is through a parliamentary election phase which runs from April 11 to May 19 2019 to elect its seventh parliament (Lok Sabha), some Indian voters have taken a very unusual action for refusing to participate in the elections.

en: In Goa, a southwestern state of India, residents of a tribal hamlet in Canacona block (district subdivision), Marlem Village refused to vote on 23 April during the third phase of the general election, alleging that the government had been oblivious to the problems of their village.
swa: Huko Goa, jimbo la Kusini mwa India, wakazi wa kijiji kidogo kilichopo kitongoji  cha Cancona (sehemu ya wilaya), kijiji cha Marlem walikataa kupiga kura tarehe 23 Aprili katika awamu ya tatu ya uchaguzi mkuu wakiwa na madai kwamba serikali imekuwa ndio tatizo kuwa katika kijiji chao.
mt0: In Goa, south India, the villagers of the small village of Cancona (part of the district), Marlem village have rejected the third round of the general election on April 23, with the claim that the government has become a problem in their village.

en: Their main grievance is that basic facilities, such as proper roads and water supply, have not been provided by the government.
swa: Malalamiko yao makubwa ni kwamba mahitaji na huduma muhimu kama vile barabara nzuri na huduma ya maji safi na salama hazijawahi kutolewa na serikali.
mt0: Their biggest concern is that essential needs and services such as good roads and safe water services have never been provided by the government.

en: A video by Community Correspondent Devidas Gaonkar, a member of the aboriginal shepherd tribe of Goa called Velip, documented the protests of the villagers:
swa: Video ya Mtangazaji wa masuala ya kijamii  Devidas Gaonkar, mzaliwa wa kabila la wafugaji la waGoa inayoitwa Velip, ikionesha maandano ya wanakijiji hao:
mt0: Video of a social media presenter Devidas Gaonkar, a native of the Goa tribe of Velip, showing the portraits of the villagers:

en: In this video, Pandurang Gaonkar, a resident from Marli village, states that:
swa: Katika video hii, Pandurang Gaonkar, mkazi wa kijiji cha Marli alisema kwamba:
mt0: In this video, Pandurang Gaonkar, a villager from Marli village, said that:

en: Tirwal to Marlem is a three-quilometres road stretch, which is incomplete.
swa: Kuanzia Tirwal mpaka Marlem ni kilomita tatu tu za barabara lakini hazijakamilika.
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know. From Tirwal to Marlem there are only three kilometers of road but it's not finished yet.

en: To date, no action has been taken by the authorities.
swa: Mpaka leo hakuna hatua zozote zilizochukuliwa na mamlaka husika.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Since then, no action has been taken by the authorities.

en: They only make false promises, but no implementation.
swa: Wanatupa ahadi za uongo tu hakuna utekelezaji.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: For this reason, we havent cast our votes.
swa: Na kwa sababu hiyo basi, hatujapiga kura.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The residents of Marlem have been living in this village for more than 20 years.
swa: Wakazi wa kijiji cha Marlem wamekuwa wakiishi katika kijiji hicho kwa zaidi ya miaka 20 sasa.
mt0: The residents of Marlem village have been living in the village for more than 20 years.

en: In 1968, the Forest Department declared Marlem village part of a wildlife sanctuary.
swa: Mwaka 1968, idara ya misitu ilitangaza kuwa kijiji cha Marlem kama  sehemu salama kwa wanyama wa mwituni.
mt0: In 1968, the wildlife department declared the village of Marlem as a safe place for wild animals.

en: This makes the construction of roads, or any development work in this area, a rather complex issue.
swa: Hili linafanya ujenzi wa barabara au kazi yoyote ya maendeleo katika eneo hili kuwa na ugumu wa kutekeleza.
mt0: This makes road construction or any other development work in this area difficult to accomplish.

en: According to reports, an underground power cabling project for carrying electricity to the area had been initially approved, but when digging work commenced, it was soon halted following objections coming from the state Forest Department.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa,  ni kwamba mpango wa kupitisha mkongo wa umeme aridhini ili uweze kufika eneo hilo ulishapitishwa lakini ulizuiwa hivi karibuni kutokana na mapingamizi kutoka kwa Idara ya Misitu ya Taifa
mt0: According to the report, a plan to establish a power line to connect the site to the electricity system had been approved but was blocked recently due to opposition from the National Forest Service.

en: Another source of frustration for the local population is the absence of proper roads.
swa: Chanzo kingine cha mahangaiko ya wakazi wa hapa ni ukosefu wa barabara nzuri.
mt0: The other reason for the problems of the people here is the lack of good roads.

en: One has to navigate a 2.8 km unpaved and broken road to reach the first household at Marlem from the main road.
swa: Mtu anatakiwa kusafiri  kutoka barabara kuu umbali wa kilomita 2.8 katika barabara mbaya na ambayo haijasafishwa vizuri ili aweze kukuta nyumba ya kwanza katika kijiji cha Marlem.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. A person has to travel from the main road 2.8 km on a rough and unpaved road to find the first house in Marlem.

en: Finally, the supply of electricity and safe drinking water remain a challenge for the villagers.
swa: Mwisho kabisa, usambazaji wa umeme na maji safi na salama kwa wanakijiji vimebaki kuwa changamoto kwa wanakijiji.
mt0: Finally, the supply of electricity and safe water to the villagers has remained a problem for the villagers.

en: Having publicly and repeatedly voiced their complaints, but failing to get any answers, the residents of Marlem, as well as residents from two other villages decided not to vote in the elections in order to draw the attention of the authorities towards their issues.
swa: Pamoja na kuweka malalamiko yao hadharani mara kwa mara, lakini wameshindwa kupata majibu ya mahitaji yao, wakazi wa Marlem pamoja na wakazi kutoka katika vijiji vingine viwili waliamua kutokupiga kura ili kuvuta masikio ya mamlaka dhidi ya masuala yao wanayoyalalamikia.
mt0: Although they have repeatedly submitted their complaints, but they have not received their needs, the Marlem residents and the other two villagers decided not to vote to silence the government on their concerns.

en: Polling officials came to talk to us, but our decision of not to vote, still stands, added Pandurang.
swa: Wafanyakazi wa tume ya uchaguzi walikuja kuongea nasi kuhusu uamuzi wetu wa kutokupiga kura na msimamo wetu uko pale pale, aliongeza Pandurang.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate the sentence. If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Isidore Fernandes, an opposition (Indian National Congress) member of the legislative assembly of Cancona, also met the locals.
swa: Isidore Fernandes, kiongozi wa upinzani kutoka chama cha (Indian National Congress) ambaye ni mbunge katika bunge la Cancona, pia alikutana na wakazi wa eneo hilo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Isidore Fernandes, a opposition leader from the Indian National Congress, a member of the Cancona Parliament, also met with the local people.

en: After hearing the grievances he assured his support in favour of their agitation.
swa: Baada ya kusikiliza kero zao alieahakikishia kuwa atawasaidia kushughulikia jamjo hilo.
mt0: After listening to their complaints he assured them that he would help them deal with the problem.

en: It is important for any government to provide road, water, and electricity to people.
swa: Ni muhimu kwa serikali yoyote kutengeneza barabara, kusambaza umeme na maji kwa ajili ya watu wao.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. It's important for any government to build roads, provide electricity and water to its people.

en: Till now, all government officials have neglected these facilities in Marlem Village, stated Fernandes.
swa: Mpaka sasa maafida wote wa serikali wamepuuza kutoa huduma hizi katika kijiji cha Marlem, alisema   Fernandes.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Boycotting elections is now becoming a way of protest, although voting is not mandatory in India.
swa: Kususia uchaguzi sasa imekuwa kama njia mojawapo ya mgomo, ingawa kupiga kura sio lazima katika nchi ya India.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Apart from Goa, villages in the central state of Madhya Pradesh, the western state of  Maharashtra, and the eastern state of Odisha are employing this method in order to get pressing issues addressed by the authorities in charge.
swa: Tofauti ya kijiji cha Goa, vijiji vilivyo katika jimbo la Kati Madhya Pradesh, Magharibi jimbo la Maharashtra, na Mashariki jimbo la Odisha wamekuwa wakitumia mbinu hii ili kuweza kufikisha mambo yao muhimu mbele ya viongozi wa mamlaka zinazohusika.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: So far, none of those boycotts seem to have translated into action on the side of government.
swa: Hata hivyo, hakuna mgomo wowowte kati ya hii ambao umechukuliwa hatua na serikali.
mt0: But, no one of these strikes has been taken into account by the government.

en: Ultimately, voters are adopting such tactics as a show of frustration towards officials and politicians who often reach out to neglected communities only before elections, in hope of securing their votes, but fail to deliver once the elections are over.
swa: Wapiga kura wengi wameanza kuzoea kutumia mbinu hii kama ishara ya kuonesha hasira zao kwa wanasiasa na maofisa wa serikali ambao huzigeukia jamii walizozitelekeza katika kipindi cha uchaguzi wakiwa ma matumaini ya kupata kura zao, huku wakishindwa kutekeleza ahadi zao baada ya uchaguzi.
mt0: Many voters have become accustomed to using this method as a way to show their anger at politicians and government officials who often turn to their communities with hopes of winning their vote, but fail to fulfill their promises after the election.

en: In the end, if boycotting elections does not heed changes in society, what else can members of neglected communities do to get the attention of those supposed to hear them and take proper action?
swa: Lakini mwishowe, kama Kugomea chaguzi haitaleta mabadiliko katika jamii, je ni kitu gani wanajamii wataamua kufanya ili kuvuta masikio ya wenye mamlaka ambao wanapaswa kusikia sauti zao na kuchukua hatua za utekelezaji?
mt0: But finally, if refusing to vote doesn't bring about a change in the society, what will the citizens decide to do to lure the authorities who should hear their voices and take action?

en: Journalists Amade Abubacar and Germano Adriano, who were detained earlier this year while covering the military conflict in northern Mozambique, were released pending trial on 23 April, 2019.
swa: Waandishi wa Habari Amade Abubacar na  Germano Adriano, ambao waliokamatwa mapema mwaka huu wakati wakikusanya habari za mgogoro wa kijeshi  katika ukanda wa Kaskazini mwa Msumbiji, wameachiliwa huru bila kushtakiwa mnamo tarehe 23 April,  2019.
mt0: If you can't translate the translation simply say you don't know.

en: Amade, who contributes to various local media outlets including Zitamar News and A Carta, was detained on 5 January while he interviewed internally displaced people in the Macomia district of Cabo Delgado, a northern province of the country.
swa: Amade, ambaye amekuwa akichangia habari katika vyanzo mbali mbali vya habari vikiwamo Zitamar News na A Carta, aliwekwa kizuizini tarehe 5 Januari wakati akifanya mahojiano na wakimbizi wa ndani kutoka katika wilaya ya Macomia katika jimbo la Kaskazini mwa nchi, Cabo Delgado.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Germano, a reporter for the local community radio Nacedje, disappeared on 6 February and was found to have been detained on 18 February.
swa: Germano, ambaye ni mwandishi wa habari wa kituo cha redio ya jamii cha Nacedje, alipotea tangu Februari 6 na alipatikana akiwa kizuizini tarehe 18, Februari.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know Germano, a journalist at the Nacedje Community Radio station, has been missing since February 6 and was found in custody on February 18.

en: According to the Media Institute of Southern Africa (MISA), Amade and Germano were charged with spreading defamatory messages against members of the Mozambican Armed Defence Forces via a Facebook account that announced attacks which occurred in villages in the district of Macomia.
swa: Kulingana na taarifa kutoka kwa Shirikisho la Vyombo Vya Habari Kusini Mwa Afrika(MISA), Amade na Germano walishtakiwa kwa kueneza habari za kuwachafua baadhi ya viongozi wa Jeshi la Wananchi wa Msumbiji kupitia kurasa zao za Facebook ambapo walitangaza kuanza kwa mapigano yaliyotokea katika vijiji vya wilaya ya Macomia.
mt0: According to South African Press Association (MISA), Amade and Germano were charged with spreading rumors about a clash between soldiers and activists on Facebook which announced the beginning of a fighting in the communities of Macomia.

en: The journalists were released from the provincial jail of Mieze in Pemba, Cabo Delgados capital, and will be on probation as they await trial before the provincial judicial court of Cabo Delgado.
swa: Wanahabari hao waliachiliwa huru kutoka katika gereza la  Mieze huko Pemba, makao makuu ya Cabo Delgado na wapo katika kipindi cha uangalizi wakati wakisubiri kushtakiwa katika mahakama ya hakimu mkazi huko Cabo Delgado.
mt0: These journalists were released from the Mieze prison in Pemba, the capital of Cabo Delgado and are in custody while they wait for their trial in the Cabo Delgado Crown Court.

en: Their first hearing is scheduled for 17 May.
swa: Kesi imepangwa kusikilizwa kwa mara ya kwanza hapo Mei 17.

en: Since 2017, groups armed with knives have carried out attacks on villages in Cabo Delgado, burning houses and decapitating residents.

en: Since our Iran coverage aims to bridge the divide that exists between external perspectives on Iran and the actual country itself, Global Voices Iran has started a series of interviews with various Iranian journalists and writers who practice this role.

en: These interviews are done to understand how and why these figures, who make a career out of communicating the intricacies and complexities of a country riddled with contradictions, explain Iran to non-Iranians.

en: On the difficulties of covering a country he has an emotional attachment for, Saeed explains:
swa: Katika magumu ya kuiandikia nchi ambayo anafungamana nayo kihisia, Saeed anafafanua kwamba:
mt0: In the difficulties of writing to a country he is emotionally connected to, Saeed explains that:

en: As an Iranian I have an emotional attachment to the country, but when Im writing news I step back and try to be impartial.
swa: Kama mu-Irani nina hisia zangu juu ya nchi, lakini ninapoandika habari zake huwa ninajaribu kukaa pembeni kidogo ili kuondoa upendeleo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: But Im allowed to express my opinion when I write op-eds, and Ive also done that sort of thing.
swa: Lakini ninaruhusiwa kuelezea mawazo yangu wakati nikiandika habari za kinyume na nimekuwa nikifanya kitu kama hicho.
mt0: But I am allowed to express my opinions when I write against the truth and I have been doing that.

en: I wrote about why Canada is getting it wrong on Iran, which led to the then Canadian foreign minister accusing me on Twitter of working for the Iranian authorities.
swa: Niliandika kuhusu ni kwa nini Canada waliielewa Irani vibaya na hii ilipelekea waziri wa mambo ya nje wa wakati huo kunituhumu kupitia ukurasa wake wa Tweeter kuwa natumiwa na mamlaka za Irani.
mt0: I wrote about why Canada misunderstood Iran and this led to the former foreign minister accusing me on his Twitter account of being used by Iran.

en: Ive been attacked by some people who accuse me of working for the Iranians and by others who accuse me of working for the Brits.
swa: Nimekuwa nikishambuliwa na baadhi ya watu ambao wamekuwa wakinituhumu kuwa natumikishwa na wa-Irani na wengine wamekuwa wakinituhumu kuitumikia Uingereza.
mt0: I've been attacked by some people who have accused me of being used by Iranians and others of being used by the UK.

en: I hope thats a sign Im doing my job right!
swa: Ninaamini hii ni ishara ya kuwa ninaifanya kazi yangu ipasavyo.
mt0: I believe this is a sign that I'm doing my job appropriately.

en: Omid Memarian: To turn that explosive anger into something constructive, to put it into perspective and not take it personally, is an art.

mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know Omid Memarian: Making your anger something to build and not taking it personally is a painting.

en: Omid Memarian, an Iranian journalist living in New York.

mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you can't translate simply say you don't know Omid Memarian, an Iranian journalist living in New York.

en: Omid Memarian was formerly a widely read journalist inside Iran, and now works in the United States covering Iranian news for both English and Persian speaking audiences.
swa: Omid Memarian ni mwandishi wa zamani aliyesomwa sana huko Irani na sasa anafanya kazi Marekani na amekuwa akiandika habari za Irani kwa watumiaji wa lugha zote za Kiingereza na Kiajemi.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. Omid Memarian is an ancient writer who was very popular in Iran and now works in the United States and has been writing about Iran for readers of both English and Persian.

en: Our interview with him explores the nuances of covering Iran for different audiences, and his experiences as a journalist both inside Iran and out.
swa: Mahojiano yetu yalitaka kufahamu utofauti katika kuandika habari kuhusu Irani kwa watumiaji wa lugha tofauti tofauti na uzoefu wake kama mwanahabari wa ndani na nje ya Irani.
mt0: The interview was aimed at understanding the differences in writing about Iran in different languages and his experience as an Iranian journalist.

en: Read more: Iranian Journalist Omid Memarian

en: Memarian describes his experience writing and reporting on civil society as a journalist in Iran:
swa: Memarian anaelezea uzoefu wake wa kuandika na kuripotia katika jumuiya ya kijamii nchini Irani kama ifuatavyo:
mt0: Memarian describes his experience of writing and reporting in the Islamic society in Iran as follows:

en: There were, and still are, people in Iran who believe that by empowering civil society organizations, political parties and independent media, the Islamic Republic might change gradually from within.
swa: Kulikuwapo na bado wapo watu ndani ya Irani ambao wanaamini kuziwezesha jumuiya za kijamii,vyama vya siasa na uhuru wa habari, serikali ya kiislamu inaweza kubadilika polepole kwa kuanzia ndani.
mt0: There are still people in Iran who believe that by allowing society, politics and freedom of press, the Islamic government can slowly change from the inside out.

en: On the other side, there are forces trying to prove them wrong, and one way to do so is by making the environment so threatening that no one dare stay active in the field.
swa: Kwa upande mwingine kuna nguvu nyingine zinazopambana kuthibitisha kuwa hilo haliwezekani na njia mojawapo ni kuyafanya mazingira kuwa hatarishi kiasi kwamba hakuna mtu atadhubutu kubaki akifanya alichokuwa anakifanya.
mt0: In the other hand, there are other forces fighting to prove that this is not possible and one way to do this is to make the environment so dangerous that no one will dare to continue doing what he is doing.

en: When I insisted on continuing to what I was doing, writing and promoting the things I believed in, I was arrested and thrown into jail.
swa: Niliposisitiza kuendelea kufanya nilichokuwa nafanya, kuandika nankuhamasisha kuhusu vitu nilivyokuwa naamini nilikamatwa na kutupwa gerezani.
mt0: I kept on doing what I was doing, writing and encouraging people about things I believed I was being held in prison.

en: Hooman Majd: Iran is not uniquely paradoxical: what's unique is that most people dont know about Iran.
swa: Hooman Majd: Irani haina utofauti wa kipekee: upekee hapa ni kuwa watu wengi hawafahamu mengi kuhusu Irani.
mt0: If you cannot translate, just say you don't know.

en: We are now at a turning point in US foreign policy.
swa: Sasa tupo katika hatua za marejeo ya sera za nje za nchi ya Marekani.
mt0: We are in the phase of rewriting the US foreign policy.

en: Weeks away from the end of the Obama presidency, there is a strong possibility that the US is moving away from the defining project of rapprochement with its long-time foe, the Islamic Republic of Iran.
swa: Majuma kadhaa kuelekea ukingoni mwa utawala wa Obama, kuna uwezekano mkubwa Marekani ikaachana na mradi wake mkubwa wa muda mrefu wa maelewano na adui yake wa muda mrefu, jamuhuri ya Kiislamu ya Irani.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know A few weeks to the end of Obama's presidency, there is a good chance that the United States will abandon its long-running peace project with its long-time enemy, the Islamic Republic of Iran.

en: At the dawn of the Donald Trump presidency, which is slated to be a peculiar shade of hardline and hawkish Republicanism, I thought it a timely moment to sit down with journalist and author Hooman Majd.
swa: Katika mawio ya Uraisi wa Donald Trump yanayoonesha yatakuwa ya kipekee yenye uvuli wa magumu na jamuhuri ya kikatili, ninafikiri ni wakati wa kukaa chini na wanahabari na mtunzi Hooman Majd.
mt0: In the remarks of Donald Trump's presidency that show that it will be a unique display of hardship and violence, I think it's time to sit down with journalists and singer Hooman Majd.

en: His books, articles and commentary explaining the paradoxes of Iran became widely featured in the American mainstream media during the Bush era, when hawkish rhetoric against the Iranian government became a hallmark of the early 2000s foreign policy and media depictions of Iran.
swa: Vitabu vyake, makala na machapisho yake yanafafanua kitendawili cha Irani ambayo kwa upana yameonekana katika vyombo vikubwa vya habari vya Marekani katika kipindi cha Bush, wakati wa ukatili dhidi ya serikali ya Irani ilipogeuka kuwa alama kuu mwanzoni mwa miaka ya 2000 katika sera za nje na mtazamo wa vyombo vya habari dhidi ya Irani.
mt0: These books, articles and publications explain the iranian crisis that has appeared widely in the major American media during the Bush era, when the iranian government's violence against the government became a key element in the US foreign policy and the media's view of Iran.

en: Hooman Majd has been known to be the voice of Iran to the western world.
swa: Hooman Majd amekuwa akijulikana kama sauti ya Irani kwa nchi za Magharibi.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: On whether misconceptions on Iran have lessoned since his 2008 book that aimed to dispel misconceptions about Iranian society to American audiences:
swa: Kama mtazamo mbaya dhidi ya Irani umeleta somo tangu kutoka kwa kitabu chake mwaka 2008 kilicholenga kupinga mitazamo mibaya kuhusu jamii ya wa-Irani kwa wasomaji wa Marekani:
mt0: If the negative view of Iran has been a lesson since his 2008 book aimed at fighting negative views about the Iranian people to American readers:

en: Ahmadinejad was the first to make himself available to the media, which is the source of a lot of the negativity.
swa: Ahmadinejad ndiye alikuwa wa kwanza kuwa wazi kwa vyombo vya habari, ambavyo ndio chanzo cha kwanza kabisa cha habari hasi.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. Ahmadinejad was the first to be open to the press, which is the first source of negative news.

en: But Iranian-Americans and Iranian-Europeans have written a lot about the culture in the recent years, and there's a lot more travel between Iran and the US, among both Iranian-Americans and Iranians themselves.
swa: Lakini wa-Irani wenye asili ya Marekani na wa-Irani wenye asili ya Ulaya wameandika sana kuhusu utamaduni wao katika siku za hivi karibuni, na pia kuna safari nyingi sana kati ya Irani na Marekani baina na wa-Irani wenye asili ya Marekani na wa-Irani asilia.
mt0: But the American and European Iranians have written a lot about their culture in the last few years, and there are also a lot of trips between Iran and the United States between the American and the European Iranians.

en: They are understanding it a little bit better and there have been a number of books.
swa: Kwa sasa wanauelewa mzuri kidogo na kuna vitabu vingi kidogo.
mt0: They have a little knowledge now and there are few books.

en: Iran is not uniquely paradoxical: what's unique is that most people dont know about Iran.
swa: Irani sio kitendawili cha kipekee: lakini kilicho cha pekee ni kuwa watu wengi hawafahamu mengi kuhusu Irani.
mt0: Iran is not a unique entity: but what is unique is that most people don't know much about Iran.

en: On May 15, thousands of Brazilians took to the streets in all 26 states and the Federal District against the Bolsonaro government's slashing of federal funds to education that will affect dozens of universities and schools.
swa: Hapo Mei 15, maelfu ya Wabrazili waliingia mitaani katika majimbo yote 26 wakiandamana kuipinga serikali ya Bolsonaro kukata fedha za elimu ambapo itaathiri mamia ya shule na vyuo.
mt0: In May 15, thousands of Brazilians went to the streets in all 26 states to protest the government's plan to cut education funding which will affect thousands of schools and colleges.

en: At the end of April, Brazil's government announced cuts of 30 percent on a so-called discretionary budget, which goes towards expenses such as electricity, water, general maintenance, and research.
swa: Mwishoni mwa mwezi Aprili, serikali ya Brazili ilitangaza kukata kiasi cha asilimia 30 ya kile kinachosemekana ni bajeti ambayo ilikuwa kwa ajili ya gharama za maji, umeme, uendeshaji wa jumla pamoja na tafiti.
mt0: Last month, Brazil announced a reduction of 30% of what it claimed was a budget which was supposed to cover water, electricity, general maintenance and research.

en: When considering the total federal budget for higher education, the cuts would amount to around 3,5 percent.
swa: Wakati ukifiria kuwa jumla ya bajeti kuu ya serikali kwa ajili ya elimu ya juu, makato hayo yanaweza kufikia mpaka asilimia tatu au 5.
mt0: If you think that the total government budget for higher education is 3% or 5%, then these rates can reach up to 3% or 5%.

en: Besides, the government has suspended funds for 3,500 publicly-funded postgraduate scholarships.
swa: Hata hivyo, serikali imefuta udhamini kwa wanafunzi wa elimu za juu wapatao 3,500 waliokuwa wakidhaminiwa na serikali..
mt0: But the government has withdrawn funding for 3,500 high school students who were being supported by the government.

en: From Paulista Avenue in São Paulo, a traditional gathering spot for protests, to far away indigenous lands in Alto Rio Negro, near the border with Colombia, people went out to defend their public education.
swa: Kuanzia mtaa wa Paulista huko São Paulo, kituo cha makutano ya maandamano cha kimila mpaka kwenye mashamba ya asili huko Alto Rio Negro, karibu ma mpaka wa Colombia, watu walitoka kwenda kutetea elimu ya umma.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know

mt0: In Viçosa, Minas Gerais, a group of 5,000 people gathered under a blanket while heavy rain was falling.

en: Brazil has 69 federal universities and a large number of state universities, all offering undergraduate and postgraduate education completely free of tuition, and several community-oriented services such as extension courses, legal assistance offices, and hospitals.
swa: Brazili inayo vyuo vya umma 69 na idadi kubwa ya vyuo vikuu vya serikali na vyote vinatoa shahada ya kwanza na shahada ya uzamili bure kabisa bila kulipia ada na baadhi ya huduma za kijamii kama vile ofisi za ushauri wa kisheria na hospitali.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. Brazil has 69 public universities and a large number of state universities and all of them offer degrees of first and graduate degrees free of charge and some social services such as legal advice offices and hospitals.

en: Initially, the cuts would apply to only three federal universities, but they were later extended to the entire federal network.
swa: Awali, makato hayo yalikuwa yafanyike katika vyuo vitatu lakini baadayr yaliendelezwa kwa vyuo vingine vyote.
mt0: Initially, the rates were to be applied to three schools but later they were widened to all schools.

en: Bolsonaro's Education Minister Abraham Weintraub says that they're not cuts but a contingency of expenses.
swa: Waziri wa elimu wa Bolsonaro, Abraham Weintraub alisema kuwa hayo sio makato bali ni kubana matumizi.
mt0: Return only if you cannot translate. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Weintraub has justified the cuts because public universities are places of mayhem.
swa: Weintraub alieleza kuwa kuna makato kwa sababu vyuo vya umma ni kama sehemu ya uharibifu.
mt0: Weintraub said there were cuts because public schools were like a wasteland.

en: When asked by reporters to name examples of such mayhem, he mentioned the presence of social movements in campuses, and parties with naked people.
swa: Alipoulizwa na wanahabari aleleze mifano ya huo uharibifuWhen alitaja uwepo wa mikusanyiko mikubwa ya kijamii vyuoni na pia uwepo wa sherehe za watu walio uchi.
mt0: When asked by journalists he cited examples of the damage when he mentioned large social events at colleges and the existence of naked parties.

en: Weintraub was appointed as minister in early April after his short-lived predecessor's administration became involved in a series of controversies.
swa: Weintraub aliteuliwa kuwa waziri mapema mwezi Aprili baada ya aliyemtangulia kukaa kwa muda kidogo kuondolewa kwa sababu ya kuhusishwa na baadhi ya migogoro.
mt0: Weintraub was appointed as the first minister in April after the previous minister who was serving a short term was sacked for being involved in some disputes.

en: The new minister often voices rightwing conspiracy theories, such as that crack cocaine was introduced in Brazil as part of a communist plot, and that he wants to erase cultural Marxism from universities.
swa: Waziri huyu mpya mara zote amekuwa akitoa maoni yanayowiana na sera za mrengo wa kulia kama vile madawa ya kulevya yalitambulishwa Brazili kama mkakati wa wakomunisti, na anataka kufuta utamaduni wa U-Marx vyuoni..
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know This new minister has always given opinions that are consistent with left-wing policy, such as drugs were presented in Brazil as a communistic policy, and he wants to erase Marxism in schools.

en: Some university deans have said that the cuts might impede them from opening their doors as early as the second semester of 2019.

mt0: Some universities have said that the cuts could prevent them from opening their doors early in the second half of 2019.

en: Women journalists carry the double burden of gender-based abuse online in addition to potential threats related to political reporting.

en: In November 2016, Ugandan journalist Joy Doreen Biira, who was working at the privately-owned Kenya Television Network (KTN) in Kenya, returned home to Uganda for a traditional ceremony.
swa: Mnamo Novemba 2016, mwandishi wa habari wa Uganda, Joy Doreen Biira, aliyekuwa akifanya kazi katika televisheni binafsi ya Kenya Television Network (KTN) nchini Kenya, alirejea nyumbani Uganda kwa ajili ya sherehe ya kitamaduni.
mt0: In November 2016, Ugandan journalist Joy Doreen Biira, who was working for the Kenyan private television network (KTN) in Kenya, returned home to Uganda for a cultural festival.

en: While Biira was home, Ugandan security forces clashed with members of the traditional Rwenzururu kingdom in the Rwenzori region of western Uganda, and their palace was burned to the ground.
swa: Wakati Biira akiwa kwao, vikosi vya usalama vya Uganda vilipambana na walinzi wa ufalme wa Rwenzururu katika mkoa wa Rwenzori magharibi mwa Uganda, na ikulu yao ikateketezwa kwa moto.
mt0: When Biira was at home, Ugandan security forces fought with the garrison of the reigning kingdom of Rwenzururu in the province of Rwenzori in the eastern Uganda, and their palace was burned down by fire.

en: The gunbattle resulted in 62 deaths, including 16 policemen.
swa: Mapambano hayo ya kufyatuliana risasi yalisababisha vifo vya watu 62, wakiwemo polisi 16.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know.

en: Its so sad what Ive witnessed today with my own eyes  part of the palace of the kingdom Im from, the Rwenzururu Kingdom, burning down.
swa: Inasikitisha sana kile nilichokishuhudia leo kwa macho yangu mwenyewe  sehemu ya jumba la ufalme huko nitokako, Ufalme wa Rwenzururu, likiteketea kwa moto.
mt0: I was so shocked to see today my own eyes a part of the palace where I live, the Kingdom of the Lost, burning down.

en: It felt like watching your heritage deplete before my eyes.
swa: Nilijihisi kana kwamba nilikuwa nikitizama urithi ukiangamizwa mbele ya macho yangu.
mt0: I felt like I was watching the legacy being destroyed before my eyes.

en: That same day, Biira was arrested and accused of circulating graphic photos of the aftermath of a deadly battle between security forces and the regional kings royal guard of the Rwenzururu kingdom  to a widely subscribed WhatsApp group, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ).

mt0: The same day, Biira was arrested and accused of spreading graphic pictures of the awful fighting between security forces and the guards of the king of Rwenzururu to a WhatsApp group with many members, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPIJ).

en: This article is part of a series called The identity matrix: platform regulation of online threats to expression in Africa.These posts interrogate identity-driven online hate speech or discrimination based on language or geographic origin, misinformation and harassment (particularly against female activists and journalists) prevalent in digital spaces of seven African countries: Algeria, Cameroon, Ethiopia, Nigeria, Sudan, Tunisia and Uganda.
swa: Makala haya ni sehemu ya mfululizo unaoitwa Jedwali la Utambulisho: Jukwaa la kudhibiti vitisho vya mtandaoni dhidi ya uhuru wa kujieleza barani Afrika, Machapisho haya yanahoji kauli za chuki zenye utambulisho au kubagua kwa misingi ya lugha au asili ya kijiografia, habari potovu na udhalilishwaji (haswa dhidi ya wanaharakati wanawake na waandishi wa habari) uliokithiri mtandaoni katika nchi saba za Kiafrika: Algeria, Kamerun, Ethiopia, Nigeria, Sudani, Tunisia na Uganda.
mt0: This article is part of a series called the Identity Table: A platform to control online threats against freedom of expression in Africa, which addresses racist or homophobic remarks, false information and bullying (especially against women and journalists) that have been widespread on the internet in seven African countries: Algeria, Kamerun, Ethiopia, Nigeria, Sudan, Tunisia and Uganda.

en: The project is funded by the Africa Digital Rights Fund of The Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).
swa: Mradi huu umefadhiliwa na Mfuko wa Haki za Kidijitali wa Afrika wa shirika la Ushirikiano wa Sera za kimataifa za TEHAMA kwa ajili ya Mashariki na Kusini mwa Afrika (CIPESA).
mt0: This project is funded by the African Digital Rights Fund of the International Partnership for Internet Policy for the East and South Africa (CIPESA).

en: Editors note: This personal essay was written following a Twitter campaign organized by Global Voices sub-Saharan Africa and Rising Voices where each week, a different language activist shared their perspectives on the intersection of digital rights and African Languages  as part of the project, The identity matrix: Platform regulation of online threats to expression in Africa.

en: According to the United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO), linguistic and cultural diversity are of strategic importance for people around the world to strengthen the unity and cohesion of societies.
swa: Kulingana na shirika la Umoja wa Mataifa la Elimu, Sayansi na Utamaduni (UNESCO), utofauti wa lugha na utamaduni una umuhimu kimkakati kwa watu ulimwenguni kote katika juhudi za kuimarisha umoja na mshikamano wa jamii.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: This linguistic and cultural diversity propelled the UNESCO general conference to proclaim International Mother Language Day (IMLD) in November 1999, to be commemorated annually on February 21 annually.
swa: Utofauti huu wa lugha na utamaduni ulishinikiza kongamano kuu la UNESCO kutangaza Siku ya Kimataifa ya Lugha ya Mama (IMLD) mnamo Novemba 1999, siku inayokumbukuwa mnamo Februari 21 kila mwaka.
mt0: This difference in language and culture led to UNESCO's chief conference to declare the International Mother Language Day (IMLD) in November 1999, a day which is observed on February 21 every year.

en: To bolster IMLD, the United Nations (UN) declared the International Year of Indigenous Languages (IYIL 2019), to draw attention to the endangerment of the worlds indigenous languages.
swa: Kuimarisha IMLD, Umoja wa Mataifa (UN) ulitangaza Mwaka wa Kimataifa wa Lugha za Asili (IYIL 2019), ili kuzingatia hatari ya kuangamia kwa lugha za asili ulimwenguni.
mt0: Strengthening the IMLD, the United Nations (UN) has announced the International Year of Languages (IYIL 2019), to examine the danger of global decline of native languages.

en: Today, there are over 7,100 languages spoken around the world, 28 percent of which are spoken on the African continent alone.
swa: Hivi leo, kuna zaidi ya lugha 7,100 zinazozungumzwa kote duniani,asilimia 28 yazo zikizungumzwa barani Afrika pekee.
mt0: Today, there are over 7,100 languages spoken around the world, 28 percent of which are spoken in Africa.

en: Despite this, English dominates online spaces in the region.
swa: Licha ya hili, Kiingereza kinaongoza mtandaoni katika eneo hili.
mt0: However, English is the dominant language on the Internet. If you cannot translate it simply say you don't know.

en: Some twenty years ago, 80 percent of the worlds online content was English-centric.
swa: Miaka ishirini iliyopita, asilimia 80 ya maudhui ya dunia mtandaoni yalikuwa yanaegemea Kiingereza.
mt0: In the last 20 years, 80% of the world's online content was based on English.

en: Currently, however, English content online is said to have shrunk to between 51- 55 percent.
swa: Kwa sasa, hata hivyo, maudhui ya Kiingereza yanasemekana kupungua hadi kiwango cha kati ya asilimia 51 hadi 55.
mt0: But, at the moment, English content is reported to have fallen to a level between 51. and 55.

en: The million-dollar question, therefore, is: Could this sharp drop be an indicator that people now favor their native languages online over English, considering that less than 15 percent of the world population speaks English as their first language?
swa: Swala kizushi, kwa hivyo, ni:je, kupungua huku kunaashiria kuwa sasa watu wanapendelea lugha zao za asilia kuliko Kiingereza, ukizingatia kuwa ni chini ya asilimia 15 tu ya idadi ya watu duniani inayozungumza Kiingereza kama lugha yao ya kwanza?
mt0: The question is, therefore, whether this decline indicates that people are now preferred to speak their native languages over English, given that only 15 percent of the world's population speaks English as their first language?

en: Swahili is recognized as one of the official languages of the African Union (AU), alongside English, Portuguese, French, Spanish and Arabic.

en: Despite Swahili being the most widely spoken African language, with approximately 150 million speakers  mostly in East Africa, the Great Lakes region, southern Somalia, and some parts of Southern Africa, its visibility online is dismal.

en: John Walubengo, a lecturer at the Multimedia University of Kenya, states in an op-ed with the Nation, a Kenyan daily, that the absence of online linguistic and cultural diversity creates a society with a tunnel-vision view of the world.
swa: John Walubengo, mhadhiri wa Chuo Kikuu cha Multimedia cha Kenya, anachanganua kwenye makala yake katika Nation, jarida la kila siku nchini Kenya, kuwa ukosefu wa lugha na utamaduni mtandaoni unaunda jamii yenye mtazamo mdogo wa dunia.

en: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers
swa: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers.

en: (ICANN), a global multi-stakeholder organization that coordinates Internet Domain Name System (DNS), Internet Protocol (IP) addresses and autonomous system numbers, instituted the Internationalized Domain Names (IDNs) that enable people to use domain names in local languages and scripts.
swa: (ICANN),  shirika la kimataifa lenye wadau wengi linaloratibu Mfumo wa Majina ya Mtandao(DNS), Anwani za Mtandao (IP) na nambari za mfumo huru, lilianzisha Majina ya Kikoa ya Kimataifa (IDNs), yanayowezesha watu kutumia majina ya kikoa katika lugha na maandishi ya kiasili.Kiuhakika, huundwa kwa kutumia herufi kutoka maandishi tofauti, kama vile Kiarabu, Kichina, au Kisiriliki.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know (ICANN), a global organization with many partners that coordinates the DNS system, Internet Protocol address (IP) and free system numbers, has created International Domain Name (IDN) which allows people to use IDNs in languages and native texts. IDNs are created using characters from different languages, such as Arabic, Chinese, or Spanish.

en: Ideally, they are formed using characters from different scripts, such as Arabic, Chinese, or Cyrillic.These are then encoded by the Unicode standard and used as allowed by relevant IDN protocols, a set of standards defined by the Internet Architecture Board (IAB), and its subsidiary groups; the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) and the Internet Research Task Force (IRTF).
swa: Herufi hizi kisha husimbwa na kiwango cha Unicode na kutumiwa kama inavyoruhusiwa na vikoa vya IDN, seti ya viwango vilivyoainishwa na Bodi ya Usanifu wa Mtandao (IAB), na vikundi vyake vya kampuni ndogo; Tume ya Kazi ya Uhandisi wa Mtandao (IETF) na Tume ya Utafiti wa Mtandao (IRTF).

en: UASG is a community-based team of industry leaders, supported by ICANN, that prepares online communities for the next billion internet users.

en: This is achieved through a process known as Universal Acceptance (UA) that ensures that internet applications and systems treat all top-level domains (TLDs) and emails based on those domains in a consistent manner  including those in non-Latin-based languages and those that are more than three characters long.
swa: Huku kunafanikishwa kupitia mchakato unaojulikana kama Ukubalikaji Ulimwenguni (UA), ambao huhakikisha kwamba programu na mifumo ya mtandao inashughulikia vikoa vyote vya viwango cha juu (TLDs) na barua pepe kulingana na vikoa hivyo kwa njia thabiti  pamoja na vile vilivyoko kwenye maandishi yasiyo ya Kilatini na vile ambavyo ni zaidi ya herufi tatu.
mt0: This is achieved through a process called Global Acceptance (UA), which ensures that programs and systems on the Internet are able to handle all high-level domains (TLDs) and emails based on these domains in a consistent way, including those in non-Latin characters and those with more than three characters.

en: UA serves digital natives around the world in their local languages and with domain names that better align with their cultural identities.

en: KCN is the first community network to pilot the use of television white space (TVWS), a wireless technology that employs unused parts of the radio spectrum in the 470 to 790 MHz frequency band  to address internet connectivity in rural Tanzania.

KCN is the first network to test the TVWS broadcast technology, a technology which does not connect to a cable that uses unused radio frequencies in the range of 470 to 790 MHz to solve the problem of rural Internet connections in Tanzania.

en: KCN trains the rural populace to create and host local content thats befitting to their context.

en: The activists will tweet in African languages like Bambara, Igbo, Khoekhoe, N|uu, Swahili, Yorùbá, in addition to French and English.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. The activists will tweet in African languages such as Bambara, Igbo, Khoekhoe, N|uu, Swahili, Yoruba, and French and English.

en: They will also share their personal experiences and insights using a language lens on challenges and threats to digital rights.
swa: Pia wataweza kutushirikisha uzoefu na uelewa wao binafsi kwa mtazamo wa lugha kuhusu changamoto zinazotishia haki za kidijitali.
mt0: They can also share their experience and knowledge in linguistic terms about the challenges facing digital rights.

en: The conversations will interrogate how threats to net neutrality marginalize digital content in African languages; the expansion of mis- and disinformation in African languages on various digital platforms and what companies or civil society are doing about it; the effects of a lack of affordable internet connectivity in places where there are large communities of speakers of an African language; the importance of and challenges for the right to access information in digital spaces in African languages.
swa: Mazungumzo hayo yatahoji namna gani tishio la kutoegemea upande wowote mtandaoni linavyoathiri maudhui ya mtandaoni kwenye lugha za Kiafrika; uenezaji wa taarifa potovu katika lugha za Kiafrika kwenye lugha tofauti mtandaoni na kile kinachofanywa na makampuni au mashirika ya kijamii kuhusiana na hili; athari za ukosekanaji wa mtandao wa bei nafuu katika maeneo yaliyo na jamii kubwa za wazungumzaji wa lugha ya Kiafrika; umuhimu wa na changamoto za haki ya kupata taarifa katika lugha za kidijitali a Kiafrika.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The debate will examine how the threat of censorship affects the content of the Internet in African languages; the spread of racist messages in African languages on the Internet and what companies or social organizations do about this; the impact of the lack of affordable internet access in areas with a large African population; the importance and challenges of the right to access information in African digital languages.

en: They will also look at corporate policies, as well as ongoing challenges that may affect how citizens can freely express themselves in their language.
swa: Vile vile, wataangazia suala la sera za mashirika, na pia changamoto zinazoendelea kuwepo zenye uwezo wa kuathiri jinsi raia wanavyoweza kujielezea huru katika lugha yao.
mt0: They will also look at the issue of corporate policies, as well as the challenges that are remaining that can affect the ability of citizens to express themselves freely in their own language.

en: Witaba is a writer, local content developer and advocate, trainer, researcher, and consultant in Internet Governance and policy matters.

en: In the early morning of November 15, 2017, Zimbabweans woke up to the news that former strongman, the late Robert Mugabe, had been deposed in a coup d'etat, and was under house arrest with his family at the presidential residence, State House.
swa: Mapema asubuhi ya Novemba 15, 2017, raia wa Zimbabwe waliamka na habari zilizoenea kwamba aliyekuwa mbabe, marehemu Robert Mugabe, alikuwa amengolewa madarakani katika mapinduzi ya serikali, na alikuwa nguvuni kwenye makazi yake, Ikulu, pamoja na familia yake.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know On November 15, 2017, Zimbabweans woke up with reports that the ex-leader, Robert Mugabe, had been removed from power in a government coup, and was locked up in his residence, the palace, and his family.

en: Major General Sibusiso Moyo, now foreign affairs minister, announced on state television that the president was safe under state custody and that the situation has moved to another level.
swa: Meja Jenerali Sibusiso Moyo, ambaye kwa sasa ni waziri wa mambo ya nje, alitangaza kwenye runinga ya taifa kuwa rais huyo alikuwa salama chini ya ulinzi wa serikali na kwamba hali ya mambo iko katika ngazi nyingine.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Almost immediately following General Moyos announcement, Zimbabweans fervently took to social media  in particular, WhatsApp, Twitter and Facebook  to get updates on the situation.

mt0: Just after the announcement of General Moyo, Zimbabweans flooded social media, including WhatsApp, Twitter and Facebook, to get a new update on the situation.

en: This newfound popularity of social media to access information and mobilise protests took root for the first time among Zimbabweans, when protesters took to the streets and helped push Mugabe out of office.

mt0: For the first time, the new popularity of social media to enable access to information and encourage protests spread among Zimbabwean citizens, when protesters entered the streets and helped to encourage Mugabe's resignation.

mt0: As a former national security minister, Mnangagwa also recognized the importance and role of lying in Zimbabwean politics.

en: In a calculated move to consolidate newfound political power and ensure an electoral victory during the presidential and legislative elections scheduled for next year, Mnangagwa instructed his ruling ZANU PF (Zimbabwe African National Union-Patriotic Front) party youth league to enter the social media and online firmament and batter the opponent, back in March 2018.
swa: Mnamo mwezi Machi, 2018, kwa kutambua mara na ili kujitwalia mamlaka ya kisiasa yaliyojianika mbele yake na ili kuhakikisha ushindi katika uchaguzi wa rais na wabunge katika mwaka uliofuatia, Mnangagwa aliamuru umoja wa vijana wa chama tawala cha  ZANU PF (Zimbabwe National Union-Patriotic Front) kujimwaga katika mitandao ya kijamii na mtandaoni na kuwachafua na kuwashambulia wapinzani.
mt0: In March 2018, to recognize and to secure the political powers which were established before him and to ensure a victory in the next election and parliament, Mnangagwa ordered the ZANU PF (Zimbabwe National Union-Patriotic Front) youth movement to spread across social media and online to denigrate and attack opponents.

en: In post-Mugabe Zimbabwe, this has exacerbated a mis- and disinformation crisis, leaving Zimbabweans with few credible and accurate sources of information to stay informed about the countrys transition and and anti-government protests.
swa: Katika Zimbabwe baada ya Mugabe, mpango wake huu umeimarisha mgogoro wa upotoshaji na utoaji taarifa zisizo za kweli, na hivyo kuwaacha Wazimbabwe na vyanzo vichache tu vya kuaminika vya kupata habari na kujua kuhusu yanayoendelea katika kipindi cha mpito na maandamano ya kupinga serikali.
mt0: If you can't translate this, just say you don't know In Zimbabwe after Mugabe, this plan has created a crisis of lying and false reports, leaving Zimbabweans with few reliable sources of information and knowledge about what is happening in the transition period and protests against the government.

en: While the new government decried fake news pertaining to any news circulated on social media that they perceived to threaten the countrys status quo, it also deployed tactics aimed at misleading the public about its handling of anti-government protests.

en: The internet penetration rate increased by 41.1 percent, from 11 percent of the population to 52.1 percent between 2010 and 2018, while mobile phone penetration increased by 43.8 percent from 58.8 percent to 102.7 percent over the same period.
swa: Kiwango cha kuenea kwa intaneti kiliongezeka kwa asilimia 41.1, kutoka asilimia 11 ya idadi ya watu hadi asilimia 52.1 kati ya 2010 na 2018, wakati kuenea kwa simu za mkononi kuliongezeka kwa asilimia 43.8 kutoka asilimia 58.8 hadi asilimia 102.7 kwa kipindi hicho hicho.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The percentage of Internet usage has increased by 41.1 percent from 11% to 52.1 percent between 2010 and 2018, while the percentage of mobile phone usage has increased by 43.8 percent from 58.8 to 102.7 percent during the same period.

en: This means that half the population is now connected to the internet, compared to only 11 percent in 2010.
swa: Hii inamaanisha kuwa nusu ya idadi ya watu sasa imeunganishwa na intaneti, ikilinganishwa na asilimia 11 tu katika mwaka 2010.
mt0: This means that half of the population is now connected to the Internet, compared with only 11 percent in 2010.

en: However, mis- and disinformation have found fertile ground to flourish owing to a variety of factors: extreme polarisation in the media, proposed government controls over social media, poor official communication methods and low digital literacy among internet users.
swa: Hata hivyo, upotoshaji na utoaji taarifa za uongo nao vimepata mazingira ya kushamiri kwa sababu kadhaa: mgawanyiko mkubwa katika vyombo vya habari, mapendekezo ya serikali kudhibiti mitandao ya kijamii, njia hafifu za mawasiliano rasmi na na elimu duni miongoni mwa watumiaji wa intaneti.
mt0: But, lying and falsehood have also become a growing problem due to several reasons: widespread divisions in the media, government proposals to control social media, weak communications channels and poor education among Internet users.

en: During the anti-government protests of January 2019, when state security forces arrested and beat hundreds of protesters, news of these clampdowns competed with government claims of fake news or their absolute denial.
swa: Wakati wa maandamano dhidi ya serikali ya Januari 2019, kipindi vikosi vya usalama vya serikali vilipowakamata na kuwashambulia mamia ya waandamanaji, habari za ukandamizaji huu zilishindana na madai ya serikali kwamba zilikuwa habari za uongo au pale ilipokanusha kabisa kuwepo kwake.
mt0: When the government took over the protests in January 2019, when the government took over the protests and killed hundreds of protesters, the reports of this violence clashed with government claims that they were false or when it completely denied its existence.

en: In Zimbabwe, citizens usually regard general statements issued by government ministers as official policy.

en: Media control in Zimbabwe bears its origins in colonial policies of the 20th century, which were tainted with violent subjugation to political authority.

mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The Rhodesian government led by Ian Smith focused on propaganda and control of information as its best weapon, not only supporting the legitimacy of the government but also spreading false reports about the war.

en: The colonial government passed a plethora of laws to suppress free expression or dissent against Smiths racist policies and they brutally enforced these laws to target liberation leaders.
swa: Serikali ya kikoloni ilipitisha idadi kubwa ya sheria za kukandamiza kujieleza au kupinga sera za kibaguzi za Smith na ilitekeleza sheria hizi kwa ukatili mno kuwalenga viongozi wa ukombozi.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. The colonial government passed a number of laws to restrict speech or protest against Smith's racist policy and enforced these laws very harshly against activists.

en: In Uganda, the internet has become a battleground where the government attempts to silence a growing online population voicing dissent.
swa: Nchini Uganda, mtandao umekuwa uga wa makabiliano pale serikali inapojaribu kunyamazisha sauti ya upinzani inayozidi kukua mtandaoni.
mt0: In Uganda, the internet has become a weapon of war when the government tries to suppress the growing opposition voice on the internet.

en: For years, Ugandan authorities have deployed different tactics to stifle political dissent and keep the ruling National Resistance Movement party and President Yoweri Museveni in power.
swa: Kwa miaka mingi, mamlaka za Uganda zimetumia mbinu tofauti kuukandamiza upinzani na kukirudisha chama tawala cha National Resistance Movement na Rais Yoweri Museveni madarakani.
mt0: For many years, Ugandan authorities have used different methods to suppress the opposition and re-establish the ruling National Resistance Movement and President Yoweri Museveni in power.

en: This includes blocking media websites, filtering SMS and shutting down social media platforms.
swa: Hii ni pamoja na kuzuia tovuti za vyombo vya habari, kuchuja ujumbe mfupi (SMS) na kuzima majukwaa ya mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: This includes blocking media websites, blocking text messages (SMS) and blocking social media forums.

en: As Ugandas 2021 general election approaches, authorities are expected to continue deploying similar tactics.
swa: Wakati uchaguzi mkuu wa Uganda wa 2021 unapokaribia, viongozi wa utawala wanatarajiwa kuendeleza mbinu kama hizi.
mt0: When the 2021 Ugandan presidential election is approaching, the government is expected to continue such tactics.

en: 2016 election shutdowns

en: During the 2016 general elections, Ugandan authorities resorted to shutting down entire social media platforms twice.
swa: Wakati wa uchaguzi mkuu wa 2016, viongozi wa Uganda walilazimika kuyafunga mara mbili majukwaa yote ya mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: When the 2016 presidential election was held, Ugandan leaders had to close all social media platforms twice.

en: The first shutdown took place on February 18, 2016, on the eve of the presidential election, and it affected social media platforms and mobile money services.
swa: Ufungwaji wa kwanza ulitekelezwa mnamo Februari 18, 2016, wakati wa mkesha wa uchaguzi wa urais, na uliathiri majukwaa ya mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu.
mt0: The first closure was on February 18, 2016, during the Republican presidential campaign, and affected social media and mobile money services.

en: The restrictions lasted for four full days.
swa: Uzuiaji huu ulidumu kwa jumla ya siku nne.
mt0: This quarantine lasted for four days.

en: On May 11, 2016, social media platforms including Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter and mobile money transfer services were once again blocked.
swa: Mnamo Mei 11, 2016, majukwaa ya mitandao ya kijamii, ikiwemo Facebook, WhatsApp na Twita na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu zilifungwa kwa mara nyingine.
mt0: On May 11, 2016, social media platforms, including Facebook, WhatsApp and Twitter, and mobile money transfer services were temporarily closed.

en: This shutdown lasted for one day and took place a day before President Museveni was sworn in for his fifth term as president.
swa: Kufungwa huku kulidumu kwa siku moja na kulifanyika siku moja kabla ya Rais Museveni kuapishwa kwa muhula wake wa tano kama rais.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Museveni has been in power since 1986.

mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Museveni has been in power since 1986.

en: Opposition to his rule is growing: According to a public opinion poll released in April 2019, an overall majority of Ugandans opposed a 2017 decision to remove the maximum age limit of 75 to run for president, which would allow the 74-year-old to run again in the 2021 elections.
swa: Upinzani dhidi ya uongozi wake unaimarika: Kulingana na kura ya maoni iliyotolewa mnamo Aprili 2019, idadi ya Waganda wengi inapinga uamuzi wa 2017 wa kuondoa kigezo cha umri wa 75 waa kugombea urais, ambacho kingeweza kumruhusu rais huyo mwenye umri wa miaka 74 kuwania tena katika uchaguzi wa 2021.
mt0: Upinzani against his leadership is growing: According to a poll released in April 2019, a majority of Ugandans oppose the decision of 2017 to remove the age requirement for a candidate to be president, which could allow the 74-year-old president to run again in 2021.

en: During both shutdowns in 2016, the Ugandan government cited national security as the motivation behind restrictions.
swa: Wakati wa matukio yote ya ufungwaji mwaka 2016, serikali ya Uganda ilitaja kuwa sababu ilikuwa ni usalama wa kitaifa ili kudhibiti mtandao.
mt0: When all the attacks of 2016 took place, the government of Uganda announced that the reason was national security to control the network.

en: The disruptions were ordered by Ugandas security agencies and the Uganda Communications Commission (UCC), which regulates the telecommunications sector, online publications, broadcasting (both radio and television), film industry, postal and courier services.
swa: Uvurugwaji uliagizwa na vyombo vya usalama vya Uganda na Tume ya Mawasiliano ya Uganda (UCC), ambayo inasimamia sekta ya mawasiliano, machapisho ya mtandaoni, utangazaji (wote redio na runinga), tasnia ya filamu, huduma za posta, usambazaji barua na vifurushi.
mt0: The attack was reported by the Ugandan security authorities and the Communications Commission of Uganda (UCC), which controls the communication, publishing, broadcasting (both radio and television), film industry, postal services, mail distribution and packaging.

en: On February 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, a telecommunications service provider, issued a statement on Twitter confirming that UCC, the regulator had directed MTN to disable all social media and mobile money services due to a threat to public order and safety.
swa: Mnamo Februari 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, mtoa huduma ya mawasiliano ya simu na mtandao, ilitoa taarifa kwenye Twita ikithibitisha kwamba UCC, ilikuwa imeiagiza MTN kufunga huduma zote za mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu kwa sababu ya tishio la kiusalama kwa umma.
mt0: In February 18, 2016, MTN Uganda, a mobile phone and internet service provider, confirmed on Twitter that UCC, a security authority, had ordered MTN to shut down all social media and mobile money services due to a security threat to the public.

en: This also affected other telecoms companies such as Airtel, Smile, Vodafone, and Africel.
swa: Agizo hili liliziathiri pia kampuni nyingine za simu kama vile Airtel, Smile, Vodafone, na Africel.
mt0: If you can't translate this simply say you don't know.

en: The same day, President Museveni told journalists that he ordered the blocking of social media: Steps must be taken for security to stop so many getting in trouble, it is temporary because some people use those pathways for telling lies, he said.
swa: Siku hiyo hiyo, Rais Museveni aliwaambia waandishi wa habari kwamba aliamuru kufungwa kwa mitandao ya kijamii: Hatua lazima zichukuliwe kwa ajili ya usalama kuzuia watu wengi kujiingiza kwenye taabu, ni kwa muda mfupi kwa sababu watu wengine hutumia njia hizo kusema uongo, alisema.
mt0: The same day, President Museveni told journalists that he had ordered the closure of social media: "The measures must be taken to protect the safety of many people, it is for a short time because some people use these means to tell lies," he said.

en: On March 17, in an official declaration during Supreme Court deliberations in which President Musevenis 2016 victory was challenged, the UCC executive director Godfrey Mutabazi explained that he received instructions from the Inspector General of Police, Kale Kayihura, to shut down social media networking sites and mobile money facilities owing to security concerns.
swa: Mnamo Machi 17, katika tamko rasmi wakati wa maamuzi ya Mahakama Kuu ambako ushindi wa Rais Museveni ulipingwa, mkurugenzi mtendaji wa UCC, Godfrey Mutabazi alielezea kwamba alipokea maagizo kutoka kwa Inspekta Jenerali wa Polisi, Kale Kayihura, kufunga tovuti za mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za kutuma pesa kwa njia ya simu kwa sababu za kiusalama.
mt0: In a statement during the Supreme Court ruling which rejected President Museveni's election, UCC director Godfrey Mutabazi explained that he received a command from the Chief Inspector General of Police, Kale Kayihura, to close social media sites and mobile money services for security reasons.

en: These shutdowns interfered with the rights and daily lives of Ugandans who use the internet and social media platforms to access information, express views and conduct everyday business online.
swa: Kufungwa huku kuliingilia haki na maisha ya kila siku ya Waganda wanaotumia mtandao na majukwa ya mitandao ya kijamii kupata habari, kuelezea maoni na kufanya biashara zao za kila siku.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: During the weeks prior to the 2016 elections, Ugandans actively tweeted and debated about the elections using hashtags like #UgandaDecides and #UGDebate16.
swa: Majuma kabla ya uchaguzi wa 2016, Waganda walijitolea sana kuchapisha na kujadili kuhusu uchaguzi huo kwa kutumia kibwagizo cha #UgandaDecides na # UGDebate16.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Ugandan citizens level of online civic engagement was sparked by the first-ever televised presidential debates, the first of which was held in January and the second, a week later.
swa: Kiwango cha Waganda cha ushiriki wa raia kwenye mtandao kilichochewa na midahalo ya rais ya kwanza  kabisa kuwahi kurushwa na runinga, wa kwanza ambao ulifanyika mnamo Januari na wa pili, wiki moja baadaye.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. The percentage of citizens participating on the internet was driven by the first televised debate of the president, which took place in January and the second, a week later.

en: Even with the social media bans in place, many Ugandans continued to post about the elections using Virtual Private Networks or VPNs.
swa: Licha ya ufungwaji wa mitandao ya kijamii, Waganda wengi waliendelea kutuma taarifa kuhusu uchaguzi kwa kutumia anwani ya mtandao binafsi inayofahamika kama VPN.
mt0: Although social media was closed, many Ugandans continued to send reports about the election using a private VPN address.

en: On election day, citizens were able to share updates on late arrivals of voting materials at various stations, reports of election malpractice, and provisional election results on social media.
swa: Siku ya uchaguzi, raia waliweza kushiriki yaliyokuwa yanajiri kuhusu kucheleweshwa kwa vifaa vya kupiga kura katika vituo mbali mbali, visa vya udanganyifu katika uchaguzi, na matokeo ya muda ya uchanguzi kwenye mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: The day of the election, citizens could participate in the news of the delay in the polling machines at various locations, cases of fraud in the election, and the timetable of the election on social media.

en: Human rights activists say that targeted shutdowns during election periods slow down communication, just when access to information and citizen expression are most needed.
swa: Wanaharakati wa haki za binadamu wanasema kwamba ufungwaji wa kimkakati wakati wa uchaguzi hupunguza kasi ya mawasiliano, wakati tu upatikanaji wa habari na usemi wa raia unahitajika sana.
mt0: Human rights activists say that a campaign shutdown during elections slows down communication, when only access to information and the citizens' voice is needed.

en: Internet shutdowns limit people from communicating particular concerns that affect them, such as health, interaction with friends as well sharing of political views and opinions, Moses Owiny, the chief executive of the Center for Multilateral Affairs, an independent platform for policy analysis operating in Uganda and Tanzania, told Global Voices in an interview.
swa: Kufungwa kwa mtandao kunazuia watu kuzungumzia mambo fulani yanayowaathiri, kama vile afya, mwingiliano na marafiki na pia kubadilishana maoni ya kisiasa, Moses Owiny, afisa mkuu wa the Center for Multilateral Affairs, jukwaa huru la uchambuzi wa sera linalofanya shughuli nchini Uganda na Tanzania, aliiambia  Global Voices katika mahojiano.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: According to Owiny, shutdowns primarily aim to stop dissent in politics based on perceived fear by the state that citizens views and concerns are likely to incite the public, an accusation he believes is unfounded and not grounded in reality but assumptions.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa Owiny, ufungwaji hukusudia kuzuia upinzani katika siasa kwa misingi ya hofu ya serikali kwamba maoni ya raia yanaweza kuchochea umma, madai ambayo anaamini hayana msingi kiuhakika ila ni ya kudhaniwa.
mt0: Owiny said that the execution was meant to prevent opposition in politics because the government feared that the citizens' opinion could cause a public outcry, a claim he believed was not based on facts but on myths.

en: Ugandas history of blocking platforms and websites
swa: Historia ya Uganda kufunga majukwaa ya mitandaoni na tovuti
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: On April 14, 2011, the UCC instructed ISPs to temporarily block access to Facebook and Twitter for 24 hours to eliminate connecting and sharing information.
swa: Mnamo Aprili 14, 2011, UCC iliagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kufunga kwa muda ufikiaji kwa Facebook na Twitter kwa saa 24 ili kuondoa uunganishwaji na ubadilishanaji habari.
mt0: On April 14, 2011, UCC ordered Internet service providers (ISPs) to temporarily close access to Facebook and Twitter for 24 hours to remove connections and information exchanges.

en: The order came in the heat of opposition-led walk to work protests over rising fuel and food prices.
swa: Agizo hilo lilitolewa wakati wa maandamano motomoto ya walk to work yaliyoongozwa na upinzani kufuatia kupanda kwa bei ya mafuta na chakula.
mt0: The order was issued during a protest against the rise in oil prices and food prices.

en: The regulator stated that security agencies requested the block to minimize social media use in order to prevent violence.
swa: Mamlaka hiyo ya mawasiliano ilisema kwamba vyombo vya usalama viliomba ufungwaji wa matumizi ya mitandao ya kijamii ili kuzuia vurugu.
mt0: The communications authority said that security officials asked for the closure of social media to prevent riots.

en: In 2011, the elections were marked with SMS filtration that contained certain words including Egypt, bullet and people power.
swa: Mnamo mwaka wa 2011, uchaguzi ulikumbwa na uchujwaji wa ujumbe mfupi (SMS) wenye maneno fulani yakiwemo Egypt, bullet na people power.
mt0: In 2011, the election was hit by a flood of SMS messages with words such as Egypt, bullet and people power.

en: In the lead up to the 2006 elections, the UCC instructed ISPs to block access to the website of Radio Katwe for publishing malicious and false information against the ruling National Resistance Movement and its presidential candidate, according to a 2015 ICT policy briefing by Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).
swa: Kuelekea uchaguzi mkuu wa 2006, UCC iliagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kuzuia upatikanaji wa wavuti ya Radio Katwe kwa kuchapisha habari mbovu na za uongo dhidi ya chama tawala cha National Resistance Movement na mgombea wake wa urais, kwa mujibu wa chapisho la sera ya tehama la 2015 la Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: Ugandan authorities blocked access to the radio station and the Daily Monitor website for publishing independently tallied election results.
swa: Mamlaka ya Uganda ilizuia upatikanaji wa matangazo ya kituo hicho cha redio na wavuti wa the Daily Monitor kwa kuchapisha matokeo huru ya uchaguzi.
mt0: The government of Uganda blocked access to the radio station and the Daily Monitor website for publishing a free election result.

en: Media platforms were quickly reinstated but only after the electoral commission announced official results.
swa: Majukwaa haya yalirejeshwa kwa haraka lakini tu baada ya tume ya uchaguzi kutangaza matokeo rasmi.
