en: Photo credit: Foreign and Commonwealth Office on Flickr [CC BY 2.0].Since 2016, authorities have continued to crack down on opposition politicians and journalists.
swa: Picha: Foreign and Commonwealth Office kwenye Flickr [CC BY 2.0].Tangu mwaka wa 2016, utawala umeendelea kuwakamata wanasiasa wa upinzani na waandishi wa habari.
mt0: Image: Foreign and Commonwealth Office on Flickr [CC BY 2.0].Since 2016, the government has been holding political activists and journalists.

en: Robert Kyagulanyi, known as Bobi Wine, singer and leader of the opposition party People Power, who is also a member of parliament, has already announced his bid for the presidency.
swa: Robert Kyagulanyi, almaarufu kama Bobi Wine, mwimbaji na kiongozi wa chama cha upinzani cha People Power, ambaye pia ni mbunge, tayari ametangaza azma yake ya kuwania urais.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Robert Kyagulanyi, better known as Bobi Wine, singer and leader of the opposition People Power Party, a parliamentarian, has already announced his candidacy for president.

en: Wine currently faces criminal charges for annoying the president and if convicted, he would not be allowed to run.
swa: Bobi Wine kwa sasa anakabiliwa na mashtaka ya jinai kwa kumuudhi rais na ikiwa atapatikana na hatia, hataruhusiwa kuwania.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Bobi Wine is currently facing criminal charges for insulting the president and if convicted, he will not be allowed to run.

en: According to Human Rights Watch, in 2018 authorities targeted six opposition members including Bobi Wine and Francis Zaake, ahead of the August 15 by-elections in Arua (northern Uganda).
swa: Kwa mujibu wa Human Rights Watch, mnamo 2018 utawala uliwalilenga wabunge sita wa upinzani wakiwemo Bobi Wine na Francis Zaake, kabla ya uchaguzi mdogo wa Agosti 15 huko Arua (kaskazini mwa Uganda).
mt0: Human Rights Watch says that in 2018, the government targeted six opposition MPs including Bobi Wine and Francis Zaake, before the early August 15 elections in Arua (eastern Uganda).

en: Members of the police and military arrested the group along with 28 other people on August 13, 2018, and charged them with treason.
swa: Polisi na jeshi walilikamata kundi hilo pamoja na watu wengine 28 mnamo Agosti 13, 2018, na kuwashtaki kwa uhaini.
mt0: Police and soldiers arrested the group along with 28 others on August 13, 2018, and charged them with murder.

en: They were later released on bail.
swa: Baadaye waliachiliwa kwa dhamana.
mt0: After they were released on bail.

en: That same day, police also arrested two journalists, Herber Zziwa and Ronald Muwanga, as they covered the by-election and related violence, including the deadly shooting by the military of Bobi Wines driver.
swa: Siku hiyo hiyo, polisi pia waliwakamata waandishi wa habari wawili, Herber Zziwa na Ronald Muwanga, walipokuwa wakiripoti kuhusu uchaguzi na vurugu zilizohusiana na uchaguzi huo, ikiwemo mauaji mabaya ya kufyatuliwa risasi dereva wa Bobi Wine yaliyotekelezwa na jeshi.
mt0: The same day, police also arrested two journalists, Herber Zziwa and Ronald Muwanga, while they were reporting on the election and the violence related to the election, including the killing of the Bobi Wine driver by the army.

en: Read more:  #FreeBobiWine: Protests mount over torture and arrest of a young political force in Uganda
swa: Read more:  #FreeBobiWine: Protests mount over torture and arrest of a young political force in Uganda
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: As the 2021 election approaches, Uganda authorities are very likely to continue to crack down on political dissent, including through social media shutdowns.
swa: Wakati uchaguzi wa 2021 unapokaribia, kuna uwezekano mkubwa kuwa utawala wa Uganda utaendeleza ukandamizaji wa wapinzani, ikiwa ni pamoja na kufunga mitandao ya kijamii.
mt0: When the 2021 election is approaching, it is very likely that the government of Uganda will continue to persecute opposition, including blocking social media.

en: In fact, since the 2016 elections, there has been no change in the legal framework that allows the government to restrict the rights to freedom of expression and access to information online.
swa: Kwa kweli, tangu uchaguzi wa 2016, hakujakuwepo na mabadiliko katika mfumo wa kisheria ambao unaruhusu serikali kuzuia haki ya uhuru wa kujieleza na ufikiaji wa habari mtandaoni.
mt0: However, since the 2016 election, there has been no change in the laws that allow the government to restrict the right to freedom of speech and access to information on the internet.

en: According to the 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report,  the 2013 Communications Act gives UCC broad powers and functions under Section 5 that permits the communications regulator to monitor, inspect, license, supervise, control, and regulate communications services and to set standards, monitor, and enforce compliance relating to content.
swa: Kwa mujibu wa 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report, Sheria ya Mawasiliano ya 2013 inaipa UCC nguvu zaidi na inafanya kazi chini ya kifungu cha 5 kinachoruhusu mdhibiti wa mawasiliano kufuatilia, kukagua, kutoa leseni, kusimamia, na kudhibiti huduma za mawasiliano na kuweka viwango, kufuatilia, na kutekeleza uzingatifu unaohusu taarifa.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. According to the 2016 State of Internet Freedom in Africa report, the Communications Act of 2013 gives UCC more powers and acts under Article 5 which allows the regulator to monitor, inspect, issue licenses, manage and control communication services and set standards, enforce and implement transparency concerning information.

en: At the request of the government, the UCC used this section to order ISPs to block access to social media and mobile money services during the 2016 elections.
swa: Kwa ombi la serikali, UCC ilitumia sehemu hii kuagiza watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) kuzuia ufikiaji wa mitandao ya kijamii na huduma za pesa kwa njia ya simu wakati wa uchaguzi wa 2016.
mt0: With the government's request, UCC used this section to order ISPs to block access to social media and money services through mobile phone during the 2016 election.

en: The government continues to weaponize these laws to control public debate and to silence political dissent, particularly at times of elections.
swa: Serikali inaendelea kutumia sheria hizi kudhibiti mijadala ya umma na kunyamazisha wapinzani wa kisiasa, haswa wakati wa uchaguzi.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The government continues to use these laws to control public debate and to silence political opponents, especially during elections.

en: Owiny argues that the state is capable of shutting down the internet at any time deemed necessary: Where regime security and that of its citizens converges, and where regime security is threatened, the regime security and its survival will take precedent.
swa: Owiny anatoa hoja kwamba serikali ina uwezo wa kuzima mtandao wakati wowote ule inapoonekana kuna umuhimu huo: Pale ambapo usalama wa serikali na ule wa raia wake unaingiliana, na pale usalama wa serikali unapotishiwa, usalama wa serikali na uponaji wake utapewa kipaumbele.
mt0: Owiny argues that the government has the power to shut down the Internet whenever it believes it is necessary: When the security of the government and the security of its citizens are in conflict, and when the security of the government is compromised, the security of the government and its recovery will be priority.

en: Nongovernmental organizations and human rights defenders have been organizing in Uganda so that shutdowns like the ones that took place in 2016 dont happen again.
swa: Asasi zisizo za kiserikali na watetezi wa haki za binadamu wamekuwa wakijiandaa nchini Uganda ili ufungaji kama ule uliofanyika mwaka wa 2016 hautokei tena.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Several organizations wrote a joint letter to the African Union and regional bodies asking them to condemn the decision by Ugandan authorities to shut down internet access during the 2016 elections.
swa: Asasi kadhaa ziliandika barua ya pamoja kwa Jumuiya ya Afrika na mashirika ya kikanda zikiyaomba kulaani uamuzi wa utawala wa Uganda wa kufungia ufikiaji wa mtandao wakati wa uchaguzi wa 2016.
mt0: Many organizations have written to the African Union and regional organizations urging them to condemn the government's decision to ban internet access during the 2016 election. If you cannot translate, just say you don't know.

en: Unwanted Witness Uganda took the Ugandan state to court, along with internet service providers and the regulator, in a case filed in September 2016.
swa: Shirika la Unwanted Witness Uganda liliipeleka serikali ya Uganda mahakamani, pamoja na watoa huduma za mtandao (ISPs) na mdhibiti wa mawasiliano (UCC), katika kesi iliyowasilishwa mnamo Septemba 2016.
mt0: Unwanted Witness Uganda has filed a lawsuit against the government of Uganda, including ISPs and the Communications Control Commission (UCC), in a case filed in September 2016.

en: The organization contended that the internet shutdown planned by the state violated the rights of Ugandans to personal freedom of speech and expression is enshrined in Article 29(1) of the 1995 constitution.
swa: Shirika hilo lilionyesha kwamba hatua ya ufungwaji wa mtandao iliyopangwa na serikali ilikiuka haki za raia wa Uganda za uhuru wa kusema na kujieleza kama inavyoelezwa kwenye kanuni za kifungu cha 29 (1) cha katiba ya 1995.
mt0: The organization pointed out that the government's planned shutdown of the Internet violated the rights of Ugandan citizens to freedom of speech and assembly as defined in Article 29 (1) of the 1995 Constitution.

en: However, a judge ruled that the applicants failed to prove any violations that resulted from the shutdowns, Unwanted Witness Uganda told Global Voices.
swa: Hata hivyo, jaji alitoa uamuzi kwamba upande wa mashtaka ulishindwa kuthibitisha ukiukwaji wowote uliotokana na ufungwaji huo, Unwanted Witness ililiambia shirika la Global Voices.
mt0: But the judge ruled that the prosecution could not prove any violations of the prisoner's privacy, a witness told the Global Voices.

en: Achieving uninterrupted access to the internet  particularly during the upcoming elections  will require more advocacy.
swa: Kufanikisha kutokatishwa kwa ufikiaji wa mtandao  hasa wakati wa uchaguzi ujao  kutahitaji utetezi zaidi.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. To achieve a lack of internet access especially during the next election requires more arguments.

en: Owiny suggested the need for digital rights activists to deepen conversations between the government and private sector to present the negative impact of shutdowns because the private sector is intimidated by the state.
swa: Owiny alipendekeza hitaji la wanaharakati wa haki za dijitili kuongeza mazungumzo kati ya serikali na sekta binafsi kuwasilisha athari mbaya za ufungwaji kwa sababu sekta binafsi inatiwa hofu na serikali.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Uganda was among the first African countries to enact a right to information law, known as the Access to Information Act (ATIA), in 2005.
swa: Uganda ilikuwa miongoni mwa nchi za kwanza barani Afrika kutunga sheria ya haki ya raia kupata habari za umma, inayojulikana kama Access to Information Act (ATIA), mnamo 2005.
mt0: If you can't translate it, just say you don't know Uganda was one of the first African countries to pass a law on the right of citizens to access public information, known as Access to Information Act (ATIA), in 2005.

en: The law promises to provide efficient, effective, transparent and accountable that will enable the public to effectively access and participate in decisions that affect them as citizens of the country.
swa: Sheria hiyo inaahidi kutoa ufanisi, urahisi, uwazi na uwajibikaji ambao utawezesha umma kupata kwa urahisi na kushiriki katika maamuzi ambayo yanawaathiri kama raia wa nchi.
mt0: The law promises to provide efficiency, transparency, transparency and accountability that will allow the public to access and participate in decisions that affect them as citizens.

en: Will the government meet its mandate to promote the right to access to information?
swa: Je! Serikali itatimiza jukumu lake la kukuza haki ya kupata habari?
mt0: What if the government doesn't fulfill its obligation to promote the right to know?

en: Will it live up to its promise?
swa: Na je!Itatimiza ahadi zake?

en: This article is part of a series of posts examining interference with digital rights through methods such as network shutdowns and disinformation during key political events in seven African countries: Algeria, Ethiopia, Mozambique, Nigeria, Tunisia, Uganda, and Zimbabwe.
swa: Makala haya ni sehemu ya mfululizo wa machapisho yanayochunguza kuingiliwa kwa haki za dijitali kupitia mbinu kama vile ufungwaji wa mtandao wa intaneti na upotoshaji taarifa wakati wa matukio muhimu ya kisiasa katika nchi saba za Afrika: Algeria, eEthiopia, Msumbiji, Nigeria, Tunisia, Uganda, na Zimbabwe.
mt0: This article is part of a series of articles examining digital rights during key political events in seven African countries: Algeria, Ethiopia, Mozambique, Nigeria, Tunisia, Uganda, and Zimbabwe.

en: The project is funded by the Africa Digital Rights Fund of The Collaboration on International ICT Policy for East and Southern Africa (CIPESA).

en: Thousands of visitors to the historic city of Stone Town, Zanzibar, have followed the sound of music to the Dhow Countries Music Academy (DCMA), a music school that promotes and preserves the islands musical traditions of the Swahili Coast along the Indian Ocean.
swa: Maelfu ya wageni wanaozuru Mji Mkongwe, Zanzibar, mji wa kale uliofahamika kubeba historia  kubwa ya visiwa hivyo, hufuatilia sauti ya muziki unaorindima kutoka DCMA, shule ya muziki inayolenga kutangaza na kutunza muziki wa mwambao unaofahamika kuwa na asili yake visiwani humo na maeneo mengine ya pwani ya Bahari ya Hindi.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: Since 2002, the school has promoted and preserved the Zanzibar's unique mix of Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.
swa: Tangu mwaka 2002, shule hiyo imekuwa ikiutangaza na kuutunza utamaduni huo wa kipekee wa Zanzibar unaochanganya tamaduni za ki-Arab, ki-Hindi na ki-Afrika kupitia muziki.
mt0: Since 2002, the school has been promoting and preserving the unique culture of Zanzibar that mixes Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.

en: After 17 years, the school faces a financial crisis that threatens its closure.
swa: Miaka 17 tangu kuanzishwa kwa shule hiyo, sasa ni wazi inakabiliwa na hali mbaya ya kifedha inayotishia kufungwa kwake.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. 17 years after the school was founded, it is clear that it is in a financial crisis that is threatening to close.

en: Nearly 70% of its 80 full-time students can't afford to pay their tuition, which comes to about $13 USD per month, according to an official DCMA press release.
swa: Karibu asilimia 70 ya wanafunzi 80 wanaosoma shuleni hapo hawana uwezo wa kulipa ada ya masomo, ambayo ni kiasi cha dola za Marekani 13 kwa mwezi, kwa mujibu wa taarifa rasmi ya DCMA kwa umma.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know About 70 percent of the 80 students at the school do not have the financial means to pay the school's tuition fee, which is about 13 dollars a month, according to DCMA's official announcement to the public.

en: While the school has received support over the years from international donors and diplomatic missions, they face a gap in funding that may force them to shut their doors at the historic Old Customs House.
swa: Ingawa shule hiyo imekuwa ikipokea misaada kutoka kwa wafadhili wa kimataifa na mashirika ya kirafiki, kwa sasa inakabiliana na ombwe kubwa linaloweza kulazimisha kufunga virago vyake na kuondoka kwenye Jumba hilo la kihistoria mjini Zanzibar, linalofahamika kama Old Customs House.
mt0: Although the school has received international funding and friendship organizations, it is currently facing a huge financial crisis that could force it to close its doors and leave the historic Old Customs House in Zanzibar.

en: Without crucial funds to continue, DCMA students and staff fear that the soulful sounds that flow through the hallways of this iconic institution that make these islands sing  may cease.
swa: Bila kupata fedha za haraka kuwezesha shughuli zake kuendelea, wanafunzi na walimu wa DCMA wana wasiwasi kwamba sauti zilizozoeleka kurindima kutoka kwenye viunga vya jengo hilo na kufanya visiwa vipate burudani ya sanaa  zinaweza kukoma.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. If you can't get funding to continue its activities, students and teachers at DCMA are worried that the usual sounds that float from the grounds of the building and make the islands enjoy artistic entertainment may stop.

mt0: From now on, we are not sure we will be able to pay the salaries of teachers and other employees.

en: At the moment, 19 master teachers and small core staff have gone without salaries for over three months as the school struggles to secure strong funding partnerships and explore sustainable funding models for a school.
swa: Hivi sasa, walimu 19 wabobezi na wafanyakazi wengine wachache hawajalipwa mishahara yao kwa zaidi ya miezi sita kwa sababu shule hiyo imekuwa ikihangaika kupata misaada kutoka kwa marafiki wakati huo huo ikijaribu kutengeneza mfumo endelevu wa kupata mapato kwa minajili ya uendashaji wa shule hiyo.
mt0: Currently, 19 teachers and a few other employees have not been paid their wages for more than six months because the school has been trying to get donations from friends while trying to create a sustainable income system for the school's funding.

en: While the archipelago is known as a tourist destination for its pristine beaches and luxury hotels, the majority of local people struggle with high unemployment even as poverty has slightly decreased, according to The World Bank.
swa: Ingawa visiwa hivyo vinafahamika kuvutia watalii wengi shauri ya kuwa na fukwe na hoteli kubwa za kifahari, wenyeji wengi wanateseka na ukosefu mkubwa wa kazi ingawa takwimu zilizotolewa na Benki ya Dunia zinaonesha kuwa umasikini umepungua kidogo visiwani humo.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. Although the islands are known to attract tourists because of their beaches and luxury hotels, many residents are suffering from a severe job shortage, although the World Bank statistics show that poverty has fallen a little.

en: For 17 years, the DCMA has worked tirelessly to promote and protect Zanzibars rich heritage and traditions through music.
swa: Kwa zaidi ya miaka 17, DCMA imefanya kazi bila kuchoka kutangaza na kulinda urithi mkubwa wa Zanzibar kupitia muziki.
mt0: For more than 17 years, DCMA has worked without a break to promote and protect the great heritage of Zanzibar through music.

en: The birthplace of legendary taarab singers Siti Binti Saad and Fatuma Binti Baraka, or Bi.
swa: Ikiwa ni mahali alipozaliwa gwiji wa muziki wa taarab na waimbaji maarufu Siti Binti Saad na Fatuma Binti Baraka, au Bi.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: Kidude, Zanzibar is home to musical genres that emerged through cultural exchange and collaboration along the Swahili Coast for hundreds of years.
swa: Kidude, Zanzibar ni makazi ya mahadhi ya muziki ulioibuka kupitia mchanganyiko wa kiutamaduni na ushirikiano baina ya wa-Swahili wa Pwani kwa mamia ya miaka iliyopita.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. Kidude, Zanzibar is the home of a musical style that has been formed through a mixture of culture and cooperation between the Zanzibari people for thousands of years.

en: Today, students can learn traditional musical genres like taarab, ngoma and kidumbak, along with instruments like drums, qanun and oud, as gatekeepers  and interpreters  of culture and tradition.
swa: Leo, wanafunzi wanaweza kujifunza muziki wa asili kama taarab, ngoma na kidumbak, sambamba na vyombo vingine kama ngoma, qanun na oud, kama walinzi  na watafsiri  wa utamaduni na desturi.
mt0: Today, students can learn traditional music such as taarab, drums and dumbak, along with other instruments such as drum, qanun and oud, as guards and translators of culture and customs.

en: Neema Surri, a violin player at the DCMA, has been studying the violin since the age of 9.
swa: Neema Surri, mpigaji wa chombo kiitwacho violin shuleni hapo DCMA, amekuwa akijifunza namna ya kucheza chombo hicho tangu akiwa na umri wa miaka 9.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. Neema Surri, a violin player at DCMA, has been learning to play the instrument since she was nine years old.

en: I know many young people who would like to study music but they cant afford the minimal tuition fee because they are poor and unemployed, Surri said in the DCMA video.
swa: Ninawajua vijana wengi wanaotamani kujifunza muziki lakini hawawezi kumudu ada ndogo shauri ya umasikini na ukosefu wa kazi, Surri alisema kwenye video ya DCMA.

en: After completing DCMA workshops, certificate and diploma courses, many DCMA students go on to perform on world stages as award-winning bands and solo artists.
swa: Baada ya kumaliza warsha za DCMA, kozi za Astashahada na Stashahada, wanafunzi wengi wa DCMA huenda kufanya kazi kwenye majukwaa ya kimataifa wakiwa kama bendi zenye sifa ya kushinda tuzo na wasanii wa kujitegemea.
mt0: After completing DCMA workshops, degrees and certificates, many students of DCMA go on to work on international stage as bands with recognized awards and independent artists.

en: Zanzibars Amina Omar Juma, a former DCMA student and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with her critically acclaimed, Siti and the Band, known for fusing the roots by blending traditional taarab sounds with contemporary, layered rhythms.
swa: Mzanzibar Amina Omar Juma, mwanafunzi wa zamani wa DCMA na mwalimu wa sasa wa DCMA, hivi karibuni alirudi kutoka kwenye ziara nchini Afrika Kusini akiambatana na bendi yake iliyojipatia sifa Siti na Bendi Yake, inayofahamika kwa kuunganisha mizizi  kwa kuchanganya sauti za taarabu ya asili na sauti za mahadhi ya kisasa.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Zanzibar's Amina Omar Juma, a former DCMA student and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with his band Siti and His Band, which is known for combining roots with modern sounds.

en: She and other band members, also former DCMA students, released their first full album, Fusing the Roots, in 2018, going on to perform at Sauti za Busara, East Africa's largest music festival, that same year.
swa: Pia, kwa ushirikiano na wanabendi wenzake, ambao nao ni wanafunzi wa zamani wa DCMA, alitoa alibamu ya kwanza iitwayo, Fusing the Roots, mwaka 2018, akiendelea kufanya maonesho kwenye  Sauti za Busara, tamasha kubwa zaidi la muziki kwenye ukanda wa Afrika Mashariki, mwaka huo huo.
mt0: In addition, with his fellow bands, who are also former students of DCMA, he released his first album, Fusing the Roots, in 2018, while continuing to perform at the South African Music Festival, the biggest music festival in the region, that same year.

en: Here's Siti and the Band's Nielewe (Understand Me) and music video, depicting scenes from Zanzibar while telling the story of a woman who experiences domestic abuse and dreams of life in music, much like Omar Juma's personal story:
swa: Hapa unaweza kuusikiliza wimbo wa Bendi hiyo uitwao Nielewe pamoja na video yake, ikionesha madhari ya Zanzibar kuelezea simulizi ya mwanamke anayekabiliana na unyanyasaji wa nyumbani na ndoto za maisha ya muziki, kama ilivyo hadithi ya maisha binafsi ya Omar Juma:
mt0: You can listen to the song Nielewe here with the video, which shows the Zanzibar landscapes telling the story of a woman who is fighting domestic abuse and dreams of music life, just like Omar Juma's personal story.

en: A history of cultural crossroads and collaboration
swa: Historia ya mwingiliano wa kiutamaduni na ushirikiano
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Over 15,000 visitors have passed through the academys iconic building to enjoy live performances, workshops and classes and interact with passionate DCMA musicians who represent the future of Zanzibar culture and heritage, according to the DCMA.
swa: Zaidi ya wageni 15,000 wamewahi kupitia kwenye jengo la shule hiyo kufurahia maonesho mubashara, warsha na madarasa pamoja na kukutana na wanamuziki wa DCMA wanaowakilishia mustakabali wa utamaduni na urithi wa Zanzibar, kwa mujibu wa DCMA.
mt0: More than 15,000 visitors have already passed through the school building to enjoy the free exhibitions, seminars and classrooms, and to meet DCMA musicians representing the future of Zanzibar's culture and heritage, according to DCMA.

en: Drawing from a complex history of Indian, Arab and African exchange, the school celebrates the influence of dhow countries, with inspiration from cultures that converged along the Indian Ocean and the Persian Gulf.
swa: Ikiwa na vionjo vya historia ya India, Urabuni na Afrika, shule hiyo inafurahia kuwa matokeo ya tamaduni za nchi mbalimbali, ikiwa na utamaduni uliunganishwa kwenye eneo lal Bahari ya Hindi na Ghuba ya Uajemi.
mt0: With a history of India, Europe and Africa, the school is proud to be a result of a variety of cultures, including a culture which was connected to the areas of the Indian Ocean and the Arctic Ocean.

en: The Omani Sultanate, a major maritime force from the 17th to 19th centuries, shifted its seat of power from Muscat to Zanzibar in 1840.
swa: Sultani wa Omani, mfalme maarufu wa kati ya karne ya 17 na 19, alihamia utawala wake kutoka Muscat kwenda Zanzibar mwaka 1840.
mt0: Return to the translated translation only. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: From Stone Town, Omani kings oversaw elaborate systems of maritime trade, including cloves, gold, and textiles, powered by strong winds that set dhows  traditional Arab vessels  sailing across the Indian Ocean, from India to Oman to East Africa.
swa: Kutoka Mji Mkongwe, watawala wa Omani waliendesha biashara ya baharini, ikiwa ni pamoja na karafuu, dhahabu, nguo, wakitegemea safari za vyombo vilivyoongozwa na upepo kati ya kingo ya Bahari ya Hindi nchini India kwenda Oman na Afrika Mashariki.
mt0: From the Old City, the Ottoman rulers ran a sea trade, including gold, silver, and clothing, using ships driven by wind between the Indian coast and Oman and East Africa.

en: Young Zanzibaris recognize the importance of connecting with the past to determine their future and the music created today expresses that desire to bridge the old with the new.
swa: Vijana wa Zanzibar wanatambua umuhimu wa kuelewa historia yao ili kubaini ikiwa mustakabali wao na muziki wanaoutengeneza leo unaelezea matamanio ya kuweka daraja kati ya mambo ya kale na haya ya kisasa.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. The young people of Zanzibar recognize the importance of learning their history to determine if their future and the music they are making today reflect their desire to bridge the gap between the old and the new.

en: DCMA students and teachers recently formed TaraJazz, a blend of traditional taarab and modern jazz.
swa: Hivi karibuni wanafunzi wa DCMA na walimu wao walianzisha TaraJazz, mwuunganiko wa taarab ya asili na jazi ya kisasa.
mt0: Last year, DCMA students and their teachers created TaraJazz, a fusion of classical and modern jazz.

en: Their violinist, Felician Mussa, 20, has only been studying the violin for 3.5 years; TaraJazz is one of the most sought-after bands on the islands, captured here by photographer Aline Coquelle:
swa: Mwanamuziki wake, Felician Mussa, 20, amekuwa akijifunza kupiga chombo cha muziki kinachoitwa violin kwa miaka mitatu na nusu; TaraJazz ni moja wapo ya bendi zinazotafutwa zaidi visiwani humo, hapa ikiwa imenaswa na mpiga picha Aline Coquelle:
mt0: The musician, Felician Mussa, 20, has been learning to play the violin for three and a half years; TaraJazz is one of the most wanted bands in the island, which is photographed by Aline Coquelle.

en: The Swahili coast tells the story of epic cultural exchanges and the DCMA continues this tradition through its musical collaborations.
swa: Pwani ya wa-Swahili inaeleza simulizi ya mchanganyiko wa utamaduni na DCMA inaendeleza utamaduni huu kupitia ushirikiano wa kimuziki.
mt0: The Swahili coast tells the story of a mixture of cultures and DCMA promotes this culture through music collaboration.

en: Every year, the school hosts an initiative called Swahili Encounters, matching well-known musicians hailing from Africa, the Middle East, Europe and North America with DCMA students to create original musical compositions within a week-long period.
swa: Kila mwaka, shule hiyo huandaa mradi unaoitwa  Swahili Encounters,  [Mkutano wa ki-Swahili] unaowakutanisha wanamuziki wanaofahamika kutoka Afrika, Mashariki ya Kati, Ulaya na Amerika ya Kaskazini na wanafunzi wa DCMA kwa minajili ya kutengeneza tungo halisi za muziki ndani ya kipindi cha juma moja.
mt0: Every year, the school hosts a project called Swahili Encounters, [Swahili Encounters] which gathers famous musicians from Africa, Middle East, Europe and North America with students of DCMA to create real music tracks in one week.

en: At the end of the encounter, the newly-formed collaboration performs at Sauti za Busara, and many of these collaborations turn into life-time friendships that transcend the boundaries of language and culture, proving music is a universal language.
swa: Mwishoni mwa mkutano, timu mpya za wasanii waliokutanishwa hutakiwa kufanya onesho kwenye Sauti za Busara, na mara nyingi timu hizi huishi kuwa na urafiki unaodumu unaovuka mipaka ya lugha na utamaduni, na hivyo kuthibitisha kuwa muziki ni lugha ya dunia.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know At the end of the meeting, new teams of artists are asked to perform on the Sounds of Reason, and these teams often remain in a lasting friendship that crosses linguistic and cultural borders, and thus prove that music is the world's language.

en: DCMA offers weekly live performances showcasing students talents and collaborations with visiting musicians, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019.
swa: DCMA huandaa onesho mubashara kila juma kuonesha vipaji vya wanafunzi wake na marafiki wanaowatembelea wanamuziki hao, Mji Mkongwe, Zanzibar, 2019.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Photo courtesy of DCMA.
swa: Picha kwa hisani ya DCMA.
mt0: Image by DCMA.

en: The DCMA recognizes that music empowers and unites people across cultures  and it also employs talented youth living in a struggling economy with limited job opportunities.
swa: Shule ya DCMA inatambua kuwa muziki unawainua na kuwaunganisha watu bila kujali tamaduni zao  na pia inaajiri vijana wenye vipaji wnaaoishi kwenye jamii isiyo na uchumi mzuri na upungufu mkubwa wa fursa za ajira.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The DCMA School recognizes that music encourages and connects people regardless of their cultures and also employs talented young people living in a poor economic environment with a huge gap in job opportunities.

en: For the 1,800 students who have trained at the DCMA, this is the only musical home they know, where they can learn and grow as professional musicians and artists.
swa: Kwa idadi ya wanafunzi 1,800 waliopita kwenye mafunzo ya DCMA, shule hii ndiyo makazi pekee ya kimuziki wanayoyafahamu, ambapo wanaweza kujifunza na kukua kama wanamuziki na wasanii mahiri.
mt0: With 1,800 students who graduated from DCMA, this school is the only music school they know, where they can learn and grow as artists and musicians.

en: One traveler from Spain, who recently visited the DCMA, wrote on TripAdvisor: Personally, meeting the musicians was the best piece of my time on this island.
swa: Mtalii mmoja kutoka Uhisipania, aliyetembelea shule ya DCMA hivi karibuni, aliandika kwenye mtandao wa TripAdvisor: Binafsi, kukutana na wanamuziki ule ulikuwa wakati wangu mzuri zaidi nikiwa visiwani pale.
mt0: One tourist from Iceland, who recently visited DCMA school, wrote on TripAdvisor: For me, meeting the singers was the best time I had in the islands.

en: As Zanzibars tourism sector rapidly grows, the DCMA believes that music plays an essential role in the celebration, preservation and promotion of Swahili culture, heritage and history.
swa: Wakati sekta ya utalii Zanzibar ikiendelea kukua kwa kasi, shule ya DCMA inaamini kuwa muziki una nafasi muhimu katika kusherehekea, kutunza na kutangaza utamaduni wa wa-Swahili, urithi wao na historia yao.
mt0: While the tourism sector in Zanzibar is growing rapidly, DCMA believes that music plays an important role in celebrating, preserving and promoting the culture of the Swahili people, their heritage and their history.

en: Zanzibar is far more than its beaches and luxury hotels  its a place bursting with talent that stems from an extraordinary history of cultural connection and collaboration.
swa: Zanzibar ni zaidi ya fukwe na hoteli zake za kifahari  ni sehemu inayojaa vipaji vinavyochipukia kwenye historia kubwa ya mkusanyiko na miunganiko wa historia.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Zanzibar is more than beaches and luxury hotels. It is a place filled with a huge collection of treasures and connections of history.

en: Editor's note: The author of this post has volunteered with DCMA.
swa: Nyongeza ya Mhariri: Mwandishi wa makala haya aliwahi kujitolea kwenye shule ya DCMA.
mt0: The author of this article has volunteered at DCMA school.

mt0: Sierra Leone: Health workers prepare to enter the Ebola treatment area.

en: On August 12, the World Health Organization (WHO) announced a positive development in the clinical trials of drugs being tested for the treatment of Ebola in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DR of Congo).
swa: Mapema tarehe 12 Agosti, Shirika la Afya Duniani (WHO) lilitoa taarifa chanya ya maendeleo ya michakato ya kitabibu ya majaribio ya dawa kadhaa za kutibu ugonjwa wa ebola nchini Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya Congo (Jamhuri ya Congo).
mt0: WHO released a positive report on the progress of a number of experimental drugs to treat Ebola in the Republic of the Congo on August 12, 2014.

en: WHO asserted that the Ebola drugs showed advances that will bring patients a better chance of survival, and further affirmed that two out of the four drugs being tested are more effective in treating Ebola.
swa: WHO ilitanabaisha kuwa, dawa za ebola zilizojaribiwa zimeonesha matokeo chanya yatakayoleta matumaini ya kuishi kwa wagonjwa wa Ebola, na kuendelea kueleza kuwa dawa mbili kati ya nne zilizojaribiwa zimeonesha kuwa na uwezo mkubwa wa kutibu Ebola.
mt0: WHO announced that the experimental ebola drugs showed positive results that would give patients hope of life, and continued to say that two of the four tested drugs showed a greater ability to treat Ebola.

en: Who is the man behind the Ebola cure?
swa: Ni nani huyu anayehusika kwenye tiba hii ya Ebola?
mt0: Who is this person involved in this Ebola treatment?

en: Esteemed professor Jean-Jacques Muyembe-Tamfum, director-general of the Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) DR of Congo, who invested a substantial part of his adult life treating the virus.
swa: Mheshimiwa Profesa Jean-Jacques Muyembe-Tamfum, Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB) DR ya Congo, aliwekeza sehemu kubwa ya Maisha yake katika kutafuta tiba ya kirusi cha Ebola.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: While the international media has often focused heavily on the deadly, contagious nature of Ebola in DR of Congo, less has been said about the Congolese scientist who discovered its cure.
swa: Wakati vyombo vya ahabari vya kimataifa vikiwa vinaripoti kwa kiasi kikubwa kuhusu namna ugonjwa wa Ebola unavyosababisha idadi kubwa ya vifo nchini Congo, habari za kumhusu mwanasansi huyu zinazungumzwa kwa kiasi kidogo sana na vyombo hivi vya habari.
mt0: While international media are reporting a lot about the spread of Ebola in Congo, the news about the researcher is very little mentioned by these media.

en: Muyembe-Tamfum declared: We will no longer say that EVD [Ebola virus disease] is not curable.
swa: Muyembe-Tamfum  alieleza : kuwa hatutasema tena kuwa ugonjwa wa  Ebola (EVD) hautibiki.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Based on Muyembe-Tamfum's tireless work, scientists tested four drugs for Ebola treatment: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.
swa: Kutokana na kazi adhimu ya Muyembe-Tamfum, wanasayansi walifanya majaribio ya dawa nne za kutibu Ebola: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.
mt0: Based on Muyembe-Tamfum's important work, scientists have tested four medications to treat Ebola: ZMapp, remdesivir, mAb114 and REGN-EB3.

en: The results from the clinical trials conducted in 499 study participants showed that patients treated with REGN-EB3 or mAb114 had a greater chance of survival when compared to those treated with the two other drugs.
swa: Majibu ya majaribio ya kitabibu conducted kwa washiriki 499 wa utafiti yalionesha kuwa wagonjwa waliotibiwa kwa REGN-EB3 au mAb114 walionesha kuwa na nafasi kubwa ya kupona ukilinganisha na wale waliotibiwa kwa dawa nyingine mbili.
mt0: If you can't translate, just say you don't know. Responses of clinical trials conducted on 499 participants showed that patients who were treated with REGN-EB3 or mAb114 had a higher chance of survival compared to those who were treated with other two drugs.

en: The trials were conducted under the auspices of the Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB), the DR Congo Ministry of Health and three medical humanitarian organizations: the Alliance for International Medical Action (ALIMA), the International Medical Corps (IMC) and Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF).
swa: Utafiti huu uliofanyika chini ya uangalizi wa taasisi ya Institut National de Recherche Biomédicale (INRB), Wizara ya Afya ya Congo pamoja na mashirika mengine matatu yanayojihusisha na utoaji wa huduma za afya: Jumuia ya Kimataifa ya Masuala ya Afya (ALIMA), the International Medical Corps (IMC) na Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF).
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The Congolese scientist behind the Ebola treatment
swa: Raia wa Congo aliyehusika kwenye upatikanaji wa tiba ya Ebola
mt0: Return only the translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Muyembe-Tamfum has been researching Ebola since its first known outbreak in DR of Congo in 1976 when he became the first researcher to travel to the area of the first outbreak.
swa: Muyembe-Tamfum amekuwa akifanya tafiti zinazohusiana na ugonjwa wa Ebola tangu kuripotiwa kwa ugonjwa huu kwa mara ya kwanza nchini Congo ambapo  mwaka 1976 alikuwa  mtafiti wa kwanza  kuzuru eneo ambalo ugonjwa wa Ebola uripotiwa kwa mara ya kwanza.Nilitumia miongo minne ya maisha yangu kutafuta tiba kwa aajili ya kutibu ugonjwa wa Ebola.Kwa hiyo, haya ni mafanikio katika maisha yangu-Dr Jean-Jacques Muyembe, ambaye ni Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa Institut National de Recherche Biomedicale ya Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya #Congo pamoja na wenzake wamegundua tiba mpya ya ugonjwa wa Ebola inayoweza kutibu dalili za ugonjwa huu katika muda wa masaa matatu tu.Nilitumia miongo minne ya maisha yangu kutafuta tiba kwa aajili ya kutibu ugonjwa wa Ebola.Kwa hiyo, haya ni mafanikio katika maisha yangu-
mt0: Dr Jean-Jacques Muyembe, a Director of the National Institute for Recherche Biomedicale of the Republic of the Congo, and his colleagues have discovered a new Ebola vaccine that can treat symptoms of the disease in just three hours.

en: Dr Jean-Jacques Muyembe, director general of the Institut National de Recherche Biomedicale in the Democratic Republic of #Congo and his team have discovered a new Ebola treatment that can cure symptoms in just an hour
swa: Dr Jean-Jacques Muyembe, ambaye ni Mkurugenzi Mkuu wa Institut National de Recherche Biomedicale ya Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya #Congo pamoja na wenzake wamegundua tiba mpya ya ugonjwa wa Ebola inayoweza kutibu dalili za ugonjwa huu katika muda wa masaa matatu tu.
mt0: Dr Jean-Jacques Muyembe, the Director of the National Institute for Scientific Research in the Republic of the Congo, and his colleagues have discovered a new Ebola cure that can treat symptoms of the disease in just three hours.

en: A professor of microbiology at Kinshasa University Medical School in DR of Congo, he has been working for the past 40 years on a cure for the disease.
swa: Profesa wa maikrobaolojia wa Chuo Kikuu cha Tiba cha Kinshasa- Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya Congo, hadi sasa ametumia muda wa takribani miaka 40 kutafuta tiba ya ugonjwa huu.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: In 1995, he worked with WHO in implementing detection protocols and control measures in the first documented urban outbreak of Ebola in Kikwit, DR of Congo.
swa: Mwaka 1995, alifanya kazi na WHO kwa ajili ya utekelezaji wa mradi wa he worked with WHO in implementing  utambuzi mbinu za kukabiliana na ugonjwa huu mara baada ya kuripotiwa kwa mara ya kwanza wagonjwa wa Ebola katika mji wa Kikwit, Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya  Congo.
mt0: In 1995, he worked with WHO in implementing the identification strategies for the fight against the disease after the first cases of Ebola were reported in Kikwit, Democratic Republic of Congo.

en: Professor Muyembe-Tamfum (seated with the microphone) speaking at a public education event in Beni, North Kivu, DR of Congo, in September 2018.
swa: Professor Muyembe-Tamfum (aliyekaa akiwa na kipaza sauti) akiongea wakati wa zoezi la utoaji elimu kwa jamii huko Beni, Kivu ya Kaskazini, Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya Congo,  mapema mwezi Septemba 2018.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. Professor Muyembe-Tamfum (sitting with a speaker) speaking during a community education program in Beni, North Kivu, Democratic Republic of Congo, early September 2018.

en: With this discovery, people infected with Ebola will now have more trust in the possibility of recovery and will be more likely to go to the hospital for treatment.

mt0: After this discovery, the Ebola patients have a greater chance of getting immediate medical care and being transported to hospital for more treatment where they are still alive.

en: Now that 90 percent of their patients can go into the treatment center and come out completely cured, they will start believing it and building trust in the population and community.
swa: Kwa kiwa asilimia 90 ya wagonjwa wataweza kufikishwa kwenye vituo vya afya na kupata matibabu na kurejea wakiwa wazima kabisa, watanza kuiamini dawa hii na kujenga imani kwa jamii zao na wananchi wote kwa ujumla.
mt0: If 90% of patients can be treated and return to their normal state, they will begin to believe this medicine and to build faith in their communities and in the whole nation.

en: However, the most devastating cases occurred between March and June 2016 in three countries: Sierra Leone: over 14,000 cases and about 4,000 deaths; Liberia: about 10,000 cases and 3,000 deaths; Guinea:  3,800 cases and 2,500 deaths.

en: The global narrative on Ebola

en: Ebola's ravaging of African countries generated global panic and hysteria in 2015 when two patients died in the United States and one each in Spain and Germany.
swa: Ugonjwa wa Ebola ulioleta madhara makubwa katika nchi za Kiafrika ulizua taharuki na hofu mwaka 2015 pale wagonjwa wawili wa ebola waliporipotiwa kufariki nchini Marekani, mmoja Hispania na mwingine Ujerumani.
mt0: Ebola, which has caused huge damage to African countries, caused panic and fear in 2015 when two cases of the disease were reported in the United States, one in Hispania and the other in Germany.

en: GabyFleur Böl, a researcher at the Federal Institute for Risk Assessment in Berlin, Germany, identified other cases in Spain, Germany, the UK, Italy and Switzerland.
swa: GabyFleur Böl, mtafiti katika Taasisi ya Tathmini ya Majanga ya jijini Berlin, Germany,  aliripoti  taarifa nyingine za wagonjwa wa Ebola katika nchi za Hispania, Ujerumani, Uingereza, Italia na Switzerland.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know. GabyFleur Böl, a research researcher at the Berlin disaster assessment center, Germany, reported other cases of Ebola in Spain, Germany, England, Italy and Switzerland.

en: At that time, an Ebola infection was considered a death sentence due to the lack of an effective treatment.
swa: Kwa wakati huo, maambukizi ya Ebola yalichukuliwa kama hukumu ya kifo kutokana na ukosefu wa matibabu yenye tija.
mt0: At that time, Ebola infections were considered a death penalty due to lack of effective treatment.

en: As  Böl asserted, the high mortality rate of Ebola and also the sometimesexaggerated media coverage of the epidemic created hysteria around the world.
swa: Kama Böl alivyotangulia kusema, kasi kubwa ya vifo vinavyotokana na ugonjwa wa Ebola na  na pia /a> wakati mwingine taarifa za upotoshaji kupitia vyombo vya habari kuhusu Ebola zilichangia kuibua hofu duniani kote.
mt0: As Böl said, the huge increase in deaths from Ebola and sometimes false reports from media about Ebola have contributed to the spread of fear around the world.

en: This position was further corroborated by a 2017 study in which Hal Roberts, Brittany Seymour, Sands Alden Fish II, Emily Robinson and Ethan Zuckerman analyzed over 109,000 stories published in US mainstream/regional media and blogs between July to November 2014, with a focus on Ebola coverage.
swa: Taarifa kama hizi zilichangiwa pia na 2017  utafiti ambao Hal Roberts, Brittany Seymour, Sands Alden Fish II, Emily Robinson na Ethan Zuckerman  walichambua  Zaidi ya makala 109,000 zilizochapishwa kwenye vyombo vikubwa vya habari na blogu nchini Marekani kati ya mwezi Julai na Novemba 2014, kiini cha uchambuzi kikiwa ni habari zilizohusu ugojwa wa Ebola.
mt0: If you cannot translate this sentence simply say you don't know.

en: They discovered that three distinct peaks in Ebola coverage in the United States media and blogs occurred around July 27, September 28, and 15 October 2014:
swa: Waligundua nyakati kuu tatu kuhusu habari za ugonjwa wa Ebola katika vyombo vikubwa vya habari na blogu nchini Marekani zilitokea Julai 27, Septemba 28, na  Octoba 15 mwaka 2014:
mt0: They found three major cases of Ebola reporting in major media and blogs in the United States in the period between July 27, September 28, and October 15, 2014:

en: On July 27, reports broke of the first infections of American doctors in Liberia.
swa: Tarehe 27 Julai, iliripotiwa kwa mara ya kwanza kuwa madaktari kutoka Marekani wanaohudumu nchini Liberia waliambukizwa ugonjwa wa Ebola.
mt0: On July 27, it was first reported that American doctors working in Liberia were infected with Ebola.

en: On September 30, media widely reported the infection of Thomas Duncan in Texas as the first infection on US soil.
swa: Tarehe 30 On Septemba, vyombo vya habari viliripoti kwa mapana kuhusu Thomas Duncan kuugua ugonjwa wa Ebola huko Texas na ikiwa ndio mara ya kwanza ugonjwa huo kuripotiwa nchini Marekani.
mt0: On September 30, the media reported a detailed report of Thomas Duncan being ill with Ebola in Texas, which was the first time the disease was reported in the United States.

en: On October 12, Ebola coverage intensified with the first infection of a health care worker in the United States.
swa: Mwezi Oktoba tarehe 12, taarifa za mgonjwa wa Ebola ambaye ni ambaye ni mtoa huduma za afya zilisambamba kwa kina nchini Marekani.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know On October 12, the reports of an Ebola patient who is a health care provider in the United States were mixed.

en: After October 12, a series of other US infection-related events led to continuous coverage that gradually lessened in intensity over time.
swa: Baada ya tarehe 12 Oktoba,matuko mengine ya mlipo wa Ebola yaliripotiwa mfululizo hali iliyopelekea utipotiwaji wake kufifia siku hadi siku.
mt0: After the 12th of October,another cases of Ebola were reported which led to the reduction of its reported cases.

en: US media may have covered Ebola so intensively because of the presence of the disease in the US.

en: In addition, with a more interconnected army of digital networks, the Ebola epidemic became more amplified in Europe and the US.

mt0: Also, due to the ease of spreading information through social media, the Ebola virus has become a topic of discussion in European and American media.

en: However, what remains to be seen is if the discovery of a cure by an African from DR of Congo to this African epidemic will also garner as much coverage as it did in 2017.
swa: Hata hivyo, kinachosubiriwa ni kuona ikiwa taarifa za dawa ya kutibu ugonjwa wa Ebola iliyogunduliwa na Mwafrika kutoka Jamhuri ya Kidemokrasia ya Congo inayotibu gonjwa hili la Kiafrika itapewa nafasi kwenye vyombo vya habari kama ilivyokuwa mwaka 2017.
mt0: But, what is waiting is to see if the announcement of the Ebola cure developed by a Congolese man who claims to be able to treat the African disease will be given a significant coverage in the media as it was in 2017.

en: On July 29, six plainclothes policemen forcefully removed journalist Erick Kabendera from his home in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania, and took him into police custody.

en: Police say Kabendera had failed to obey a summons to investigate the status of his Tanzanian citizenship.

en: Over the last week, police searched Kabenderas home twice, confiscated his passport and other personal documents and interrogated his family.

en: By August 5, authorities switched track, charging Kabendera with money laundering, tax evasion in the amount of $75,000 United States dollars, and criminal racketeering, according to a copy of the charge sheet obtained by the Committee to Protect Journalists.

en: Jebra Kambole, Kabenderas lawyer, says authorities also accused Kabendera of sedition for allegedly publishing an article titled John Magufuli is bulldozing Tanzanias freedom, in The Economist, but this charge was later dropped.

mt0: Jebra Kambole, a lawyer for Kabendera, says, the charges also struck Kabendera for remarks against the government in a article he published in the Economist, which claimed that John Magufuli is undermining the freedom of press in Tanzania. However, these charges were dropped later.

en: Hungarian pro-government media outlets have launched new attacks against Blanka Nagy, a high school student who has spoken out against the government at several protests since late 2018.
swa: Vyombo vya habari vinavyoiunga serikali ya Hungary mkono vimeanza mashambulizi mapya dhidi ya Blanka Nagy, mwanafunzi wa shule ya upili ambaye alizungumza vibaya dhidi ya serikali katika maandamano kadhaa tangu mwisho mwa mwaka 2018.
mt0: The Hungarian media have started a new attack on Blanka Nagy, a schoolgirl who has been speaking against the government in several protests since the end of 2018.

en: Nagy has endured criticism of her intellect and even sexual harassment, with one outlet calling her a whore.
swa: Nagy anavumilia ukosoaji mwingi dhidi yake na pia amedhalilishwa kijinsia na chanzo kimoja cha habari kimemuita kahaba.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: She has already filed and won defamation cases against three pro-government outlets that claimed she was failing in school: Lokál, Ripost, and Origo.
swa: Tayari ameshafungua kesi ya kudhalilishwa na kushinda kesi dhidi ya vyombo vitatu Lokàl, Ripost na Origo ambayo vinavyoiunga mkono serikali, vilisema kuwa alikuwa akifeli shuleni.
mt0: He has already filed a complaint of bullying and won a case against three media organizations, Lokàl, Ripost and Origo, which claimed he was failing school.

en: However, after Nady won her case against Origo, the outlet launched another attack, publishing her school reports.
swa: Hata hivyo, baada ya Nady kushinda kesi dhidi ya Origo, chanzo hicho kilimshambulia tena kwa kuchapisha ripoti yake ya shule.
mt0: But after Nady won the case against Origo, the source again attacked her by publishing her school report.

en: Nagy told Atlatszo that she is considering suing Origo again over these latest stories.
swa: Nady aliwaambia Atlatszo kuwa alikuwa anafikiria kuwashtaki Origo tena kwa sababu ya habari zao za hivi karibu.
mt0: Nady told Atlatszo that she was considering suing Origo again for their recent reports.

en: Blanka Nagy became well-known in Hungary last winter after she gave a speech at an anti-government rally, in which she criticized prominent politicians using foul language.
swa: Blanka Nagy amekuwa maarufu nchini Hungary katika majira ya baridi yaliyopita baada ya kutoa hotuba katika maandamano ya kuipinga serikali, ambapo alikosoa wanasiasa maarufu, huku akitumia lugha kali.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: Her harsh words resonated with many social media users and a video of her speech went viral.
swa: Maneno yake makali yalisambazwa na watumiaji wa mitandao ya kijamii kupitia video ya hotuba yake.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: About two months after her video became a social media sensation, the pro-government media and pundits such as Zsolt Bayer launched a series of attacks against her.
swa: Miezi miwili baada ya video yake kuvuta hisia katika mitandao ya kijamii, vyombo vinavyoiunga serikali mkono na Wanazuoni kama vile Zsolt Bayer walianzisha mfululizo wa mashambulizi dhidi yake.
mt0: After two months of his video being shared on social media, government-backed organizations and academics such as Zsolt Bayer began a series of attacks against him.

en: Pro-government outlets claimed that she was failing many of her subjects in school and that she had missed many days of school.
swa: Vyombo hivyo vilisema kuwa alikuwa akifeli masomo yake mengi na pia alikuwa amekosa siku nyingi za masomo.
mt0: The authorities said that he was failing his classes and had missed many school days.

en: They also called her an untalented wannabe actress and a whore.
swa: Pia walimuita asiye na kipaji anayetaka kuwa maarufu na kahaba.
mt0: They also called him a lazy man who wanted to be famous and a liar.

en: Her attorney filed copies of her academic transcript with the court to prove that she is not failing her classes  and thus the school transcripts became available for attorneys of Origo.
swa: Wakili wake alifikisha nakala ya matokeo yake mahakamani na kuonesha kuwa hakuwa anafeli katika masomo yake na pia nakala hizo za matokeo walipewa mawakili wa Origo.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: The outlet decided to publish data from her transcripts, claiming that Nagy almost failed history last term and is on the verge of failing in a few other subjects as well.
swa: Chanzo hicho cha habari kiliamua kuchapisha taarifa kutoka katika ripoti ya matokeo ya Nagy na kusema kuwa alikaribia kufeli somo la Historia muhula uliopita na pia yupo katika hati hati ya kufeli masomo mengine pia.
mt0: The source decided to publish a report from the results report of Nagy and said that he was about to fail History last year and is also in a serious threat of failing other subjects.

en: Since mass protests against president Daniel Ortega erupted in Nicaragua in April 2018, the government has banned demonstrations, arrested thousands without trial, and shut down both alternative and mainstream media outlets.
swa: Tangu maandamano makubwa dhidi ya Rais Daniel Ortega yalipuke nchini Nicaragua Aprili 2018, serikali imepiga marufuku maandamano, imewakamata maelfu bila kuwafungulia mashtaka na kufungia kwa pamoja vyanzo vikuu na vile mbadala vya habari.
mt0: Since the massive protests against President Daniel Ortega erupted in Nicaragua in April 2018, the government has banned protests, arrested thousands without charge and blocked major and alternative media outlets.

en: As attempts at dialogue have so far failed, the future of Nicaragua remains an open question.
swa: Majaribio ya kufanya mazungumzo yameshindikana,  kwa sasa hatma ya Nicaragua imebaki kuwa swali gumu.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know. The negotiations have failed, and the future of Nicaragua is still a difficult question.

en: The demonstrations were originally against a social security reform that would raise income taxes while reducing pension benefits.
swa: Maandamano yalianza kwa kupinga mabadiliko ya sera za mifuko ya hifadhi za jamii ambapo yangepandisha makato ya kodi ya mapato wakati ikipunguza maslahi ya kiinua mgongo.
mt0: The protests began by opposing the changes to the policies of the social security funds which would increase taxes on incomes while reducing benefits.

en: The initial crackdown by the authorities paved the way for a nationwide call for the resignation of President Daniel Ortega and first lady and Vice-President Rosario Murillo.
swa: Mwanzoni mchakato huo ulifanywa na mamlaka ulifungua mlango wa maandamano ya nchi nzima yakimtaka Rais Daniel Ortega, mkewe na Makamu wa Rais Rosario Murillo wajiuzulu.
mt0: The process was initiated by the government and opened the door for protests across the country calling for the resignation of President Daniel Ortega, his wife and the Vice President Rosario Murillo.

en: Figures given for the protests death toll vary, and have not been updated since last year as barriers to documentation efforts increase.
swa: Takwimu za vifo vilivyotokana na maandamano hayo yanapishana na hayajahuishwa tangu mwaka jana kwa sababu vikwazo dhidi ya uwekaji wa taarifa na kumbukumbu umeongezeka.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: In December 2018 the government closed down several NGOs that were keeping track of police violence and human rights abuses, including the Nicaraguan Center for Human Rights (Cenidh) and the Institute for the Development of Democracy (Ipade).
swa: Disemba 2018 serikali iilizifungia baadhi ya NGO ambazo zilikuwa zikifuatilia kwa karibu vurugu za polisi na uvunjaji wa Haki za Binadamu ikiwepo kituo cha Haki za Binadamu cha Nicaragua (Cenidh) na Taasisi ya Maendeleo ya Demokrasia (Ipade).
mt0: In December 2018, the government closed down some NGOs that were monitoring the police violence and human rights violations, including the Center for Human Rights in Nicaragua (Cenidh) and the Institute for Democracy Development (Ipade).

en: Also in December, two groups set up by the Inter-American Commission for Human Rights (IACHR)the Special Follow-up Mechanism for Nicaragua (MESENI) and the Interdisciplinary Group of Independent Expertswere expelled from the country, leaving Nicaragua virtually without independent human rights observers and opening a new stage in the repression, according to Nicaraguan feminist activist and educator María Teresa Blandón.
swa: Pia Disemba hiyo, vikundi viwili vya Kamisheni ya Haki za Binadamu Ndani ya Amerika (IACHR)Mpango Maalumu wa Kuratibu Ufuatiliaji Nicaragua (MESENI) na Kikundi cha Wanazuoni Huru wa Fani Mbalimbaliwalifukuzwa kutoka nchini, na kuiacha Nicaragua bila chombo huru cha kusimamia Haki za Binadamu na kufungua hatua mpya ya unyanyasaji, hii ni kulingana na Mwanaharakati wa haki za Wanawake na Muelimishaji María Teresa Blandón.
mt0: In December, two groups of the United States Human Rights Commission (USHC) Special Investigations Program for Nicaragua (MESENI) and the Freedom of Information Group (FGI) were also expelled from the country, leaving Nicaragua without a free agency to monitor human rights and opening new steps of violence, according to the activist for women and a researcher María Teresa Blandón.

en: Read more: We are victims who assist victims': Documenting human rights violations in Nicaragua

mt0: More: We are the victims who help the victims': Nicaraguan activists describe the violation of human rights

mt0: But the Human Rights Organization has reported 322 deaths until September 18, 2018, which mostly were killed by shootings in the head, neck and shoulder.

mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Demonstrators increasingly engaged in more violent methods and confrontations, which resulted in the death of 22 police officers as of August 2018, according to government data.
swa: Waandamanaji walizidi kujihusisha na vurugu na mapigano na kufikia Agosti 2018 vilikuwa vimetokea vifo 22 vya maafisa wa polisi, na hii ni kulingana na takwimu za serikali..
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: In mid-2018, the police deployed the so-called operación limpieza (clean-up operation) to dismantle barricades and prosecute suspected participants.
swa: Katikati ya 2018, polisi walianzisha walichokiita operación limpieza (Operesheni ya kusafisha) kuharibu vizuizi na kuwashtaki watuhumiwa walioshukiwa kujihusisha navyo.
mt0: In 2018, police launched what they called "Operation Cleansing" to remove barriers and prosecute suspected suspects.

en: Reports say that law enforcement acted in cooperation with paramilitary groups.
swa: Taarifa zinasema kuwa vyombo vya usalama vilifanya hivyo vikishirikiana na Vikundi vya wanamgambo.
mt0: Reports say that security forces did this in collaboration with militant groups.

en: Many students, leaders of peasant movements, rights defenders and journalists were targeted in smear campaigns and persecuted, and some were charged with terrorism.
swa: Wanafunzi wengi, viongozi wa harakati za wakulima, wapigania haki na wanahabari walilengwa katika kampeni hiyo hatari na wengi wao wameshtakiwa.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. Many students, farmers' leaders, activists and journalists were targeted in this dangerous campaign and many of them have been charged.

en: Even health professionals who treated people injured in the riots suffered consequences.
swa: Na baadhi ya watumishi wa afya waliohudumia majeruhi wakati wa maandamano wamepata misukosuko kwa kile walichokifanya.
mt0: Some health workers who took care of the injured during the protest have been struck by their actions.

en: The Nicaraguan Medical Association said at least 240 such professionals were fired from public hospitals and clinics in retaliation.
swa: Chama cha Madaktari wa Nicaragua wamesema kuwa angalau madaktari 240  walifukuzwa kazi katika hospitali za umma kama njia ya kuwakomoa.
mt0: Nicaraguan Doctors' Association says that at least 240 doctors were fired from public hospitals as a way to suppress them.

en: Read more: Nicaraguan protesters and journalists face violent attacks on the streets and online
swa: Soma zaidi: Waandamanaji wa Nicaragua na waandishi wa habari wakumbana na mashambulizi makali mitaani na kwenye mitandao.
mt0: More: Nicaraguan demonstrators and journalists have been attacked in the streets and on social media.

en: In September, protests were made essentially illegal, as all street activities now require advance permission from the authorities, which is often denied.
swa: Hapo Septemba maandamano yalifanywa kuwa sio halali tena, na shughuli zozote kwa sasa katika mitaa zinahitaji kibali maalum kutoka kwa mamlaka, ambapo mara nyingi vibali hivyo hukataliwa..
mt0: Since September, protests have been banned, and any activity in the streets now requires special permission from the government, which often refuses.

en: On February 27, 2019, dialogue was resumed between the government and the opposition party, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Civic Alliance for Justice and Democracy), following the release of a hundred people from prison.
swa: Hapo Februari 27, 2019, meza ya  mazungumzo ilirejelewa kati ya serikali na chama cha upinzani, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Muungano wa Haki na Demokrasia kwa Raia), ikifuatiwa na kuachiliwa huru kwa mamia ya watu kutoka gerezani.
mt0: When the government and the opposition started talks on February 27, 2019, the negotiating table was reopened between the government and the opposition, Alianza Cívica por la Justicia y la Democracia (Citizens' Union for Justice and Democracia), followed by the release of hundreds of people from prison.

en: Unlike previous attempts at dialogue, however, this one did not include leaders of peasant movements and students, as some of them are incarcerated, and others are in exile.
swa: Ukilinganisha na mazungumzo ya kipindi kilichopita, kikao hiki hakikujumuisha viongozi wa harakati za wakulima na wanafunzi, kwa sababu baadhi yao wako kifungoni, na wengine wapo uhamishoni.
mt0: Compared to the previous meetings, this meeting did not include farmers and students leaders, because some of them are in prison, and others are in exile.

en: Not just a new president a new beginning
swa: Sio Rais mpya pekeeni mwanzo mpya
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.

en: As the country's crisis enters its second year, the urgency and anxiety about Nicaragua's future is conveyed through the hashtag #SOSNicaragua, which is deployed daily in conjunction with allegations, pictures of victims and accounts of students in prison and their families.
swa: Kwa kuwa mgogoro huu wa nchi unaingia mwaka wa pili sasa, wahka na wasiwasi wa kesho ya Nicaragua umebebwa na hashtagi #SOSNicaragua, ambayo hutolewa kila siku pamoja na madai, picha za waathirika na vilio juu ya wanafunzi walio magerezani na familia zao.
mt0: Since this conflict has entered its second year, the fears and fears of Nicaragua's tomorrow have been emphasized by the hashtag #SOSNicaragua, which is released every day with petitions, pictures of the victims and voices of the students in prison and their families.

en: Read more: Nicaragua's diaspora activists bear a double burden
swa: Soma zaidi: Wanaharakati wa Diaspora wa Nicaragua wabeba mzigo mara mbili
mt0: More: The Diaspora Nicaraguans carry a heavy container twice. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Nicaraguan news outlet Niú interviewed Nicaraguans who held a protest in February in neighboring Costa Rica, and they shared accounts of the difficulties of life in exile.
swa: Chanzo cha habari cha Nicaragua, Niú waliwahoji waandamanaji walioongoza maandano ya Februari katika maeneo ya jirani na Costa Rica na walielezea ugumu wa maisha waliyo nayo huko uhamishoni.
mt0: The Nicaraguan news agency, Niú, interviewed the protesters who led the Feburary protests in the border areas of Costa Rica and explained the difficulties they had in their exilation.

en: Alejandro Donaire, a student who says he fled the country after participating in a peaceful protest, told Niú how difficult it was to feel part of a functioning society in a normal life, after spending so much time hiding, fleeing or protesting.
swa: Alejandro Donaire, mwanafunzi alisema kuwa alikimbia nchini baada ya kushiriki maandamano ya amani, aliiambia Niú jinsi ilivyo vigumu kujisikia kuwa sehemu ya jamii na maisha ya kawaida, baada ya kutumia muda mrefu kwa  kuishi kwa kujificha, kukimbia na kuandamana.
mt0: Alejandro Donaire, a student who says he fled the country after participating in peace protests, told Niú how it was difficult to feel a part of the community and normal life after a long period of living in hiding, running and protesting.

en: Madelaine Caracas, spokesperson of the student group known as the Student Coordination for Democracy, also shared with Niú her aspirations for transformation in Nicaragua, which go beyond Ortega's departure:
swa: Madelaine Caracas, msemaji wa kikundi cha wanafunzi kinachofahamika kama Ushirikiano wa Wanafunzi kwa Demokrasia, pia alishirikisha Niú kiu yake ya kutaka kuona mabadiliko ya Nicaragua ambayo yatakuwa ni zaidi ya Ortega kuondoka:
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Madelaine Caracas, a spokesperson for the student group called Students' Cooperation for Democracy, also shared Niú her desire to see Nicaraguan changes that would be more than Ortega's departure:

en: [We need to] eradicate authoritarianism, sexism, personal autocracy and other ills that have penetrated the political culture of the country.
swa: [Tunataka] kuuondoa udikteta, ukandamizaji wa kijinsia, ubinafsi na madhaifu mengine ambayo yamejipenyeza katika utamaduni wa siasa za nchi.
mt0: We want to remove democracy, sexual harassment, isolationism and other weaknesses that have become embedded in the culture of the country's politics.

en: We believe more than ever that Ortega will leave this year [] that I will return to Nicaragua this year.
swa: Tunaamini zaidi kuwa Ortega ataondoka mwaka huu na kwamba nitarudi Nicaragua mwaka huu.
mt0: We are more confident that Ortega will leave this year and that I will return to Nicaragua this year.

en: And I have the certainty because Ortega is out of air internationally and economically; and also because those who participated in the uprising last April are now more organized than ever.
swa: Na nina hakika kwa sababu Ortega kwa sasa hasikiki katika anga za kimataifa na za kiuchumi na pia kwa sababu wale wote walioshiriki maandamano ya Aprili wamejiandaa kikamilifu kwa sasa.
mt0: I'm sure because Ortega is not visible in international and economic circles and because all of the people who participated in the April protests are fully prepared now.

en: This last round of dialogues between government and opposition came to an end on April 3, with agreements reached on two of the four topics discussed.
swa: Raundi hii ya mwisho ya mazungumzo kati ya Serikali na upinzani ilifikia mwisho Aprili 3, kukiwa na makubaliano katika mada mbili kati ya nne zilizojadiliwa.
mt0: If you can't translate this last round of talks simply say you don't know.

en: The government has pledged, firstly, to release all political prisoners and, secondly, to respect civil liberties.
swa: Kwanza serikali imeahidi kuwa, itawaachia huru wafungwa wote wa kisiasa na pili itaheshimu uhuru wa raia.
mt0: First, the government has promised that it will free all political prisoners and secondly that it will respect the rights of the people.

en: There were no agreements made regarding justice for the victims of violence or the expediting of the 2021 elections.
swa: Hapakuwepo na  makubaliano yoyote yaliyofanywa kuhusu haki kwa wahanga wa vurugu za uchaguzi au kujinadi kwa ajili ya uchaguzi wa 2021.
mt0: There has been no agreement on the rights of victims of voter violence or candidate for the 2021 election.

en: Opposition group Civic Alliance pointed out, however, that the government has so far failed to honor the agreements.
swa: Kikundi cha upinzani cha Muungano wa Kiraia ulisema kuwa, hata hivyo serikali imeshindwa kabisa kuheshimu makubaliano hayo.
mt0: The opposition group Civil Union said that, however, the government has failed to fully respect the agreements.

en: Police repression of peaceful protests has reportedly continued.
swa: Imeendelea kuripotiwa kuwa, Polisi  wameendelea kuvuruga maandamano ya amani .
mt0: It is reported that police continue to break up demonstrations of peace . If you cannot translate it simply say you don't know .

en: As of April 6, only 50 out of over 600 political prisoners had been released, and those that were were placed under house arrest.
swa: Kama ilivyokuwa April 6, ni wafungwa 50 pekee kati ya wafungwa wa kisiasa 600 walioachiliwa huru, na waliowekwa katika vizuizi majumbani mwao.
mt0: As of April 6, only 50 of the 600 political prisoners were released, and were placed in quarantine in their homes.

en: Later, on April 17, following new threats of sanctions from the United States, over 600 prisoners were released to complete their sentences under house arrest, though but according to Civic Alliance, only 18 members of the group were on the list of political prisoners they had hoped to see out of jail.
swa: Baadaye hapo April 17, kufuatia kitisho kipya cha kuwekewa vikwazo na Marekani, zaidi ya wafungwa 600 waliachiliwa huru na kwenda kumalizia vifungo vyao katika vizuizi vya nyumbani, hata hivyo kulingana na Muungano wa Kiraia, ni wanachama 18 pekee wa kikundi hicho waliokuwa katika orodha ya wafungwa wa kisiasa waliokuwa na tumaini la kuachiliwa huru.
mt0: After the threat of sanctions from the United States, more than 600 prisoners were released and went back to their prisons, but according to the Civil Union, only 18 of the prisoners were on the list of political prisoners who were hopeful of being released.

en: In the minds of people like activist and researcher Felix Madariaga, the new leaders of Nicaragua's future remain in prison today.
swa: Katika fikra za watu kama vile Mwanaharakati na mtafiti Felix Madariaga, kiongozi mpya wa Kesho ya Nicaragua amebaki gerezani leo.
mt0: In the minds of people like Felix Madariaga, a former activist and researcher, the new leader of the Nicaraguan Tomorrow has been kept in prison today.

en: Meanwhile, opposition groups are calling for protests commemorating the anniversary of the events of April 2018.
swa: Wakati huo huo, vikundi vya upinzani vimeitisha  maandamano ya kuadhimisha kumbukumbu ya  matukio ya Aprili 2018.
mt0: At the same time, opposition groups have called for a protest to mark the anniversary of April 2018 events.

en: With the refusal of authorities to grant permission to the demonstration, new police crackdowns are anticipated.
swa: Kukiwa na katazo toka kwa mamlaka na zuio la kibali dhidi ya maandamano hayo, pia inatarajiwa kuwa kutakuwepo na ukandamizaji mpya kutoka kwa polisi.
mt0: If you cannot translate simply say you don't know.
